story:
In the wake of devastating environmental disasters I started to wonder if the earth was using water to communicate outrage for our total disregard for its wellbeing. I also began to wonder if we would ever listen. 71% of the earth’s surface is covered by water. Yet more than 1 billion people do not have access to clean water and as a result 5 million die every year from preventable water-related diseases. How bad does it have to get for our priorities to shift? And, can art have an impact on how we get there?

I’m Christine Destrempes, Founder and Director of Art for Water, an initiative to raise awareness of the shrinking availability of clean water through the creation of public-participation art installations. We want to start an international exchange about water through art.

Art for Water’s most popular program is Stream of Conscience, a monumental, site-specific literary sculpture that has grown, morphed, and traveled across the U.S. The sculpture is made out of torn pieces of paper upon which people write thoughts, feelings, or reflections about water. The pieces of paper are then used to create a river of words – a multitude of voices, young and old, reflecting on the importance of water, the inspiration it provides, and our responsibility to protect it.

This sculpture has been growing for 3 years. Since water knows no boundaries and water scarcity is a national as well as global crisis, we want the Stream of Conscience to reach a wider audience. Physically taking this project over an ocean or a continent poses significant logistical challenges, so we’re going virtual.

The virtual Stream will take a public-participation art project to a whole new level and turn it into a forum as well as a dynamic exhibition. Through kinetic typographic animation, participants from all over the world can add their creative content to this river of words. The virtual Stream will complement the physical installation during exhibitions, connecting venues and visitors – a creative trade offering a glimpse into the personal expression and motivation of different cultures and backgrounds.

The conceptual foundation of the Stream of Conscience is based on a quote from Thich Nhat Hanh: “We are here to awaken from the illusion of our separateness.” This new global art project creatively dissolves barriers, builds community, and empowers communication about the importance of clean water.

To launch the virtual Stream, we’re raising $20,000 so that we can hire a designer to start creating this dynamic, participatory art exhibition that will keep growing and flowing as more people become involved. Your contribution will enable Art for Water to build and offer a unique cultural art exchange that will raise the status of an essential natural resource. Please support our efforts with a donation in any amount.  And please share this with your friends. We’ve got some great perks for you – from magnets and postcards to broadside posters and original, signed art.

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

The Safe |X Camp Project consists of visual representation of Circa Survive songs (from the Inuit Sessions, to Violent Waves and B-Side tracks). I will be leaving stencil paintings on various mediums (wood panelings, wheatpastes, doors, ETC), with the following: 

                                             CIRCA |X SURVIVE
                                        THE SHRINE EXPO HALL

                                                        LA, CA

                                                       12.28.13


Each piece will be posted on various social media sites (Facebook & Instagram for example) with the title of the song being represented.

The plan is to start leaving these out all throughout Orange County, CA, and make my way closer and closer to the Shrine Expo Hall (which will host Circa Survive's last show of 2013). 

The visual depictions will get bigger and bigger until the final installation finale which will be discussed further when details begin to unfold. Regardless of you being a California resident or a Circa Survive fan, there are plenty of ways to get involved and be part of one of the greatest shows of the year.

This will all take place on the day of the show (December 28th, 2013). I will be in the LA area bright and early, putting up all the pieces throughout the city (ANY HELP IN THIS WILL BE EXTREMELY BENEFICIAL SO IF YOU'RE INTERESTED IN HELPING OUT WITH THROUGHOUT THE DAY, PLEASE SEND ME AN EMAIL SO I CAN ADD YOU TO THE "CIRCONIAN LIST" : ERIKELIOTHEREDIA@GMAIL.COM


The Perks of Donating to the Project:

.

        BELOW ARE PICTURES OF EACH PERK:


Perk #1: Hand-Written thank you letter ($5)

Perk #2: Heretic Bum Head ($10)

Perk #3: Heretic Circa Survive Album-cover Rendition ($15)

Perk #4: Circa Slaps ($20)

Perk #5: Bundle #1 ($30)

Perk #6: Circa Survive Heretic Cover-art Rendition #2 ($45)

Perk #7: Hertic Tangle Piece ($55)

Perk #8: Heretic Canvas Panel Boards ($65)

Perk #9: Heretic 18x24 Newsprint Piece ($80)

Perk #10: An Original Short Story ($90)

Perk #11: Matted Heretic Piece ($120)

Perk #12: "General Broadcasting System" + Circa Slaps ($130) - ONLY 1 MADE


Perk #13: "Heap of Broken Images" + Circa Slaps ($130) - ONLY 1 MADE

Perk #14: Ultimate Bundle #3 ($250)

Perk #15: Heretic Closet Door ($700)







The Impact

Even if you're not a fan of Circa Survive, you can always support indie artists/art culture. There is so much good art that had a tendency of being under-appreciated each day, that I felt the need to contribute to the rise of an up-and-coming movement. You can support this cause in so many different ways without even spending a dime out of your pocket.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not feel like contributing money, you can always just follow the trend of oral tradition by spreading the link of The Safe Camp Project Indiegogo site. Any potential referral is a good word-of-mouth on my end, so please feel free to spread the word through all of your social networking favorites.

story:
Short Story:

Thank you for the opportunity to share our plight. When it comes to intellectual property there are corporations who continue to suffocate, steal, and abuse artist everywhere. 
 
In our case it is the company Reebok International. Reebok has a long history of ripping off the little guy, so please take a stand with us and support our rights.
Now is the time. 
All we are looking for is to come to terms with a fair agreement with the NFL and Reebok.
 April of 2004 we solicited the National Football League and it's licensee Reebok with a new product idea. Following all Reebok's submittal processes we submitted our pattern pending artwork to Bobby Newton of the new product division of Reebok. 
May 25, 2004 we receive a letter basically telling us they were not interested, so it really took me off guard in 2007 watching a New England Patriots football game to see a fan wearing our creation. 
Stitch for stitch an exact replica of what we termed "TD Headgear"made of a synthetic leather being sold at all the NFL stadiums.
Ours a polar fleece with a fleece lining but everything else was a complete rip off. 
We followed up with a ceased and desist letter to the NFL and Reebok so we could come to terms. 
No response, no not nothing. Reebok to this day is profiting from our works.
We did try to hire a few law firms (pro-bono), with no success. It is my opinion either because Reebok and the NFL are so big, or there was just not going to be enough monies for a larger firm to get involved.
 
What we will do with... Time, monies:
Stand together as artists and fight for our rights no matter how BIG or how small.
The monies received will go towards fininshing up our pattern and trademarks.
Hire a Trademark/Intellectual Property attorney.
Develop a website showcasing our works.
We also plan to have a media blitz to put pressure on Reebok to come to terms.
Hire a law firm to take Reebok to the mat. 
 
How you can participate:
Use the indiegogo share tools to SREAD THE WORD!
Donate - no amount to little or to big.
Go online and voice your outrage and or lodge a complaint to both the NFL and Reebok.
www.nfl.com/contactus
www.shop.reebok/us/content/contactus
Consumercomplaintagency.org
Know any good law firms? LOL
 
It takes a village. We want to acknowledge these artist as well:
Black Biscuit. 
Michael Mullowney (artist especial).
All about Patterns

story:
Hello! This company, Ravenfox Studios LLC, is a small Michigan based art studio. We have been making two dimensional and three dimensional pixel art out of Perler beads for over 6 years now. We take your favorite video game characters, anime characters, or really any image you want and make it in to art work that you can use for a number of decorative uses. We strive every day to make the American dream come true. We struggle to own and run our own business even during this financially difficult time! Just like everyone else though, our costs have gone up and we are doing everything we can to not transfer these one-time fees to our customers.

By contributing to our fundraiser today you will be helping us build our company’s ability to offer newer and better products. We want to buy a smaller bead called mini Hama beads, so that we can make our work more detailed yet still a manageable size and price. Also these beads would allow us to offer the same images we already offer in a variety of new products such as key chains, jewelry, or accessories of many types.

Your donations today would also allow us to continue to take personal commissions at our tables. Many of the conventions or art shows that we sell our pieces at charge us for the electricity needed to run our computers and our iron. Some conventions will charge us over $400 in one weekend. We would like to take some of this seed money to buy a battery system that will allow us to run our electronics without having to pay such lavish charges.

The money given to us here on this site will also help us to save our places at future conventions. Most art shows require that you pay for your table space months ahead of the actual event date. In previous years we have been able to meet these obligations without issue. We would just pay the money forward out of our personal accounts. With the rising rates of the selling spaces, gasoline, and many other costly aspects of our business, we can no longer afford to pay out of pocket until after the convention.

Your donations will help us to have a future! This money will insure that this business stays in operation. It will help to preserve a type of art work. The funds raised here today will help dreams come true and lives be more fulfilling.

Donate today to help support your local artists , donate to help support small businesses, donate to help keep the American dream alive.

We have estimated that we need $2000 seed money to help to improve this business. Right now we're starting small trying to raise money for our battery! For every donation you will receive a gift!

Donation

Gift

$1

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

$5

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of select pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

$10

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of select pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

  • A coupon for 10% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$15

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of an even bigger selection of pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

  • A coupon for 10% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$20

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of an even bigger selection of pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

  • A coupon for 10% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$25

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of an even bigger selection of pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

  • A 10% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$50

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of our biggest selection of pieces of art work mailed to you. Choices

  • A coupon for 25% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$75

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of our biggest selection of pieces of art work mailed to you (any of the previous tiers) – this selection also featuring our 3D pieces!

  • A coupon for 25% off of entire purchase off of our website!

$100

  • Publicly listed on our Thank You Page on our web site.

  • One of your choice of our biggest selection of pieces of art work mailed to you – this selection also featuring our 3D pieces or your own commission sized at 60 pixels by 90 pixels.

  • A coupon for 25% off of entire purchase off of our website!

We have an excellent track record as a business. We have nearly always made back what it costs us to go to a convention. Though the prices for a lot of different parts cost us more every event. That is why we need to expand our business. This fundraiser is good for us, the people who own this business, to help us to finance our business without risking our personal homes and families. The money will help, on a miniscule level, the economy in Michigan, and in the United States.

Every little bit counts even if it's $1! But if you find you can't financially help but would like to help us out please share this with your friends on facebook, tumble, twitter, or anywhere else. We appreciate any little bit!

story:
Cerebrah! will be a Premier Social Network designed for the  intellectual and creative community of planet Earth! Due to a lack of Self-Expression provided by the multitude of social networks, Cerebrah!'s entire plan is to grant that gift back to the internet. Combining all the features provided on the multitude of social networks (twitter,facebook, linkedin etc etc), Cerebrah! will create an easy to navigate site that gives you the bread and butter (and a little extra) to make your social Experience a good one and one full of adventure and inspiration.

So do you use social media site and have some interest in things, other than the norm? Do you have activities, even passive things like reading and thinking, that you want to share with the world and a new circle friends. Then help us build Cerebrah!.

Features

-the site will promote all artist and users who have popularity

-The site's directors will be active in the art world sure to keep people informed

-The site will give users the ability to customize their sites as they would their own blogs or websites

-The users will be able to create articles/post as you would in a blog

-Our site will ofcourse have the same features as the top social sites, including newsfeeds, instant messaging, an inbox and etc.

-It will also encourage you to engage in challenges and games with other users to encourage your progress in your specific field of creativity

-Cerebrah will also a unique proximity based news feed allowing users to see the post of other users in a certain radius of their location. ( ofcourse this feature can be turned on and off)

-Cerebrah's purpose is to push it's users and create inspiration for all!!

 Cause

Please Help us try and shift the power of social network to developing and inspiring internet users. Cerebrah's goal is to be a social network in which creative and intellectual behaviour not just the random narcisstic behaviour that social media users are forced with today!

Help us spark an online renaissnce. <3 

We've got some great rewards and they're all really worth it! As well as being for a great cause! 

if you cannot Contribute please simply share our indiegogo and let the world know, so that we can encourage a new more colourful one!

story:
WHAT IS THE BELTWAY POETRY SLAM?
The Beltway Poetry Slam is DC’s newest competitive poetry event and takes place the last Tuesday of every month at The Fridge in DC (Click here for more info!). Beltway started just under a year ago in August 2010 and has already become an integral part of the DC arts scene, bringing new and seasoned poets to the stage, featuring award winning talent from across the country and gaining the attention of local media and arts organizations. Due to our popularity locally, we were able to quickly gain national recognition, becoming a certified venue through Poetry Slam, Inc. and sending a representative to compete in the 2011 Women of the World Poetry Slam (placing 17th in the world!).  We are now gearing up to send a team to the National Poetry Slam and need your help. EVERY CENT COUNTS!

 

WHO ARE THESE HOODLUMS AND WHY DO THEY NEED MY MONEY?
These four strapping young gents make up the Beltway Poetry National Slam team (from left- Joseph LMS, Chris August, Twain Dooley, Drew Law). They will be competing against 64 other slam teams from across the nation in August in Boston/ Cambridge. They are a mix of veteran and freshman poets who represent the amazing and diverse work coming out of DC right now. Sending a team of this caliber to Nationals will put The Beltway Poetry Slam on the map, gain the attention of acclaimed poets who will want to feature at our venue and give us the foundation we need to succeed well into the future. But getting there is not cheap! Our campaign goal of $1,500 will help greatly in covering the high cost of registration, lodging for 6 nights, travel and the costs of getting a team ready for competition.

Please take a moment to think about the impact that the Beltway Poetry Slam community has had on you.  Whether you have attended one show, have friends who are involved or on the team or have been a loyal groupie from the start, we value anything you are able to give at this time.  We have been able to keep the cost of our monthly show low (only $5!!) despite it costing nearly 30 times that to put on a show each month because we believe in being a welcoming space for everyone in the community. If you have the capacity to give at this time, even at the cost of entry to one show, it will make an impact on getting to our goal!

Gifts at all levels are greatly greatly appreciated! 
Questions? beltwayslam@gmail.com

story:
Reviews

Office Supply Geek  8/8/12

"....Nicer alternative to paper clips....definitely an excellent option to spruce up a package of materials like a presentation, resume/cover letter package, or invitations to an event."

Quo Vadis Blog  8/7/12

" ...a smart and stylish alternative to what we get at Staples. In an era where personalization is key, why not clips!. I love my "KD" clips - it makes the document mine in a unique way."

Inkophile - Pen & Ink Blog  8/3/12 

"Regular paper clips lack any air of style. Supra Clips leaves the ordinary clip by the wayside.“

 

About This Project

Over time, there has been little innovation in the field of paper clips and staples.
In August 2011, The Wall Street Journal, published an article asking:
Can You Build A Better Paper Clip?

We have.

Supra Clips represent an advancement over traditional staples and paper clips
by incorporating personalized design with superior function. They not only hold
papers together…they capture attention and enhance document presentation by
elegantly securing papers in perfect alignment. Our American made product is
also environmentally friendly. Manufactured in aluminum. Reusable and recyclable.

We wanted to develop a paper clip that allowed people to distinguish themselves.
We now offer a variety of designs, colors and monograms for social and business
applications.

Introduction & Why We Seek Your Support

My husband Kelly and I have developed Supra Clip. They are also known as Classic Clips. We introduced the Supra Clip brand for this Indiegogo event. This limited time promotion offers product at great discount. Goods will ship in early September shortly after funding occurs.

We design clips ourselves and own proprietary rights to product. However, we are presently dependent upon a contract manufacturer here in the US to make product for us.

Our project goal is to move from contract manufacturing to in-house manufacturing. With successful Indiegogo support we will be able to purchase press equipment to begin making clips ourselves. 

Your support is very important. Therefore, we are offering Indiegogo perks at deep discount. We have sufficient gold coil stock to make your Perks. 

We also have all embossing die-sets made for designs shown. Once funding happens, we will immediately purchase the press equipment. 

We should be setup within two weeks. If for any reason there is a delay, our contract manufacturer will still be in place. Again, our goal is to ship product soon after funding. Bottom line we are properly organized to make and ship your Rewards/Perks.

Use of Funds

What your $18,000 contribution will do.

$15,000 - Purchase of a used press, feeder and coil unwinder

$750 Perks - Coil material costs

$950 Perks - Packaging materials and postage costs

$1,300 - Indiegogo administration costs

Any additional funding will be used to purchase better equipment !

 

REWARDS/PERKS !

 

FAQ’s

What are shipping costs ?

All goods will ship via USPS with tracking information.

Shipping to     U.S. destinations                   FREE
Shipping to     Canada and Mexico                See the shipping chart    
Shipping to     International destinations        See the shipping chart  

 

How do I furnish information for personalized clips ?

After we receive your pledge we will email an order form for you
to complete and return. You will receive this form within one week
after you pledge. Goods will ship immediately after funding.

What if I want to order multiple sets ?

Again, we will email an order form for you to confirm your perk reward(s).

Are Supra Clips available in local stores ?

Unfortunately, not at this time.

Why do you show illustrations of the clips instead of photographs ?

Supra Clips are difficult to photograph in close-up. They are small
and very reflective. To present artwork in detail we use photoshop
illustrations.

What is the clip size and how many pages do they hold ?

Supra Clips are 1 inch in diameter. They secure up to 12 pages depending
on paper thickness.

Are they reuseable ?

Yes. Once attached, simply unfold the wings and remove. They can
be reused on average three to five times.

Can I select other designs or pick a mixture of other clips ?

Sorry, you may only select the assortments as offered. With Single
Initial clips, only one initial may be chosen. With 2 or 3 initial
clips, only one set of 2 or 3 initials can be designated over a
particular design. But you are welcome to buy multiple sets !

I am a blogger, a journalist. I would like added information.

If you would like further information including photographs to discuss
Supra Clip. Please email Kathleen@supraclip.com. I will be pleased to
send you more information. We appreciate your support !

Other Information

Goods will be mailed USPS with proof of shipment information.
All US shipments will have tracking information. Please note that
the gifts provided in return for your pledge are shipped from
the US. Goods shipped outside of the U.S. may be subject to import
taxes, customs duties or other fees levied by the destination country.
All such costs are the responsibility by the gift receiver.  

Supra Clip and Classic Clips are U.S. trademarks owned by Kathleen
and Kelly Langley. Both are U.S. patented products. Patent pending
internationally.

We appreciate your support !Other Information Goods will be mailed USPS with proof of shipment information. All US shipments will have tracking information. Please note that the gifts provided in return for your pledge are shipped fromthe US. Goods shipped outside of the U.S. may be subject to import taxes, customs duties or other fees levied by the destination country. All such costs are the responsibility by the gift receiver.

story:
What is the Violet Protest?

Developed and organized by Arizona-based artist, educator and social practitioner, Ann Morton, the Violet Protest is a nation-wide public engagement project that employs hand-made textiles as tools for protest against political divisiveness, and instead, generates a creative call for national unity.

Focused on values we hold dear, rather than specific political or social issues, the color Violet symbolizes the literal combination of red and blue, familiar symbols of our nation’s differing ideologies.

Thousands of makers from across all 50 states, DC and Canada have contributed 8 x 8-inch squares using a variety of textile processes. Each square, created with equal parts red and blue, sends an individual message supporting the core values of the Violet Protest.

Core values of the Violet Protest:
• Respect for the other   • Citizenship   • Compromise   • Courage   • Candor  
• Country over party and corporate influence   • Compassion   • Creativity

As of July 2021, the Violet Protest has over 2200 makers signed up to make nearly 17,000 individual squares, representing almost 75,000 hours of hand labor.

Why do we need your support?

The project goal is to send bundles of between 25-50 of these individual squares to each member of the 117th US Congress in late 2021/early 2022 as a unique demonstration of protest, and to voice our hopes and support for cooperation between lawmakers on both sides of the aisle. In support of the thousands of Violet Protesters, and to achieve our ultimate mission of affecting hearts and minds, we want the impact to be strong when these bundles arrive in Washington DC.

In addition to the unique collection of textile squares of all techniques and textures, we will be including letters and photos from multiple makers and overview materials about Violet Protest in each package.

We are also working with Arizona State University to be a part of an event at their program facility in Washington DC to gain presence and visibility. We are reaching out to PR and media outlets to create a buzz around the Violet Protest’s arrival in DC. We have a team of tenacious, well connected advocates working on behalf of the Violet Protest. And although we hope to hand deliver some of these packages directly to lawmaker’s offices, the majority of these packages will be sent via USPS.

To print, package and pay for postage, our estimated budget to send 535 individual packages totals approx. $12,000.00. In addition, there are travel and rental costs associated with the sorting and packaging operation, and to facilitate our presence in Washington DC coinciding with the delivery of these packages of squares to Congress. All these efforts need funding, and that is why we are launching this campaign.

 

Your support matters!

The Violet Protest has been on exhibit at Phoenix Art Museum since March 10, and will be up until September 5, 2021. The exhibit opened with approximately 9500 squares on display, with new squares being added each week. Now totaling about 11,000 squares, it is projected that the gallery will hold nearly 17,000 squares by the closing of the exhibition!

Artist, Ann Morton, has spent several days each week in the gallery, knitting to underscore the extraordinary outpouring of hand labor by all the Violet Protesters. Nearly every time she is present, she encounters visitors that are stunned and even moved to tears upon experiencing the Violet Protest face to face. The power within this exhibition is palpable. 

With the launch of this project being in January 2020, before any of us knew what the year ahead would bring, makers have stepped up and participated throughout the challenging events of 2020. This project has been a lifeline for many during these dark days. It has given makers a way to be creative, and be a part of this movement that has become an increasingly important outlet through which to voice their resistance to the growing and threatening divisions within our US democracy. Delivering these tens of thousands of squares to Congress has been our singular goal because we believe that this is a truly unique expression that can touch the hearts and minds of our lawmakers.

You can be an important part of the this extraordinary effort. Please join us now with your support. Your donation will go towards making the Violet Protest arrival in Washington DC a memorable one, and more importantly, one that will touch each member of Congress in meaningful ways. 

 

Other ways you can help.

Times are challenging, so if you can't support us with a financial contribution, there are still ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with everyone you know - post it on social media to your circles so that we can gain a broader audience. Use the web link or the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Let us know if you know someone, that knows someone, that knows someone, that can put us in touch with offices of lawmakers across the country.

story:
Short Summary

Kirsten Meier and Zachary Ochoa are both Juniors at the Milwaukee Institute of Art and Design. Over the past year Kirsten and Zach assisted in the execution of and performed in the Advice Tent at Center Street Days and Bay View Bash both in Milwaukee. According to Kirsten, "Participating in the Advice Tent showed me the importance of sharing your personal voice and experiences with others. To be able to assist in the Miami Advice Tent would mean experiencing a whole new variety of advice asked and advice given."  In Miami, Kirsten and Zachary would be present at the Museum of Advice workshops, helping teenaged participants to find their own voice and style of advising, as well as taking photo documentation of the Advice Tent, in order to capture the action as it happens and have a permanent record of all the advice provided.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Airplane tickets for both Kirsten and Zachary = $688. Indiegogo takes 5% of raised funds, therefore we need $722 in order to cover all of it, but if we raise it to a nice even $750 that gives them some extra cash for in-town travel and/or a couple meals. 
  • Perks for donors include: custom drawings, poems, songs, private flute concerts, copy editing services and... advice!
  • If we don't meet our goal the funds will still go to help support everyone on this trip, including Kirsten and Zachary, however we 100% plan on meeting our goal.

The Impact

Your donation will allow us to

  • To help Miami residents find answers to real life problems!
  • To help Miami teens gain empowerment through Zachary and Kirsten's example.
  • To have an experience that Kirsten and Zachary will never forget changing their lives and future careers for the better.
  • Both aspire to be performance artists after graduation and this opportunity to help a working performance artist will give them insight for their own success.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is that if we don't raise the funds to travel we will have to pay for this trip ourselves.

  • It is a small amount of money we believe others can help us easily reach.
  • If we don't make it, we make debt for artists and students... so help us prevent that!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with others.
  • Treat us to lunch.

Treat us to lunch.

story:
Meaningful Visions...

When I was 3 years old, in the north west of Australia, my mother drew me a stick figure, and I thought it was the most magical thing in the world! Over the years that sense of wonder has only grown, just as the language that evokes that wonder has kept evolving. Stick figures at some point became realistic illusions. And realistic illusions soon became meaningful visions.

The poetic and meaningful vision, transmitted in a song of oil, is what I live for; it is the secret I have to give the world. 'The Secrets of Pangaea' is my most ambitious project to date. It has been conceived as a series of large scale paintings, drawings and prints. Already underway I plan to complete the series during a 3 month apprenticeship with the renowned painter, Odd Nerdrum, in Norway, between August and October of this year.

'The Secrets of Pangaea' comes off the back of two successful solo exhibitions of mostly single figure paintings, since moving to Ireland. These were 'The Antique Gaze' (2015) and 'Guardians of Solitude' (2016). The Antique Gaze marked my first foray into Baroque-inspired figurative painting (previously my work had been very modernist). 'The Secrets of Pangaea' marks another shift, this time from single figure portraiture to multi-figure narrative painting. This is a bit like a writer shifting from the short story to the novel, and my chief inspiration, in making this move, has been the Norwegian master Odd Nerdrum. It is an amazing privilege, therefore to be studying with him this year. But I need your help to get me there!

'What Lies Within', oil on linen, from 'Guardians of Solitude', 2016. Painting and prints available! Painting: €750; Prints from €45

I decided to launch this campaign as a shared opportunity: pre-sales and patronage will give me the time and resources I need for the Nerdrum apprenticeship (including travel and living expenses) - and time and materials to complete the series. It will greatly alleviate the financial pressure which builds to a crescendo between exhibitions (I live off sales and private teaching). In alleviating such pressure it will allow me to produce a higher quality presentation, in terms of materials (both in quantity and quality), in the production of limited edition lithographs (to be created and printed at Cork Printmakers),  and in the production of a high quality catalogue to complement the exhibition.

Conversely it is an an opportunity for the art lover, friend and supporter to contribute towards the series' creation. Purchasing a work of art is for many of us, a little out of reach. This is an opportunity to show your appreciation and support without necessarily making an expensive purchase. Catalogues, classes, prints, seminars and prize draws all come in at under €50! For the collector and patron it is an opportunity to join the journey from the works' earliest conception, to the point of  realisation and acquisition. The Secrets of Pangaea can live on in your home as paintings, drawings and prints! In between the two, if you would love to be a collector, but can't quite manage it, I'm offering a third option: co-owning a work with other community collectors. But, hang on, how would that work? Read on!

Community Acquisition Fund: 'Clon Art Share'

Sometimes I see a painting, print or sculpture at a show, and would love to buy it, but I just don't have the funds. If I had the option to co-own the piece, however, say for a 10% share, that perhaps I could afford! This has got me thinking about the possibility of a community art share fund, and I'd like to try it out in Clonakilty, where I live, through this campaign (you could start something similar where-ever you are!). So I am offering a community sharehold option of €85. Community shareholders will meet as a group at a preview event to The Pangaea exhibition, and decide as a group on a purchase and negotiate a community space for it to be shown in. Shareholders will each receive a certificate stating their sharehold value and the title of the work. It will be up to the group to decide rules of on-sale and exchange, however it is my hope that it could be the beginnings of a permanent community collection. Community lovers, are you game? Let's begin the revolution!

'Striped Feather', oil on linen, 2016, from Guardians of Solitude. Painting and prints available! Painting: €300; Prints from €45

Prize Draws

Everyone who pledges will go into a prize draw! EVERYONE! There are three prize draws: the first for an A4 'gilcee' colour print of one of my paintings (this is a high quality reproduction on fine art paper), the second for a limited edition lithograph of one of the Pangaea drawings (hand printed at Cork Printmakers using a special photo-litho technique), and the third for an original Pangaea drawing. How lucky are you feeling? One special perk - the Raw Sienna Supporter - has entry into all three draws!!!

Classes

There are four class options available, from 2 hour sketching sessions to a six week course. There are options for those wanting to explore recreationally ('Summer Creators), for beginners and more advanced painters. There is also an option to join me in Paris in Summer 2018 for a gallery tour and drawing tuition! Come and join the fray!

'Summer Sketchers': Sketching class by the sea this Summer!!

Baroque Wanderers Soiree

Cheese and wine in hand, allow me to take you into the world of the 'Old Masters', into the time of Rembrandt and Carravaggio - then hold on as we accelerate into the Now, into the world of the 'New Baroque', a painterly world defined by the likes of Odd Nerdrum, Nicola Samori and Agostino Arrivabene. They are contemporary masters who are reviving the very soul of painting and this a chance for me to introduce you to their work!

This will be an intimate, informative and sensory evening. Wine, nibbles and refreshments will be provided, as well as my Guardians and Pangaea catalogues. And, of course a night of the Baroque would not be complete without the timeless airs of award-winning composer Justin Grounds, who will regale us with his Baroque violin.

To add a little more spice there will be an exclusive soiree prize draw with several lithographs and giclee prints up for grabs!

Lithographs & Drawings

Lithography is a beautiful form of printmaking, and photo-lithography an exquisite way of reproducing drawings. And this is what I plan to do for the Pangaea series. The process, technical support and facilities, however are not cheap, and this is one of the reasons for running this campaign. With pre-orders and pledges I can make this happen, providing a richer smorgasboard (yet more affordable acquisition) for your eyes.

'Song of Pangaea', 100x100cm, charcoal and pastel on paper, 2017. Available for reservation by deposit. To be shown this November. €700 (unframed).

Drawing plays a vital role for me in developing compositions for paintings, and they become wonderful works in their own right. A suite of the Pangaea drawings will be shown in late 2017 as part of the collection. If you place a 'collector' deposit through this campaign I will email you images as they emerge and will give you an invitation to a special preview event, giving you first options for acquisition.

Collectors and Patrons

Works are still available from my previous two collections and may be viewed on my website: jameswaller.org. The 'Collector' and 'Patron' options allow you to place a deposit for artwork which you can then choose from existing available work, or which you can commission, or which you can choose from the Pangaea series as it becomes available. Collectors and Patrons will be emailed images as they come to light and be invited to a special preview event, to see the work first hand and have first options on acquisition. A note, as well on size: there will be a good mix of small, medium and large paintings in the collection, and prices will range from €250-€550 (smallest), €550-€950 (small-medium), €950-€1400 (medium-large), €1400-€9000 (large-epic). Drawings will be between €250 and €750 (not including frame).

 

'Gaze', oil on linen, 2017, 38x48cm. A Pangaea series study. Available for reservation by deposit, to be shown this November. €475.

Portrait Packages

This is a treasure to keep for a life time. The Child Portrait Package comes in at €550. It is for a 60x40cm oil painting on linen, and includes a preparatory drawing, catalogues and prize draw entry. I can work from a photograph that you provide or we can organize a photo session.

The Wedding Package is at the high end of my campaign offers, at €1400. It is for a life-size double portrait, oil on linen, roughly 90 x 120cm. I'll include a preparatory drawing with the painting, and you'll have the choice of one of the limited edition lithographs from the Pangaea series. You'll also get all the 'Gold Patron' perks!

 

'Ari', oil on linen, 2016, from 'Guardians of Solitude'.

 

Secrets of Pangaea Catalogue

Producing a high quality exhibition catalogue is a significant way to increase visibility and presence and provides a valuable aid in pitching to galleries, collectors and markets further afield. It is, however, something I can only contemplate through pre-sales, and is another reason for this campaign. I was only able to produce a catalogue of my last show after it was over, and then only in a small number. Your pledge will enable The Secrets of Pangaea to be far better presented and in time for the show! And, of course, you will receive the catalogue!


Guardians catalogue, 2016, front and back cover.

 

Crunching the Numbers!

By now you'll have an inkling of what's involved: a three month apprenticeship, flights, travel, living expenses, material expenses - including oils and mediums, timber for frames, linen, paper -  printmaking  expenses, including studio membership, paper, ink and technical guidance - studio rental, catalogue and printing costs. And most of all, time.  It all stacks up. Sales from Guardians of Solitude have taken me part of the way. But I'm now looking to your support and to Pangaea pre-sales to carry me through!  €4500 will get me there. Five portraits, 5 lithographs, 10 gilcee prints and 2 full classes will do the job. And the world will be all the richer for it!

                      

'Player and Pigeons', oil on linen 2016, from 'Guardians of Solitude'. Prints available!

So I hope to see you on this journey, deepening the vibration, investing in a richer stillness and a greater beauty, investing in your community and the special space of your home. Your faith and patronage will be rewarded, with treasures that will last centuries, for all to enjoy. The Secrets of Pangaea project is as much about a striving for mastery of expression, as it is an attempt to hauntingly resonate the world. Underlying both is a desire for human connection and that is the very essence of this campaign. I'll get there by hook or by crook, but I'd rather you with me on the way! And if you're not able to make a pledge, you can still help me immensely by sharing this campaign and spreading the word.

So, thank you for your support and interest and do not hesitate to contact me for further info about The Secrets of Pangaea!

'Interloper', oil on linen, from 'Guardians of Solitude'. Painting available: €380

 

'The Secrets of Pangaea': oil study

 

'The Secrets of Pangaea': detail of work in progress.

 

'The Secrets of Pangaea': detail of work in progress.

 

'The Secrets of Pangaea': detail of work in progress.
story_txt:
Meaningful Visions...
When I was 3 years old, in the north west of Australia, my mother drew me a stick figure, and I thought it was the most magical thing in the world! Over the years that sense of wonder has only grown, just as the language that evokes that wonder has kept evolving. Stick figures at some point became realistic illusions. And realistic illusions soon became meaningful visions.
The poetic and meaningful vision, transmitted in a song of oil, is what I live for; it is the secret I have to give the world. 'The Secrets of Pangaea' is my most ambitious project to date. It has been conceived as a series of large scale paintings, drawings and prints. Already underway I plan to complete the series during a 3 month apprenticeship with the renowned painter, Odd Nerdrum, in Norway, between August and October of this year.
'The Secrets of Pangaea' comes off the back of two successful solo exhibitions of mostly single figure paintings, since moving to Ireland. These were 'The Antique Gaze' (2015) and 'Guardians of Solitude' (2016). The Antique Gaze marked my first foray into Baroque-inspired figurative painting (previously my work had been very modernist). 'The Secrets of Pangaea' marks another shift, this time from single figure portraiture to multi-figure narrative painting. This is a bit like a writer shifting from the short story to the novel, and my chief inspiration, in making this move, has been the Norwegian master Odd Nerdrum. It is an amazing privilege, therefore to be studying with him this year. But I need your help to get me there!

'What Lies Within', oil on linen, from 'Guardians of Solitude', 2016. Painting and prints available! Painting: €750; Prints from €45
I decided to launch this campaign as a shared opportunity: pre-sales and patronage will give me the time and resources I need for the Nerdrum apprenticeship (including travel and living expenses) - and time and materials to complete the series. It will greatly alleviate the financial pressure which builds to a crescendo between exhibitions (I live off sales and private teaching). In alleviating such pressure it will allow me to produce a higher quality presentation, in terms of materials (both in quantity and quality), in the production of limited edition lithographs (to be created and printed at Cork Printmakers),  and in the production of a high quality catalogue to complement the exhibition.
Conversely it is an an opportunity for the art lover, friend and supporter to contribute towards the series' creation. Purchasing a work of art is for many of us, a little out of reach. This is an opportunity to show your appreciation and support without necessarily making an expensive purchase. Catalogues, classes, prints, seminars and prize draws all come in at under €50! For the collector and patron it is an opportunity to join the journey from the works' earliest conception, to the point of  realisation and acquisition. The Secrets of Pangaea can live on in your home as paintings, drawings and prints! In between the two, if you would love to be a collector, but can't quite manage it, I'm offering a third option: co-owning a work with other community collectors. But, hang on, how would that work? Read on!
Community Acquisition Fund: 'Clon Art Share'
Sometimes I see a painting, print or sculpture at a show, and would love to buy it, but I just don't have the funds. If I had the option to co-own the piece, however, say for a 10% share, that perhaps I could afford! This has got me thinking about the possibility of a community art share fund, and I'd like to try it out in Clonakilty, where I live, through this campaign (you could start something similar where-ever you are!). So I am offering a community sharehold option of €85. Community shareholders will meet as a group at a preview event to The Pangaea exhibition, and decide as a group on a purchase and negotiate a community space for it to be shown in. Shareholders will each receive a certificate stating their sharehold value and the title of the work. It will be up to the group to decide rules of on-sale and exchange, however it is my hope that it could be the beginnings of a permanent community collection. Community lovers, are you game? Let's begin the revolution!

'Striped Feather', oil on linen, 2016, from Guardians of Solitude. Painting and prints available! Painting: €300; Prints from €45
Prize Draws
Everyone who pledges will go into a prize draw! EVERYONE! There are three prize draws: the first for an A4 'gilcee' colour print of one of my paintings (this is a high quality reproduction on fine art paper), the second for a limited edition lithograph of one of the Pangaea drawings (hand printed at Cork Printmakers using a special photo-litho technique), and the third for an original Pangaea drawing. How lucky are you feeling? One special perk - the Raw Sienna Supporter - has entry into all three draws!!!

There are four class options available, from 2 hour sketching sessions to a six week course. There are options for those wanting to explore recreationally ('Summer Creators), for beginners and more advanced painters. There is also an option to join me in Paris in Summer 2018 for a gallery tour and drawing tuition! Come and join the fray!

story:
Here at Diane’s Hunting Club HQ we are so excited to begin preparations for our annual meeting and can’t wait to be together with you all again out there in the forest. Our membership dues only cover the most basic requirements for the event. In order to create an even better event and bring down our longer-term costs, we are raising funds to improve our infrastructure. Our most pressing needs are:

+Outhouses                                                                                                                                                                   -Porta-potty rental is one of our highest costs, and for each latrine/outhouse that we construct our annual club costs go down. This project requires the purchasing of digging equipment, lumber, paint, and other building materials to create lovely, inviting places to poop.

+Showers                                                                                                                                                                       We are constructing an outdoor shower stall on the property to allow members to bathe during the event. This will require lumber, concrete, and other building materials.

+Communal cooking                                                                                                                                                     We are constructing a communal grill/cooking station in the back of the property to improve on our ad-hoc station we put together on the 4th last year. We will need to purchase rebar, cinderblocks, propane, and grill grates.

+Generator                                                                                                                                                                       Any remaining funds will go toward the purchase of a dedicated inverter-generator for the event. While this is a very expensive investment, it will not only bring down long terms costs of generator rental, but will provide us with safer, quieter energy for our power needs.

***Please note contributions to this campaign do not cover annual club membership dues***

For those unable to contribute financially or who want to do more, please come out and help make these (and other) projects a reality by joining us for work-weekends starting in April.

story:
My mini dream

 I believe that miniatures can change the world. It gives us perspective. A better point of view on our lives. they reminds us that we are bigger than our problems, and gives us courage to fulfill our dreams.

 I have a mini dream! to make a tiny change in the world by  sharing my  miniature beer caps worlds, with 2,500 people in the planet. 


one of a kind dream

 My name is tomer rosenman, I'm a miniature artist. Making this little pieces of life, is my life work.
 I invite you to be one of the lucky 2,500 that will own one of my mini dreams.
 

one of a kind dream

making each miniature peice takes time and Availability.  your Contribution  will help me todedicate  my self for the project. 

 

what you get

a breathtaking handmade miniature scene, in a beer/soft drink cap.

story:
Hi! My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a Romanian self-publisher and blogger. I've been writing for over eight years now, but I've only decided to release my stories for a wider audience in April 2012, when I also launched my blog.

So far I have released three novels, four short stories, a novella, and a compilation of essays.

I'm pretty much a one man operation, meaning that I do most of the stuff that needs to be done in order to publish a book, from cover art to interior formatting. Basically anything, except for editing.

I'm a self-publisher by choice. An independent artist who does all the work himself, and tries his best to make a living out of it.

And, believe it or not, I know how difficult and frustrating the world of self-publishing can be sometimes, especially when books aren't selling very well, despite the overall positive feedback from readers.

That's why the perks are aimed at helping indie artists reach a bigger audience in exchange for a small contribution.

Your contributions will help me make ends meet, keep on writing, and release my future projects. Donations allow me to dedicate all my time to writing, blogging, and doing all the other stuff related to self-publishing.

What I Need & What You Get

The Midnight Muse is a website that I'm currently testing with. I'd like to purchase the premium upgrade from Wordpress, which is $99. Also, I'd like to purchase a premium theme, which costs $79.
Story-a-week.com is another side project. Domain is good to go, but I'd like to be able to find an editor willing to help me properly edit my short stories. Four short stories every month would put me at around $200-300 total, depending of the length of the short stories themselves.
Also, I've got two novels ready for publishing:

and...

Both of which are finished, but need to be edited. The total cost of that goes for around $800-900.
Other than that, I've got everything covered. Interior formatting, covers, e-book layout.
For your contributions, you get the chance to reach an audience of over 95,000 people, via the Sponsor perks available.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that people sometimes can't afford to be charitable.

But if you don't have any money to contribute you can help out with a tweet or like. It's really simple. You just have to click on a button. And, trust me, that's enough, and it will really help me towards meeting my goal.

Thank you,

Cristian

story:
Bringing professionalism to Burning Man since 2007, Driven by Profit's Mobile Boardroom plans to return to the playa for its annual general meeting in September 2015. The corporate welfare industry has been suffering tight times of late, and our reliance on government handouts has had a good run; however current trends indicate a return to the private sector - WE NEED YOU!

Driven by Profit is a mobile performance - and one of the many ART CARS that roam the playa during Burning Man. During my first time at Burning Man in 2003 I was captivated with the medium of the art car, and was convinced that some day I would make one and contribute it to the week long festival. Like any artist, I wanted to make something unusual or outstanding, something that could break through the constant chatter of our post modern world. I needed to make an art car that cut through the whimsical pirate ships, giant bunnies and fun-fur costumes of Black Rock City. In the no-rules fantasy land of Burning Man, I chose "business as usual".

   

We encourage anyone who wants to meet with us to promote synergy, move laterally, and blue-sky it up. The biggest rule is for business attire only. When you look good you feel good, and they'll be a lot of slobs out there not wearing a tie. They're going to look at you like they've never seen anyone with a job before. For those people who show up late, there is little sympathy. It takes a lot of work and a long time to become an overnight success.

We are seeking financial support to help fund:

  • Transportation costs
  • Automotive repairs 
  •  Equipment and furniture upgrades

This in turn will help:

  • Reinforce corporate social responsibility
  • Increase networking opportunities
  • Ensure the bottom does not fall out of the market
  • Maximize share holder participation
  • Educate Black Rock City on the importance of greenwashing
  • And more

By contributing, you become a valued shareholder and will help determine the direction of the Mobile Boardroom and our participation on the playa.  We have a number of proposed activities for shareholders this year, including the "19th Hole Invitational Golf Tournament," a ladies executive afternoon to Break the Glass Ceiling, red ribbon cutting and ground breaking ceremonies (Silver shovel and giant scissors provided) and a blinkey-light vs. wet wipe seminar.  


Joking aside, we would greatly appreciate any contribution from those who have or plan to participate, ride on and interact with this entertaining art car on the playa.  Everyone is invited to join - however, business attire is mandatory. We have a company to run!
story_txt:
Bringing professionalism to Burning Man since 2007, Driven by Profit's Mobile Boardroom plans to return to the playa for its annual general meeting in September 2015. The corporate welfare industry has been suffering tight times of late, and our reliance on government handouts has had a good run; however current trends indicate a return to the private sector - WE NEED YOU!Driven by Profit is a mobile performance - and one of the many ART CARS that roam the playa during Burning Man. During my first time at Burning Man in 2003 I was captivated with the medium of the art car, and was convinced that some day I would make one and contribute it to the week long festival. Like any artist, I wanted to make something unusual or outstanding, something that could break through the constant chatter of our post modern world. I needed to make an art car that cut through the whimsical pirate ships, giant bunnies and fun-fur costumes of Black Rock City. In the no-rules fantasy land of Burning Man, I chose "business as usual".   We encourage anyone who wants to meet with us to promote synergy, move laterally, and blue-sky it up. The biggest rule is for business attire only. When you look good you feel good, and they'll be a lot of slobs out there not wearing a tie. They're going to look at you like they've never seen anyone with a job before. For those people who show up late, there is little sympathy. It takes a lot of work and a long time to become an overnight success.We are seeking financial support to help fund:


Transportation costs


Automotive repairs 


 Equipment and furniture upgrades


This in turn will help:


Reinforce corporate social responsibility


Increase networking opportunities


Ensure the bottom does not fall out of the market


Maximize share holder participation


Educate Black Rock City on the importance of greenwashing


And more


By contributing, you become a valued shareholder and will help determine the direction of the Mobile Boardroom and our participation on the playa.  We have a number of proposed activities for shareholders this year, including the "19th Hole Invitational Golf Tournament," a ladies executive afternoon to Break the Glass Ceiling, red ribbon cutting and ground breaking ceremonies (Silver shovel and giant scissors provided) and a blinkey-light vs. wet wipe seminar.  
Joking aside, we would greatly appreciate any contribution from those who have or plan to participate, ride on and interact with this entertaining art car on the playa.  Everyone is invited to join - however, business attire is mandatory. We have a company to run!

story:
The Ministry of the Butterfly

The Ministry of the Butterfly is an interactive art installation that made its debut at Transformus 2015. We would like to bring it to the participants of Alchemy. 
Our art installation features a geodesic dome that houses a healthy safe, environment for both Monarch and Painted Lady butterflies and a comfortable, relaxing and meditative space for burners.

What We Need & What You Get

The installation consists of a 24 foot geodesic dome that has been covered by a netting reduces light and keeps butterflies contained. The netting was a piece of discarded sports field screen that we repurposed to cover the dome. Added to this installation is a water feature for the butterflies hydration needs, and plants that the butterflies eat and lay their eggs on. 

You will be donating toward the upgrade of our structure, modifications to the water feature and the purchase of butterflies. 

We will be upgrading the structural integrity of the geodesic dome that houses the Ministry. We hope to allow for the installation of hammocks in addition to our floor seating with this dome upgrade. 

Our Butterfly Team has incurred many expenses in constructing and maintaining the Butterfly Installation. The largest recurring expense is the purchase of the butterflies.  Previously we featured 2 types of butterflies: Painted Ladies and Monarchs. Although beautiful, the Painted Ladies are not nearly as interactive as the Monarchs. Monarchs are a very lively and interactive butterfly that would frequently land on participants. 

Normal cost for a mix is about 750.00, with Monarchs running $6-8 each , while the Ladies cost around $3 each.  We would like to add more Monarchs because of the interaction with participants, but also, they are a near Threatened species, according to the World Wildlife Fund (WWF). One of the greatest threats to the Monarch is the loss of food and habitat due to use of herbicides. The plants that they prefer serve as food, habitat and space for reproduction.

We will supply them with a safe, comforting environment for breeding while providing burners with a dome to escape the heat, enjoy the music, and appreciate the aesthetic of these wonderful creatures. 

The Impact

In true burner fashion, there will be no negative impact on the environment, but rather a positive one. We will be releasing the butterflies at the end of the burn in our  Release Ceremony. We will show participants how to gently capture the butterfly then release it.

We hope to have an educational impact on the community as well. Educating burners on how they can create their own butterfly sanctuary at home. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is appreciated, but we understand that is not always feasible! We ask that you share this wherever you can! Friends, family, neighbors, that one guy who likes bugs, your best friend's mom who loves butterflies, pretty much everyone!

story:
Who We Are

NIA stands for Northside Independent Artists. We all live and work on the north side of Chicago, and we give back to the city that inspires us with our art shows.

NIA Fine Art Friday, on December 2nd, will be our fourth show. It is not represented by a gallery or any big arts organization. Like all our shows, it is a grassroots effort created entirely by us. We are designing it, we will promote it, and we will pay for the event costs.

What We Need

Because we’ve done this so many times, we can now anticipate what the costs will be. They include space rental; food and beverages for our guests; print materials, including posters, flyers and postcards; hardware for hanging art; and event décor.

We always sell art at our shows, but we also spend at least as much as we earn on event costs. This is not a sustainable model, and we will not be able to continue doing shows at a loss.

We are asking you to help us pay for NIA Fine Art Friday event costs. Any contribution is welcome – even a $5 donation will help us get closer to our goal.

Why It Matters

For some of us, the NIA shows represent our only opportunity to present our work to the public, interact with fans, and earn any money from our art. This also means that fans will only get the chance to see most of this work at a NIA show. Your donation literally affects dozens of people.
For all of us, the shows present valuable learning experiences, as we expand our knowledge of event planning, organization, marketing and promotion. The NIA shows make us better equipped to contribute our time and talents to any number of culturally enriching events. By supporting NIA today, you are "paying it forward", helping to nurture all those future events we will create or enhance.

Why You Should Help

If you’re a friend or family member of a NIA artist, you know how much this show means to us. Help us realize our dream.

Maybe you’re someone who plans to attend the show in December. You can ensure that it actually happens by making a donation today.

If you would like to attend the show, but know that you will be unable to, you can still make your presence felt with a donation. It is the next best thing to spending your money on a piece of artwork.

Finally, if you’re simply someone who is moved and inspired by our story – the story of non-famous artists with a lot of ambition – please contribute to this fundraiser.

If you can't help monetarily at this time, then please help spread the word by sharing this campaign on your favorite social media. Maybe one of your friends will make the donation that causes us to hit our goal!

story:
Papa, I Will Miss You: A Painting Tribute To A Father Who Died

 

I am looking for good-hearted people who can help me realized my mobile art workshop for children and art enthusiast. Sharing your blessings is a great way to please God.

Mobile Art Workshop - I also planned to introduce mobile artwork shop for children, to encourage them to pursue  their skills in art and enjoy this talent throughout their lives. This will be a free art workshop that travels from time to time.

I would appeal for a whole-hearted support from Indiegogo backers all over the world. Any help extended is greatly appreciated.

THE STORY

Joel Escol is a frustrated artist and 4th Year Architecture student. He didn't finish his last year in college plus some major subjects due to massive poverty. Out of frustration, he got married and gave up his talent in art and thrashed all his painting materials. Instead, he focused on his work as a Journalist and also on his family. He had forgotten his ultimate dream of establishing a mini art school and teach children all about his brand of artistry.

But the internet and YouTube opened doors to him to live up to his passion in painting and cartooning when he saw great artists and read about their lives.

Now, after 20 years, his passion in painting is here again, as he was more inspired by his over 6,000 neighbors who are survivors of Typhoon Haiyan that hit his hometown two years ago and claimed the lives of over a thousand people. Their children needs help to recover from trauma and he believes he can become part of their recovery.

 

Right now, Joel has no more art materials left to begin working on major artworks that will inspire kids to learn art too. So, this time he turn to the loyal supporters of Indiegogo to ask for help.

THE PROJECT BENEFICIARIES

 

These are the genuine children of Typhoon survivors. Many of them have lost their brothers and sisters their, parents and other members of the family - and they are my neighbors. Once the art center is established they are the main beneficiaries of the art center, which will also cater to other children of difficult circumstances.

This is where you come in!

Any donation you make will help me put my dream mini art school and 2 other projects a real success! You know, many of the children of typhoon survivors are now school dropouts and they need some sort of temporary refuge, where they are encourage to go back to school in the next school opening. I believed teaching them about art could help alleviate the trauma they have experienced in the past.

Your donations will also received immediate gratifications! You can choose from various perks ranging from paintings, prints and original illustrations, aside from other self portrait perks that will be exclusively made for your family.

 

WHAT WE NEED?

1. Art Materials 2. 2 Computers 3. Canvasses 4. Tables and Chairs 5. Paints/Acrylics 6. Sketch Pads 7. Center Renovation Funds

A portrait of the donors! This is the first perk that I will offer to my donors. You choose the photo and I'll do a portrait of you according to my style. These portraits will be a combination of charcoal, oil and other medium. I'm sure a lot of you guys want a family portrait hanged in your wall. So, this is your opportune time to have a FAMILY PORTRAIT at a very affordable price you can really afford.

 

AND THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR SUPPORTING AND BECOMING PART OF MY LIFE! I WILL SURELY TREASURE THIS AS LONG AS I LIVE...

1. MAKE A SMALL DONATION

If you feel like sharing your blessings or as your way of thanking the good Lord for all the blessings your family receives this year, then you can donate some amount according to what your heart desires

2. SPREAD THE WORD!

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn, StumbleUpon, in email, blogs, phone calls, or with family, friends, colleagues, office mates, sport’s buddies.

3. GET ONE PERK AND TOUCH LIVES

You can also consider getting one perk. You know we have interesting perks such as the artists themselves going to make a family portrait at very affordable prices you can surely afford.

If you need to contact me for whatever reason, email me at escoljoel@gmail.com

story:
Update (7/19): Wow, we raised 2x the goal in less than 24 hours! We're definitely making books! If the campaign hits $5,000, I'll add stickers to everyone's order!

These drawings are terrible, just like Donald Trump.

I have a notebook of blind contour drawings, where I draw things without looking at the page. It’s supposed to build hand-eye coordination, but you also make some really funny and bad drawings.

A lot of my drawings are of Donald Trump. I’ve turned some of them into this coloring book, Make America Colorful Again, and I'm donating 100% of proceeds to help immigrants stay in America.

In many of these, I ended up mangling him in some unfortunate way. 

 

Some of these pictures look funny:

 

Some look frightening:

Some feature his friends like Sarah Palin:

...or Chris Christie:

 

Some I just really messed up:

 

And in some he even got bigger hands!

 

There's 21 pictures of Trump, 5 bonus pictures, and a space for you to try your own drawings across 32 pages. Make coloring fun again!

You can color Trump in any way you want. You might also find your own ways to mangle him in some unfortunate way.

But as you color these, you might find it interesting to see him in a shape or color you don’t normally see him. Maybe he won’t look so funny, or so frightening. Or maybe he will.

--

Jokes aside, we might shrug off Trump’s promises to build a wall or ban Muslim immigration, but we’ve done it before.

I care because it’s happened to Chinese-Americans. The Chinese Exclusion Act of 1882, which stood for 61 years, was the first law implemented to prevent a specific ethnic group from immigrating to the United States.

Redlining also segregated communities with “predominance of Orientals*” and made them ineligible for Federal Housing Administration mortgages, along with neighborhoods that had “Negroes, Latin races, and other low class foreign elements.*” I have no interest in an America where that is a reality for anyone.

(In fact, Trump was sued by the Justice Department in 1973 for his discriminatory rental practices for refusing to rent to black renters across his 14,000 apartments.)

The real threat to American values aren’t the people of different colors and creeds who make up this country — they’re demagogues like Trump who try to turn us against each other. We’re a stronger nation when we look out for each other, no matter where we come from. America is great because it’s a colorful place. Let’s keep it that way.

--

All proceeds from this book will be donated to the International Institute of the Bay Area, a non-profit organization that provides high-quality, low-cost immigration legal services to the Bay Area community. You'll be helping people who've immigrated here stay in this country legally and become American citizens. (Keep scrolling for more about them and what they do.)

If you can't contribute, I still want you to have the book! A PDF version is available for free at https://makeamericacolorfulagain.com/trump_ebooks.pdf.

In return, I ask you to:

1) register to vote (takes 10 min online), and 

2) speak out against hateful speech whenever you encounter it in your community, even if the people being hated on look nothing like you, and even if it's awkward. 


*All racial terms as used in official Federal Housing Administration documents.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book is done, it just needs to be printed! 

Funds from this campaign will go towards the costs of printing the book, the costs of making the rewards, shipping. I can do a small print run of the book for about $1,000.

The rewards levels are:

$10 + shipping — Coloring book! 32 pages of coloring fun.

$25 + shipping — Coloring book, plus coloring supplies! I'll either go and buy you some colored pencils, or if I get enough orders I can get them custom made. 

$50 + shipping — Your very own Trump! (Limited to 50.) You get the book, coloring supplies, and I'll draw and send you an original blind-contour drawing of Trump (or the person of your choice)!

100% of proceeds will be donated to the International Institute of the Bay Area, which helps immigrants stay in America and become American citizens.

 

The Impact

The Immigration Institute of the Bay Area is a non-profit organization that provides high-quality, low-cost immigration legal services to the Bay Area community. 

They help immigrants to America stay in this country legally and become American citizens. Their locations offer services in English, Spanish, Mandarin, Dari, Hindi, and Urdu.

Last year, they did:

  • 7000 office visits
  • 3000 attendees at Workshops & Trainings
  • 450 VAWA self-petitions / U-Visas
  • 300 Naturalizations
  • 250 Adjustment of Status
  • 250 Work Authorizations
  • 200 Consular Processings
  • 200 Replacements / Renewals of Green Cards
  • 100 Temporary Protective Status applications

They also help with:

  • applications for Citizenship and Naturalization

  • Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) applications, an Obama administration policy which protects illegal immigrants from deportation

  • family reunification services, including Lawful Permanent Residence applications for family members, green card applications, and Fiancé(e) visas

  • humanitarian services, for domestic violence and crime survivors, Temporary Protected Status (TPS) applicants, and asylees & refugees

  • free English as a Second Language (ESL) classes that emphasize speaking and cover United States government, history, and civics, all topics tested during the naturalization interview

Here's a full list of their services. Services are provided on a sliding scale based on income. Additionally, the group is largely managed and operated by people of color.

You should also donate to them directly!

 

Risks & Challenges

To maximize the proceeds we can pass on to the IIBA, I'm self-publishing and distributing the book! That'll mean that I'll have to figure out things like how to print a lot of copies and how to ship them out, so it may take me a bit longer to get things to you.

Other than that, the book is done and you can download it right now to print at home! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no problem! The PDF is free, so please download it and color it at home. 

In return, I ask two things:

1) register to vote (takes 10 min online)! Even if you don't like any of the presidential candidates, 88% of all seats in Congress are up for election this year — 469 in total — and they're the ones who make the laws. Your vote matters!

2) to speak out against hateful speech whenever you encounter it in your community, even if the people being hated on look nothing like you, and even if it's awkward. We'll come together only if we understand each other first.

Otherwise, you can spend some time volunteering at an organization in your community which helps folks who may not feel so American right now.
