story:
Our goal is reached! Thanks to all! However, we will try to go a little bit further before the end of the campaign. If we get 2500$ more, we will be able to add a complete week of creation with sound and lights; a real theater condition. That for sure will bring the show to a next level.

Notre objectif est atteint! Merci à tous! Cependant, nous visons encore un peu plus loin. Si on atteint 2500$ de plus, nous pourrons passer une semaine additionnel de répétition avec toute la technique de son et d'éclairage avant la première. Cela augmentera définitivement la qualité de la conception du spectacle. 

Machine de Cirque a besoin de votre aide pour créer son premier spectacle de cirque.


Why Machine de Cirque?

Founder Vincent Dubé has been a comedy and circus performer for nearly 20 years, as well as an engineering graduate. He is also interested in the percussions he incorporates in his artisitic work. Based on this diverse expertise, he wants to combine all his passions to create a unique endeavour – Machine de Cirque.

Pourquoi Machine de Cirque?

Le fondateur, Vincent Dubé est un homme de cirque et de comédie depuis près de 20 ans, et diplômé d'ingénierie. Il s'intéresse également aux percussions qu'il intègre à son travail artistique. Fort de ces expériences diverses, il a eu envie de réunir toutes ses passions pour en faire une créature unique, Machine de Cirque.


Circus and Engineering? Like Cirque du Soleil?

The engineering team is integral to the process from the start, which helps incorporate it seamlessly while showcasing the value of the performers. With only 1% of Cirque du Soleil’s budget, Machine de cirque has to rely on ingenious solutions, repurposed day-to-day objects, and contraptions operated with elbow grease – the fuel with the best quality/cost ratio on the market. This is a human scale project where each of the five performers occupies a vital place on stage. With a small team, the artists and art and technical designers can all gather around the drawing board to produce an unexpected exchange of ideas and astounding results.


Cirque et ingénierie? Comme le Cirque du Soleil?

L'équipe d'ingénierie est introduite au processus de création dès le départ, ce qui permet une intégration plus harmonieuse mettant en valeur les artistes du projet. Avec 1 % du budget du Cirque du Soleil, Machine de cirque mise sur des solutions ingénieuses, sur la récupération d'objets de la vie courante, et sur des mécanismes fonctionnant à l'huile de bras, l'huile avec le meilleur rapport qualité/prix sur le marché. C'est un projet à grandeur humaine où la personnalité de chacun des cinq artistes prend une place capitale dans le spectacle. Avec une petite équipe, les artistes, ainsi que les concepteurs artistiques et techniques peuvent tous être rassemblés autour de la table à dessin, ce qui engendre des échanges inattendus et des résultats surprenants.


The Team / L'équipe

RAPHAËL and YOHANN are one of the 10 best juggling acts in the world in addition to all the other skills they master – artistic bicycling, acrobatics, unicycling.

And let’s not forget their runaway smash hit with the Towel Act that was a favourite on YouTube around the world.

RAPHAËL et YOHANN font partie des dix meilleures équipes de jonglerie au monde en plus de toutes les autres disciplines où ils excellent : vélo artistique, acrobatie, monocycle.

Il ne faut pas oublier leur succès retentissant avec leur numéro de serviette qui fait sensation sur YouTube et à travers le monde. 


MAXIM and UGO are a hit wherever they go with their teeter board acrobatics act:

— Gold Medal at the Paris Cirque de Demain Festival

— Gold Medal at Youngstage in Switzerland

MAXIM et UGO font un malheur partout où ils passent grâce à leur numéro de planche coréenne :

— Médaille d'or au Festival de Cirque de Demain à Paris

— Médaille d'or à Youngstage en Suisse


FRÉDÉRIC is a consummate actor, musician and composer, and will soon add new arrows to his quiver with juggling and acrobatics!!

FRÉDÉRIC c'est un acteur, un musicien et un compositeur émérite. Et prochainement, de nouvelles cordes seront ajoutées à son arc : la jonglerie et la haute voltige acrobatique!!



Why are the best performers joining Machine de Cirque?

Because they believe in the project.

Because they play a large part in the creation process.

Because they want to explore, innovate and create a Company with a unique style.

Because they have humongous fun working together.


Pourquoi les meilleurs artistes se joignent-ils à Machine de Cirque?

Parce qu'ils croient au projet.

Parce qu'ils ont une grande place dans tout le processus de création.

Parce qu'ils veulent explorer, innover et créer une compagnie avec un style unique.

Parce qu'ils ont un plaisir fou à travailler ensemble.


How will the funds be used?

The Machine de Cirque team includes performers, technical designers (engineer, programmer, technical director) and art designers (staging, choreography, costumes, sets, music).

More funds = more budget for each department. It also means:

— BETTER machines and better-integrated acrobatic structure designed for the tour.

— BETTER staging and a more sophisticated choreography.

— BETTER costumes, sets and music.

Essentially, a BETTER show!


Comment les fonds vont-ils être utilisés?

L'équipe de Machine de Cirque comprend des artistes, des concepteurs techniques (ingénieur, programmeur, directeur technique) et des concepteurs artistiques (mise en scène chorégraphie, costumes, décors, musique). 

Plus de fonds = plus de budget pour chacune des facettes du spectacle. Cela signifie aussi :

— De MEILLEURES machines et des structures acrobatiques mieux intégrées, conçues pour la tournée.

— Une MEILLEURE mise en scène et un travail chorégraphique plus poussé.

— De MEILLEURS costumes, décors et musiques.

Bref, un MEILLEUR spectacle!


Why Should You Trust Us?

Have you already helped finance a project that never came to fruition? That won’t be the case with Machine de Cirque. Whether you help fund this project or not, the show will go ahead and be premiered in Quebec City on May 21, 2015. The venue has been booked and a show will be put on with the available resources.

The team is made up of experienced contributors who know how to repeatedly create shows within the constraints of time and money.

Machine de Cirque already possesses the minimum resources required to create the project. We have already collected 45% of the project’s total budget through grants. Our campaign objective represents 20% of the total cost. This 20% can make all the difference. We have what we need to pay for the boring stuff – studio space, insurance, venues, administration, promotion, etc.

Your contribution will be specifically invested in the quality of the show’s contents (art and technical design, research and development). It will help develop the project’s full potential. It’s that 20% that will allow us to innovate.


Pourquoi nous faire confiance?

Vous avez déjà financé un projet qui n'a pas vu le jour. Ce ne sera pas le cas avec Machine de Cirque. Que vous le financiez ou pas, il y aura un spectacle créé qui sera présenté en première à Québec le 21 mai 2015. La salle est réservée et un spectacle sera livré avec les ressources disponibles.

L'équipe est composée de collaborateurs d'expérience qui ont su créer des spectacles dans les contraintes de temps et d'argent à plusieurs reprises. 

Machine de Cirque dispose déjà des ressources minimales nécessaires pour faire le projet. Nous avons déjà amassé 45% du budget total du projet en subventions. Notre objectif de campagne représente 20 % du projet. Ce 20 % peut faire toute la différence  Nous avons ce qu'il faut pour payer les trucs ennuyeux : locaux, assurances, salles, administration, promotion etc. 

Votre contribution sera investie uniquement sur la qualité du contenu du spectacle (conception artistique et technique, recherche et développement). Elle permettra de développer le projet à son plein potentiel. C'est avec ce 20% que nous pourrons innover.


Projected Project Revenue / Revenus projetés du projet


Projected Project Expenses / Dépenses projetées du projet



What Impact Will Your Contribution Have

Your contribution will make a difference on the show’s impact. With your help Machine de Cirque has better chances of inserting itself into the artistic milieu and tour theaters near you, wherever you live on this planet.

With its great international experience, the Company has all the necessary contact points to reach you, our eager public! But we need help to produce a show that will really stand out.

The success of our first show will allow the Company to develop and invest in other creations. Your contribution can therefore have a long-term impact.


Impact de votre contribution

Votre contribution fera la différence sur l'impact qu'aura ce spectacle. Avec votre aide, Machine de Cirque a beaucoup plus de chances de s’introduire dans le milieu artistique et de faire la tournée des théâtres près de chez vous, où que vous soyez sur la planète.

Par sa grande expérience internationale, la compagnie a tous les contacts nécessaires pour se rendre jusqu’à vous, public impatient! Mais nous avons besoin d’aide pour faire un spectacle qui se démarque vraiment.

Le succès du premier spectacle permettra à la compagnie de se développer et d'investir dans d'autres créations. Votre contribution peut donc avoir un impact à long terme.


Original Perks / Des contreparties uniques




We will produce a 10- to 15-sec video that will be dedicated to you or to a person of your choice and posted on our Facebook page. It may be made by any member of the team. It will include something unusual, and/or impressive, and/or completely surrealistic. See a few samples of dedicated videos 
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFW417fjYcYzhZ5SscAxd_dL8t_dUNTFa

Nous produirons une vidéo de 10 à 15 sec qui te sera dédicacée à toi ou à une personne de ton choix et qui sera publiée sur notre page Facebook. Elle peut être exécuté par n'importe quel membre de l'équipe. Elle comportera quelque chose d'inusité et/ou d'impressionnant et/ou de complètement absurde. Vous pouvez voir les vidéos dédicacées que nous avons réalisé jusqu'à maintenant ici:

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFW417fjYcYzhZ5SscAxd_dL8t_dUNTFa






























Other Ways to Help

Spread the word among your friends. Word of mouth is the best advertising.

Share the link on your social networks.

You can also use the Indiegogo sharing tools.



D'autres façons d'aider

Passez le mot à vos amis. Le bouche à oreille est la meilleur publicité.
Partagez le lien sur vos réseaux sociaux.
Vous pouvez également utiliser les outils de partage de Indiegogo.
story_txt:
Our goal is reached! Thanks to all!  However, we will try to go a little bit further before the end of the campaign. If we get 2500$ more, we will be able to add a complete week of creation with sound and lights; a real theater condition. That for sure will bring the show to a next level.Notre objectif est atteint! Merci à tous! Cependant, nous visons encore un peu plus loin. Si on atteint 2500$ de plus, nous pourrons passer une semaine additionnel de répétition avec toute la technique de son et d'éclairage avant la première. Cela augmentera définitivement la qualité de la conception du spectacle. Machine de Cirque a besoin de votre aide pour créer son premier spectacle de cirque.




Why Machine de Cirque?
Founder Vincent Dubé has been a comedy
and circus performer for nearly 20 years, as well as an engineering graduate. He
is also interested in the percussions he incorporates in his artisitic work. Based
on this diverse expertise, he wants to combine all his passions to create a
unique endeavour – Machine de Cirque.Pourquoi Machine de Cirque?
Le fondateur, Vincent Dubé est un
homme de cirque et de comédie depuis près de 20 ans, et diplômé d'ingénierie.
Il s'intéresse également aux percussions qu'il intègre à son travail artistique. Fort
de ces expériences diverses, il a eu envie de réunir toutes ses passions pour
en faire une créature unique, Machine de Cirque.


Circus and Engineering? Like
Cirque du Soleil?
The engineering team is integral to the
process from the start, which helps incorporate it seamlessly while showcasing
the value of the performers. With only 1% of Cirque du Soleil’s budget, Machine
de cirque has to rely on ingenious solutions, repurposed day-to-day objects,
and contraptions operated with elbow grease – the fuel with the best
quality/cost ratio on the market. This is a human scale project where each of
the five performers occupies a vital place on stage. With a small team, the
artists and art and technical designers can all gather around the drawing board
to produce an unexpected exchange of ideas and astounding results.Cirque et ingénierie? Comme le Cirque du Soleil?L'équipe d'ingénierie est introduite au
processus de création dès le départ, ce qui permet une intégration plus
harmonieuse mettant en valeur les artistes du projet. Avec 1 % du budget
du Cirque du Soleil, Machine de cirque mise sur des solutions ingénieuses, sur
la récupération d'objets de la vie courante, et sur des mécanismes fonctionnant
à l'huile de bras, l'huile avec le meilleur rapport qualité/prix sur le marché.
C'est un projet à grandeur humaine où la personnalité de chacun des cinq
artistes prend une place capitale dans le spectacle. Avec une petite équipe, les
artistes, ainsi que les concepteurs artistiques et techniques peuvent tous être
rassemblés autour de la table à dessin, ce qui engendre des échanges inattendus
et des résultats surprenants.

The Team / L'équipe
RAPHAËL and YOHANN are one of the 10 best juggling acts in the
world in addition to all the other skills they master – artistic bicycling,
acrobatics, unicycling.
And let’s not forget their runaway smash hit
with the Towel Act that was a favourite on YouTube around the world.
RAPHAËL et YOHANN font partie des dix meilleures équipes de jonglerie au monde en plus de toutes les autres disciplines où ils excellent : vélo artistique, acrobatie, monocycle.
Il ne faut pas oublier leur succès retentissant avec leur numéro de serviette qui fait sensation sur YouTube et à travers le monde. 








MAXIM and UGO are a hit wherever they go with their teeter board acrobatics act:
— Gold Medal at the Paris Cirque de Demain Festival
— Gold Medal at Youngstage in Switzerland
MAXIM et UGO font un malheur partout où ils passent grâce à leur numéro de planche coréenne :
— Médaille d'or au Festival de Cirque de Demain à Paris
— Médaille d'or à Youngstage en Suisse

FRÉDÉRIC is a consummate actor, musician and composer, and will soon add new arrows to his quiver with juggling and acrobatics!!

FRÉDÉRIC c'est un acteur, un musicien et un compositeur émérite. Et prochainement, de nouvelles cordes seront ajoutées à son arc : la jonglerie et la haute voltige acrobatique!!




Why are the best performers
joining Machine de Cirque?
Because they believe in the project.
Because they play a large part in the
creation process.
Because they want to explore, innovate and
create a Company with a unique style.
Because they have humongous fun working
together.
Pourquoi les meilleurs artistes se joignent-ils à Machine de Cirque?
Parce qu'ils croient au projet.
Parce qu'ils ont une grande place dans tout le processus de création.
Parce qu'ils veulent explorer, innover et créer une compagnie avec un style unique.
Parce qu'ils ont un plaisir fou à travailler ensemble.






How will the funds be used?
The Machine de Cirque team includes
performers, technical designers (engineer, programmer, technical director) and
art designers (staging, choreography, costumes, sets, music).
More funds = more budget for each department.
It also means:
— BETTER machines and better-integrated
acrobatic structure designed for the tour.
— BETTER staging and a more sophisticated choreography.
— BETTER costumes, sets and music.
Essentially, a BETTER show!
Comment les fonds vont-ils être utilisés?L'équipe de Machine de Cirque comprend des artistes, des concepteurs techniques (ingénieur, programmeur, directeur technique) et des concepteurs artistiques (mise en scène chorégraphie, costumes, décors, musique). 
Plus de fonds = plus de budget pour chacune des facettes du spectacle. Cela signifie aussi :— De MEILLEURES machines et des structures acrobatiques mieux intégrées, conçues pour la tournée.— Une MEILLEURE mise en scène et un travail chorégraphique plus poussé.— De MEILLEURS costumes, décors et musiques.Bref, un MEILLEUR spectacle!

Why Should You Trust Us?
Have you already helped finance a project
that never came to fruition? That won’t be the case with Machine de Cirque. Whether
you help fund this project or not, the show will go ahead and be premiered in
Quebec City on May 21, 2015. The venue has been booked and a show will be put
on with the available resources.
The team is made up of experienced
contributors who know how to repeatedly create shows within the constraints of
time and money.
Machine de Cirque already possesses the
minimum resources required to create the project. We have already collected 45%
of the project’s total budget through grants. Our campaign objective represents
20% of the total cost. This 20% can make all the difference. We have what we
need to pay for the boring stuff – studio space, insurance, venues, administration,
promotion, etc.
Your contribution will be specifically
invested in the quality of the show’s contents (art and technical design, research
and development). It will help develop the project’s full potential. It’s that 20%
that will allow us to innovate.

Pourquoi nous faire confiance?
Vous avez déjà financé un projet qui n'a pas vu le jour. Ce ne sera pas le cas avec Machine de Cirque. Que vous le financiez ou pas, il y aura un spectacle créé qui sera présenté en première à Québec le 21 mai 2015. La salle est réservée et un spectacle sera livré avec les ressources disponibles.L'équipe est composée de collaborateurs d'expérience qui ont su créer des spectacles dans les contraintes de temps et d'argent à plusieurs reprises. Machine de Cirque dispose déjà des ressources minimales nécessaires pour faire le projet. Nous avons déjà amassé 45% du budget total du projet en subventions. Notre objectif de campagne représente 20 % du projet. Ce 20 % peut faire toute la différence  Nous avons ce qu'il faut pour payer les trucs ennuyeux : locaux, assurances, salles, administration, promotion etc. Votre contribution sera investie uniquement sur la qualité du contenu du spectacle (conception artistique et technique, recherche et développement). Elle permettra de développer le projet à son plein potentiel. C'est avec ce 20% que nous pourrons innover.Projected Project Revenue / Revenus projetés du projetProjected Project Expenses / Dépenses projetées du projetWhat Impact Will Your Contribution

The success of our first show will allow the
Company to develop and invest in other creations. Your contribution can
therefore have a long-term impact.
Impact de votre contribution
Votre contribution fera la différence
sur l'impact qu'aura ce spectacle. Avec votre aide, Machine de Cirque a
beaucoup plus de chances de s’introduire dans le milieu artistique et de faire
la tournée des théâtres près de chez vous, où que vous soyez sur la planète.

Par sa grande expérience internationale,
la compagnie a tous les contacts nécessaires pour se rendre jusqu’à vous,
public impatient! Mais nous avons besoin d’aide pour faire un spectacle qui se
démarque vraiment.Le succès du premier spectacle permettra à la compagnie de se développer et d'investir dans d'autres créations. Votre contribution peut donc avoir un impact à long terme.Original Perks / Des contreparties uniques

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFW417fjYcYzhZ5SscAxd_dL8t_dUNTFa

Elle peut être exécuté par n'importe quel membre de l'équipe. Elle comportera quelque chose d'inusité et/ou d'impressionnant et/ou de complètement absurde. http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFW417fjYcYzhZ5SscAxd_dL8t_dUNTFa

story:
Burlesque Hall of Fame Oh My!


Hi! I am BonBon Bombay,The Whimsical Entity. I am an award winning international burlesque artist and I have been accepted to perform in The Burlesque Hall of Fame's  Movers, Shakers and Innovators Showcase this June! This is the highest honour a burlesque artist can receive! I am thrilled! Thousands of people apply but only a few are chosen.

Every year people from all over the world gather under one roof in Las Vegas Nevada to celebrate the history, and artists of the distinctly modern art form of burlesque. The Burlesque Hall of Fame Weekend is a fundraiser, one of the longest running of it's kind, to keep the Burlesque Hall of Fame Museum alive and help many legends that have paved the way. Thus, every performer, competitor or special guest speaker that are chosen to participate must pay for their own transportation, accommodation as well as their weekend passes to all workshops, events and showcases. 

I am looking at a cost of approximately $2250 CAN! Oh my!


Why is this important?

Burlesque is an all encompassing art form that allows the artist & the audience to explore & discover sensuality, freedom of expression,  authenticity and empowerment .

As one of my students so eloquently put it: "C'est l'art de se présenté nu devant la vie!"

In my many years of performing  and teaching, I am amazed by how burlesque can change people's perception of self in a positive way.

By funding this campaign, you are not only helping me to showcase my art but helping The Burlesque Hall of Fame Museum.


THE  COST:

Flight & Medical Insurance: $462.16 CAN
Extra Baggage Fee for props & set pieces:  $100 CAN to go
                                                                                    $100 USD to come back
Hotel: $369.56 USD
BHOF Pass: $280 USD
Taxis to hotel/show venue and back to airport: $100 USD
F&B for 4 days/nights: $300 USD
Revamping certain props & costume pieces for the Vegas stage: $200 CAN

Another Way You Can Help & Be Entertained...!

Come and see BonBon's House of Horrors on Friday May 20th, 2016 at the legendary Wiggle Room. An array of neo-burlesque performers will showcase their  creepiest and strange numbers... with a sexy twist. https://www.facebook.com/events/176756509387377/

Ticket sales from this show will help fund my campaign and you will be titillated all night long!  http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2553952

Please feel free to share this! Thank you!
Peace & Love,
BonBon Bombay- The Whimsical Entity

Perk : Ze BonBon- Autographed Postcard $10 
Art by the talented Eric Scala from France.

Perk: The Cheeky Side of BonBon- 11x17 poster $25

Body Art by Mélanie Bergeron & Photography by Yan Laberge

story:
I'm Christine! 

How much I enjoy producing art pieces would never have been discovered had my physical well being not gone awry while deployed to Iraq. Before I was medically discharged from the Army, I only dabbled in some kind of creativity. Working in ceramics helps with some of the afflictions caused by the stoke I suffered. I also paint, do all forms printmaking and create handmade jewelry. I just can't do one thing. This kiln is dual media! It can change from glass to ceramic with the flip of a switch! 

Art is a way we all can be reminded of the beauty of a life. The moments we each spend on this earth are sacred and my artwork is created to remind others and myself of the beauty that can arise if we simply sense it. 

As a painting major and a ceramics minor, I have worked through my afflictions. I don't want them to be limitations or even memories. I am getting better everyday. I need to keep busy after I earn my degree to maintain and increase the progress I have made physically. Help me do that! 


The kiln is $1420
Kiln Furniture for ceramic & glass is about $200
Certified Electrical work $500


Perks will be sent to you with no additional charge.

story:
"Voices Transposed: The Refugee Crisis," is a benefit performance concert in New York City. Our mission is to provide an accessible venue of discourse on the refugee experience through visual and performing arts by bringing together narratives of refugees and local NYC artists. Our goal is to raise awareness of the refugee humanitarian crisis in Syria and elsewhere, and raise charitable funds through our performances for organizations that will have a positive impact on the lives of refugees.

In order for this performance to take place, we are raising funds to cover the costs of the venue, insurance, as well as marketing fees. Once the initial costs are met, all remaining proceeds will go directly to the USA for UNHCR – the UN Refugee Agency. Participating artists are not receiving stipends from our performance – they are donating their time, effort, and craft to invite and create a dialogue for the displaced voices affected by this global crisis.

Our performances will be held at the Manhattan Movement and Art Center on Friday, June 10th, 2016 at 7pm and Saturday, June 11th, 2016 at 6pm. We have 13 amazing companies presenting their works on these evenings.

In cooperation with USA for UNHCR - the UN Refugee Agency and Refugee Immigrant Fund, we are dedicated to providing our services through art and raising as many charitable funds as we can to aid the many displaced people seeking refuge.

Voices Transposed is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Voices Transposed must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Voices Transposed is only made possible through your donations. 

It takes one voice to make a difference, and one community to create change.


Find out more about our project and participating artists on our website:

www.VoicesTransposed.org

story:
**A big thank you to everyone who has helped fund this exhibition! Please visit CAMH's website for information about more ways you can help support CAMH's education programs and exhibitions.**


Short Summary

The Contemporary Arts Museum Houston’s Teen Council needs your help to fund their upcoming exhibition, From the Margins. Teen Council is group of teenaged art enthusiasts who meet once a week to develop a working knowledge of the behind-the-scenes activities of a museum and organize educational events and performances throughout the year. These change every year, and include art markets, fashion shows, film screenings, music festivals, poetry readings, and listening parties. Members of Teen Council also have the opportunity to participate in several studio, gallery, and museum visits that further exposes them to the dynamic Houston arts community and encourages a greater understanding of the vibrant field of contemporary art.

In order to expose these teens to as much of the curatorial process as possible, Teen Council also has the opportunity to organize a biennial exhibition. This year’s exhibition, From the Margins, will present artworks in a variety of media by Houston-area teens, which will be selected by the Teen Council. From the Margins will include works that speak to the teenaged artists’ experience with or observation of marginalization – considering communities that were once on the fringe that are becoming more mainstream.


Who are we?
Teen council is a group of 12-13 Houston-area teens employed by the museum to curate exhibitions, contribute to outreach and education programs by sharing a teenaged perspective on art, and gain valuable museum experience. CAMH is one of the few museums in the nation with programming directed specifically toward teens, and the only museum in the nation that puts teens directly in the driver's seat.

Our mission:
CAMH is a non-collecting institution dedicated to presenting the best and most exciting international, national, and regional art. CAMH is a leading destination to experience innovative art and actively encourages engagement with its exhibitions by art enthusiasts of all ages through its educational programs, publications, and online resources. Admission to the CAMH is always free.

Our motto:
ALWAYS FRESH, ALWAYS FREE

Impact

According to "Room to Rise: The Lasting Impact of Intensive Teen Programs in Art Museums," a study by the Institute for Museum and Library Sciences,  teen-oriented museum programs have an immense impact on their alumni*:

  • Personal growth and self-knowledge - teens gain a lasting sense of identity, achievement, and empowerment
  • Wide career horizons - these programs expose the teens to new career paths and opportunities
  • Real-world life skills - teens develop useful and transferable skills
  • Transformed relationships with museums - teens gain greater sense of belonging in and appreciation for museums
  • Community engagement and influence - teens more highly value community, collaboration, and diversity
*All information in the above bullet list is cited from the Institute for Museum and Library Sciences study entitled "Room to Rise: The Lasting Impact of Intensive Teen Programs in Art Museums," set to publish later this year.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Exterior and interior signage - $1,630
  • Supplies and materials for installation - $3,370
         TOTAL: $5,000

Thanks to a generous kickstarting donation from Bridget and Patrick Wade, we only need $3,500 more to present the exhibition.

Help Teen Council raise funds to put on a stellar exhibition for YOU and the Houston community - even $10 helps!

What you get:

  • Help foster the creative spirit of Houston-area teens, and help increase their exposure in the Houston art scene
  • Help the members of Teen Council gain valuable knowledge about the inner-workings of museums
  • A signed thank you letter and group photo from the members of Teen Council
  • An invitation to the opening of From the Margins and two drink tickets for the event
  • A CAMH Household membership, valued at $100 (click here for list of benefits)
  • A small original artwork by a Teen Council member
  • Your name in the exhibition catalogue (if donation is received by May 8) and a signed copy of the exhibition catalogue
  • Your name in the credit line of the exhibition title wall
  • A 20% discount at the Museum Store
  • CAMH is an IRS 501(c)(3) organization, so all contributions are tax deductible

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell friends and family about the upcoming exhibition and this campaign
  • Attend the exhibition
  • Post photos of the exhibition to CAMH's Facebook or Twitter pages, or tag us through Instagram at #camh
  • Visit CAMH - we are ALWAYS FREE!

CAMH AND THE TEEN COUNCIL THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT OF THE EXHIBITION!

once a week to develop a working knowledge of the behind-the-scenes activities
of a museum and organize educational events and performances throughout the
year. These change every year, and include art markets, fashion shows, film
screenings, music festivals, poetry readings, and listening parties. Members of
Teen Council also have the opportunity to participate in several studio,
gallery, and museum visits that further exposes them to the dynamic Houston
arts community and encourages a greater understanding of the vibrant field of
contemporary art.
In order to expose these teens to as much of the
curatorial process as possible, Teen Council also has the opportunity to organize
a biennial exhibition. This year’s exhibition, From the Margins, will present artworks in a variety of media by
Houston-area teens, which will be selected by the Teen Council. From the Margins will include works that
speak to the teenaged artists’ experience with or observation of
marginalization – considering communities that were once on the fringe that
are becoming more mainstream. Who are we?Teen council is a group of 12-13 Houston-area teens employed by the museum to curate exhibitions, contribute to outreach and education programs by sharing a teenaged perspective on art, and gain valuable museum experience. CAMH is one of the few museums in the nation with programming directed specifically toward teens, and the only museum in the nation that puts teens directly in the driver's seat.Our mission:CAMH is a non-collecting institution dedicated to presenting the best and most exciting international, national, and regional art. CAMH is a leading destination to experience innovative art and actively encourages engagement with its exhibitions by art enthusiasts of all ages through its educational programs, publications, and online resources. Admission to the CAMH is always free.Our motto:ALWAYS FRESH, ALWAYS FREE  
Impact
According to "Room to Rise: The Lasting Impact of Intensive Teen Programs in Art Museums," a study by the Institute for Museum and Library Sciences,  teen-oriented museum programs have an immense impact on their alumni*:



Personal growth and self-knowledge - teens gain a lasting sense of identity, achievement, and empowerment

Wide career horizons - these programs expose the teens to new career paths and opportunities

Real-world life skills - teens develop useful and transferable skills

Transformed relationships with museums - teens gain greater sense of belonging in and appreciation for museums

Community engagement and influence - teens more highly value community, collaboration, and diversity

*All information in the above bullet list is cited from the Institute for Museum and Library Sciences study entitled "Room to Rise: The Lasting Impact of Intensive Teen Programs in Art Museums," set to publish later this year.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need:


Exterior and interior signage - $1,630
Supplies and materials for installation - $3,370
         TOTAL: $5,000Thanks to a generous kickstarting donation from Bridget and Patrick Wade, we only need $3,500 more to present the exhibition.Help Teen Council raise funds to put on a stellar exhibition for YOU and the Houston community - even $10 helps!What you get:




Help foster the creative spirit of Houston-area teens, and help increase their exposure in the Houston art scene
Help the members of Teen Council gain valuable knowledge about the inner-workings of museums
A signed thank you letter and group photo from the members of Teen Council
An invitation to the opening of From the Margins and two drink tickets for the event
A CAMH Household membership, valued at $100 (click here for list of benefits)
A small original artwork by a Teen Council member
Your name in the exhibition catalogue (if donation is received by May 8) and a signed copy of the exhibition catalogue
Your name in the credit line of the exhibition title wall
A 20% discount at the Museum Store
CAMH is an IRS 501(c)(3) organization, so all contributions are tax deductible





Other Ways You Can Help 

Tell friends and family about the upcoming exhibition and this campaign
Attend the exhibition
Post photos of the exhibition to CAMH's Facebook or Twitter pages, or tag us through Instagram at #camh
Visit CAMH - we are ALWAYS FREE!


CAMH AND THE TEEN COUNCIL THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT OF THE EXHIBITION!

story:
My name is Margaret, a senior sculpture major at Milwaukee Institute of Art and Design. I'm creating a rather ambitious thesis project that I'm extremely excited for. The process has been extremely rewarding, taking my conversations as an artist to the Architectural Review Board of the Third Ward, MIADs president, and many faculty members where I have the opportunity to learn their take on the physical and conceptual values of public art. 

This project really means a lot to me; there are two sides to it, one that faces Highway 32 on the east side of the building and a separate interior view facing my fourth floor thesis space. 

Unfortunately, within my learning of city regulations, there is a specific type of insurance restricting anyone with a cherry picker to hang a sign. This is understandable, I want my piece to be installed and de-installed as safe as possible.

The total cost of getting it up and down a few weeks later is $4000. Luckily, the school decided to chip in with extra thesis funds but it still leaves a lot to be covered on my part. This does not include cost of material or my other smaller projects. 

I would really appreciate help, I know I have peers struggling in the same sort of sense with funds for their work but if you could chip in $5 that would be fantastic. Everything counts. 


MIAD 2015 Senior Exhibition
April 17 - May 9
All MIAD Galleries
Opening Reception: Gallery Night, Friday, April 17, 5 - 9 p.m.
Gallery Day Conversations, Saturday, April 18, 1 - 5 p.m.

story:
Canada is expensive!

With my recent move to Vancouver, BC to attend art school, I've realized this big city is a lot more expensive than the smaller town I grew up in. 

  • I want to take this opportunity to practice as much as I can, whilst providing YOU with a one of a kind piece to cherish forever!
  • My lovely parents have supported me and my art ever since I can remember, and I owe to them to show my dedication to my career (and maybe a little paycheck.) 
  • Not only will you have an AWESOME ONE OF A KIND DRAWING, but you'll be able to show your friends, get them jealous, and rub in their face that it was the best $10-$30 you had ever spent! 

What I want to make for YOU!

What to do! 
Email me your request at leahsamuels5@gmail.com. Include pictures or a detailed description of what you want! After I confirm your request, you can contribute to this indiegogo campaign with a name that you include in the email. Thank you!

story:
Residency at theAmsterdam Grafisch Atelier

Hey there, internet!

My name's Kimberly and I recently got accepted to complete a residency at the Amsterdam Grafisch Atelier in... well, Amsterdam! This is a huge opportunity for my artistic career; I just graduated art school and this will give me a really important opportunity to immerse myself in artistic research for a month. This really is allowing me to kick-start my career as an artist.

During the residency I am going to explore how to combine sculptural practices with the 2 dimensional world of printmaking. I want to print on various surfaces and use various sculptural practices to draw out that print into a three-dimensional form.

"But why do you need funding?"

Well, you see I got accepted last minute to do the residency, meaning I found out at the end of June that I will be going there for September 1st. This gives me two months to save up thousands of dollars with my part-time, minimum wage job. While I expect I will be able to save some money over the two months, I am financially independent (meaning I pay rent, food, everything myself) and I am looking to other sources for funding. If all else fails I will take out a small loan, but I really abhor being in debt. If my funds are raised, they will go to two things specifically:

My flight, 1000: Flights from Toronto to Amsterdam and back, (especially when last minute) will probably cost me about $850-$1000, according to my research. I budgeted 1000 because I also know that indiegogo skims about 4-9% off the money you raise in order to pay for the website.

My Studio Fee, 750: The studio fee is 550 euro, which translates to about $750 CAD. This covers studio costs for the month, the provided accomodation, and some materials.

Extra Funds: If I manage to raise extra funds somehow, I would first jump up and down for joy, and then I would spend them on such neccesities as:

  • Food
  • Travel Insurance
  • Extra Supplies (Paper, ink)
  • Covering rent while I am gone

"What do I get for helping?"

Well, my dear madam or sir! Any contribution helps, and will recieve my deepest gratitude. A minimum donation of 10$ will get you a pretty nifty postcard (see http://postcarddiary.tumblr.com for postcards I have sent previously), and the list goes on! From original prints to silkscreened shirts to zines, check the listing on the side over there for the perks!

"But I have no money."

Man, I TOTALLY understand that sentiment. If you have no money, you can still help by sharing my campaign! Tell your friends! Tell your RICH friends! Spread the word, ladies and gentlemen! <3 I would be so grateful.

"Okay, but like what kind of work do you do?"

Of course! Up until now, my current body of work has been focused around the representation of insects. Insects have become a metaphor for fears to me, as I used to be terribly afraid and revulsed by them. Around September 2012 I started to use them as my subject matter. When you draw something, you objectify it, it becomes less symbolic of something scary and becomes a conglomeration of lines, dots, shapes, forms. You learn to see the beauty in a thing, when you draw it.

Simultaneously, I began a project in street art, a medium which both fascinated me and scared me. Going out at night alone when you're a lady is scary, especially when you frequent run down and abandoned buildings. I began to wheatpaste prints of insects to the construction and abandoned walls of my city. Wheatpaste is a simple, organic paste made from flour, sugar, and water, which causes no damage to buildings and which small insects like to sometimes eat.

To see the products of this body of work (and also some other stuff) check out my tumblr http://paper-bug.tumblr.com . For work previous to this body of work, check out this other tumblr: http://kimdoesart.tumblr.com .

"Well okay. What other details should I know?"

Know that if you donate or even just share this campaign with your friends, you are helping an emerging artist get a foot-hold in her career! Know that I love you! Know that this year is the year that the cicada which only comes out every 17 years is emerging from the ground! That has to be good luck or something.

story:
What is Free Range Art?

Last year, Fusebox launched Free Range Art to make the festival entirely free to attend. Doing so allowed us to spark a larger conversation about some things that we wanted to talk about like:

ACCESS - We believe everyone should have access to the art we are presenting.

DISCOVERY - Going free is also a strategy to encourage people to take a risk on artists that may not be familiar to them.

ECONOMICS - We’re certainly not suggesting this work is free to make. Quite the contrary. So let’s talk about the real cost of making this art. And how do we as a community want to pay for it?

We learned a lot from our first year of Free Range. Pretty exciting stuff:

  • 60% increase in first-time festival goers
  • Overall attendance was up 20%
  • People, on average, attended twice as many events
  • The initiative sparked conversations locally, nationally, and internationally


Doing it all again

So, here we are--one year later and we’re doing it again. We always felt like we needed to try this initiative for at least three years to really understand what and how Free Range Art is doing to boost attendance and engagement in the festival. 

This campaign will play a giant role in making the 2015 Fusebox Festival happen. We really need your help.  Consider these fine bullet points:

  • We have 3 weeks to raise at least $30,000 (that's just $1 for every person who attended the 2014 Fusebox Festival).
  • 100% of the funds from this campaign will go to support artists featured in the 2015 Fusebox Festival.
  • There are perks of course: advance reservations, swag, art, eats & drinks, and more.
  • You truly play an integral role in bringing artists from all over the world to Austin every spring. 


12 days of visionary art - totally free of charge

We are presenting projects large and small at The Long Center, Salvage Vanguard, Off Center, Ground Floor Theatre, The Contemporary, Blanton, as well as galleries and sites, and spaces all over the city. As we type, we are lining-up another great year of dance, film, theater, robots, music, rum drinks, fashion shows, chats, and waffles. The full line-up will be announced in January 2015. 

Wait there's more! Folded into the 2015 Festival is our thinkEAST project - an innovative, participatory imagining and planning process for a creative community in East Austin. Read more about that HERE. 

Fusebox receives important support from the likes of the City of Austin, Texas Commission on the Arts, National Endowment for the Arts, foundations like ArtPlace America, New England Foundation for the Arts, and National Performance Network; BUT true community, grass-roots, support from individuals like you are what will make Free Range Art and the 2015 Fusebox Festival successful.


Respect the Reservation

Just like last year, you will be able to make advance reservations in our free festival model. This is important to us. However, also like last year, we will be continuing our Respect The Reservation campaign. You can read more about it HERE. In short, we want you to be able to plan your festival experience and have the best time possible, but we also ask that you don’t over-book and flake out on shows that you have reservations for as there are other people in the community that would like to go. Respect the Reservation!


Biggest. Boldest. Ever.

The 2015 Fusebox Festival will be our most ambitious undertaking in our 11-year history.  And baked into the festival this year are challenges and risk the likes we have never experienced. Which is exactly the way we like it! We feel it's our job to constantly push and challenge not just our artists and audiences - but us as an organization as well. So be our enablers. Help us take on huge ideas and bold challenges around art, community and creativity. We are going to share with you what we learn, and we genuinely want to hear your thoughts and feedback along the way. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, this is a crowd funding page and some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us.

  • Volunteer for the festival (more on that HERE).
  • Help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing links, messages, or plain peer pressure.
  • Attend the Fusebox Festival - we genuinely need financial support, but the most important outcome for a free festival is that everyone feels welcome to engage as much as they like without cost acting as a barrier.
Join us in Free Range Art 2015.

Join us in Free Range Art 2015.

story:
I am a graduate student at the School of the Museum of Fine Arts Boston and a teaching assistant for the class entitled "Arts, Resilience, and Social Activism." I am traveling trip to Ghana to work with the amazing organization Cross Cultural Collaborative to run an art workshop for the children of Nungua.  The skills they learn and projects they complete can be sold to help with their school tuition. This is a great way for students to embrace creativity and personal expression while learning sustainable skills that will support them. 

My conversations with Ellie Shimelman, the director of the program, have given me many ideas about projects to do at the Cultural center. Most of these will utilize the materials that are available in Ghana, many of which are recycled. One of the more plentiful resources is black plastic bags, which we will be using in various means of weaving and fusing to make reusable bags and other items. 

I have received a grant from the SMFA to cover my flight to Ghana. I would like to raise funds to bring supplies to the cultural center. They have limited art supplies and resource materials and I would love to be able to bring some necessary basics. If the students wish to do art in school, they are responsible for buying their own supplies which most cannot afford to do. Please specify with your donation what you would like the funds to be used for!


Here is what your donation will provide:

$100 printer ink
                     Ink is hard to find there, expensive, and dries out quickly due to the high heat
$100 paint and art supplies 
                     The youth have very few supplies to work with. Mostly crayons :(
$100 paper
                     Ellie says they go through paper like crazy!
$300 silk screen supplies
                     I will be teaching the youth how to silkscreen so that they can design t-shirts to sell
$200 secondhand or new t-shirts 
                     For the youth to print on and wear or sell
$200 extra bag fee
                     We have a donation of 4 laptops and other art supplies and believe it or not, this is the cheapest way to get supplies to Ghana.




Here is some information on the Cross Cultural Collaborative: 

"Cross Cultural Collaborative, Inc. is a non-profit educational organization that promotes cultural exchange and understanding. Our programs emphasize multigenerational and multicultural collaborations encouraging participants to find rewards in different forms of creativity. We bring artists from different cultures together in a supportive environment where they can get to know each other through the language of art. At the core of our program is the belief that interaction between African and non-African artists enriches the creativity of both groups.


CCC, Inc. invites artists and scholars from all over the world to work with Ghanaians on collaborative projects that range from mosaic walls to documentary films. Most visitors to Ghana have only a superficial connection with the people. We find that by bringing people to live and work at CCC, Inc. we break down stereotypical thinking. Our participants form lasting friendships and come to appreciate not only other cultures, but their own as well.
Visitors have an opportunity to be immersed in a spiritual culture grounded in tradition where art is part of everyday life. 
The children live in the fishing village of Nungua and come to our cultural center to interact with and learn from visiting artists. We teach them that there are no limits to creativity and offer a safe, nurturing, learning environment.
The children make paper from sugar cane leaves and other local plants and then create books, cards, diaries etc.
Proceeds from sales are used to pay for school related expenses."

(crossculturalcollaborative.org)

story:
If you missed getting your Oracle deck during the Indiegogo fundraising please visit  EcoHeartOracle.com to order the Oracle, or iPhone/Samsung Galaxy covers, signed art prints, art cards and more! Also check out our Etsy store EcoHeartDesign  (open in late April/14)


A huge thank you to all of the supporters of the Eco Heart Oracle! Thank you for helping to bring the deck and its messages from nature and spirit forward!

Eco Heart Oracle Decks are scheduled to be shipped in early June.

iPhone covers will be shipped in early May.

Art prints and cards will be shipped in late April, or sooner.

Thank you again for supporting the Eco Heart Oracle!


***

The Eco Heart Oracle is a 48 card oracle deck created by Ingrid Koivukangas, an environmental artist who works intuitively with site energies, dreams and deep meditations to create art that reconnects people back to the Earth and Nature. The cards come directly from her experiences working at sites and have been in progress for over 15 years. 

The intention in creating the cards is to bring forward messages from nature spirits and animal and plant messengers - and through the process to bring users a new awareness, and understanding of, their connections to nature and the unseen animal and spirit worlds.

The deck includes 48 full colour cards, a guidebook and box. The guidebook includes mythological and symbolic meanings for each subject plus messages received during deep meditations for each individual card.

Choose to use the Oracle for a one card reading for daily guidance or to access a quick answer to your question. You can also use the Oracle for a more in-depth reading using one of the suggested methods in the guidebook.

For each deck sold a tree will be planted - trees can be dedicated.

Please check the Gallery tab for video updates. The latest video was added on March 24th - the sample decks from the printer have arrived!


About the Eco Heart Oracle Deck

My name is Ingrid Koivukangas and I'm an environmental artist. My work is about reconnecting people back to the Earth and Nature. I work at sites directly with, and in response to, site energies through intuition, dreams and deep meditations. You can view my work, artist statement and CV at www.Ingrid-Koivukangas.com The Eco Heart Oracle deck has been in process over the last 15 years, the cards are my way of bringing forward and sharing messages and information from the natural world.

All of our ancient ancestors understood that we are all deeply inter-connected and intertwined with everything and every living being in the natural world. My hope through creating these cards is to provide a way for users to access these deep and sacred memories that we each carry within us. The Earth and all her creatures desperately need us to remember, and honour, the sacred connections we share with all living beings. 

It's really important for me that with each project I work on I'm giving back, with that in mind, for each Oracle deck sold a tree will be planted. I'm also a supporter of Kiva and partial proceeds from the sale of these cards will go towards funding micro loans in developing countries.

48 Oracle Cards

The artwork for the 48 card deck is complete and the deep meditations for each piece have begun. These meditations along with direct experiences working at sites with each of the beings represented in each card will be included in the guide booklet that is included with each boxed deck.

For those of you who like to pull a card to answer a question, or get a feeling for a situation, each of the oracle cards will include a word or phrase to give quick access to the meaning of the card.

The cards are also available as signed 5x7 archival prints (with or without the gold card frame and name) or in sets of four art cards with envelopes in different perk packages.


How you can help and what you'll get

The cost of printing and shipping the 48 card decks, the corresponding instruction book and lidded box is very expensive. I really need your help to do the next part of this project.

I've put together some perks that I trust will inspire you. If you'd like to see a perk added please message me. A special Thank You page will be created for the project and will include all supporter's names. 

The perks include:

$10 - A thank you card chosen especially for you from the oracle deck. The signed card will be mailed to you and can be framed.

$25 - Your choice of a 5x7 archival art print OR a set of four Oracle art cards with envelopes.

$40 - Your choice of an iPhone 4/4s or 5/5s or Samsung Galaxy SIII hardcase.

$45 - An Eco Heart Oracle Deck with a thank you Oracle post card. A tree will also be planted in your name. My cost to ship in North American is $15 and included.*

$65 - An Eco Heart Oracle Deck with a thank you Oracle post card. A tree will also be planted in your name. My cost to ship Internationally is $30 are included.*

$85 - An Eco Heart Oracle Deck with thank you Oracle post card AND a 5x7 archival art print AND a set of four art cards with envelopes. A tree will also be planted in your name. Shipping worldwide is included. *

$125 - An Eco Heart Oracle Deck with thank you Oracle post card AND a 5x7 archival art print AND a set of four art cards with envelopes PLUS a custom iPhone cover with your choice of Oracle image. A tree will also be planted in your name. Shipping worldwide is included. *

* Please note that shipping rates with Canada Post are very expensive - the cost of shipping is included in the different levels.


Funds raised

All of the funds raised will go towards the printing costs only. The campaign goal does not include any fee for my time for creating the art or designing the deck. 

If the campaign goal is not met then a smaller quantity of cards will be ordered. An alternate printer has already been sourced that can print smaller runs of the decks.

Everyone who purchases an Oracle deck will receive one.

The sample decks from the printer have arrived!
Check out the video: Printer Update - March 24th


Planting a forest together

For each Eco Heart Oracle deck sold a tree will be planted in the Boreal Forest in northern Canada. The boreal forest is the largest biome on Earth and stretches around the northern parts of North America and Eurasia. It makes up one of the largest forest ecosystems on the planet and provides homes for many different species of wildlife, birds, insects and amphibians. Approximately one third of this boreal forest is within Canada's borders. The Canadian Boreal Forest is used by nearly half of all of the birds in North America each year and contains wetlands that filter millions of litres of water each day. You can read more about the Boreal Forest here: Hinterland Who's Who - Canada's Boreal Forest

Choose a perk that includes the oracle deck and you will receive a coupon to 'plant' your tree in the Eco Heart Forest which is a virtual forest, that corresponds to an actual forest and a real live tree planting. You will be able to dedicate your tree and/or leave a message with your virtual planting. You can then visit your tree online in the Eco Heart Forest as well as share the link via Facebook, Twitter, email link or other social media. 


My related projects

I've been successful in previous projects I've worked on - please see my artists website and CV: www.Ingrid-Koivukangas.com

As an artist working through galleries I felt that I wasn't reaching enough people with my messages from the natural world. I feel a great sense of urgency to share and begin dialogues with people. This is why I've created the Eco Heart Oracle deck.

I've also recently started www.EcoHeartRetreats.com offering virtual retreats reconnecting people back to the Earth - these one day retreats can be done from anywhere in the world. 

I believe in giving back and sharing and that together we can create change in our lives and in the world. I began publishing Eco Heart Magazine in 2013 as another way of giving back - I was a designer working in print media before becoming an artist. The magazine is about spirituality, art, environment and healing and shares articles from, and about, people working in different ways and modalities who are creating positive heart-centered change in the world. Please sign up for your free subscription here: Eco Heart Magazine - Suscribe


Other ways you can help

Please share the Eco Heart Oracle deck campaign with your friends and family - it's easy using the Indiegogo share tools! 

Together we can create change!


Love and Light ~ Thank You!

story:
About the Program

For the last 18 years, Meridian Gallery has employed hundreds of low-income, minority teens from all over San Francisco as part of its Meridian Interns Program (MIP). Our young interns, aged 14-17, meet everyday after school and throughout the summer to work as artists-in-training, learning to paint, draw, sculpt, carve, and create printed artworks in the gallery’s on-site studio. That’s right – they’re paid to make art! Taught by professional artist instructors (some of whom are former interns themselves), these teens gain invaluable work experience and professional skills within the setting of a non-profit, contemporary art gallery. But as Meridian Gallery faces the threat of eviction, the future of MIP is in jeopardy. Please help us keep this important program alive, and in turn, support the burgeoning young artist community of San Francisco.

MIP is not only a great part-time job for low-income teens (whose families often depend on them for their financial contributions), it's also an educational program that prepares them for future employment. MIP offers our young interns academic and career counseling as well as the opportunity to develop valuable social skills (critical thinking, literacy, verbal and visual communication, team work, discipline) and transferable job skills (use of computer graphics programs and desktop publishing tools, publication writing, gallery maintenance, installation of shows, and financial literacy). It is our goal to help these kids prepare for the future, and have fun doing it.

At the end of every term, the interns organize and install their own show at the Meridian Gallery so that they can share their creations with the world. (In fact, their latest exhibition, Toward a Natural World: Exploring Indigenous Cultures and Native Plants of the Coastal Bay Area, is on display until Friday, August 22. Come check it out!) They also produce an annual “zine,” or do-it-yourself magazine, which features all of their favorite artworks and commemorates social highlights from the year, including holiday celebrations and field trips to nearby art galleries, museums, and parks. The young interns are also very involved in local community work, beautifying San Francisco by restoring murals and planting gardens.

Shument Cheng, Miwok Roundhouse, 2014. This painting was made by one of our interns during a field trip to the 34th Annual Big Time Festival, a cultural celebration hosted by the Coast Miwok.

Here are the interns, artist instructors, and co-founders Anne Brodzky and Anthony Williams at our annual Bread Bake event. Every year, the kids visit the Headlands Center for the Arts and learn to make delicious homemade bread in their brick oven. 

The annual zine includes personal essays about the young interns' experiences in the Meridian Interns Program. In this year's publication (front cover, left) includes Gabi's testimonial (right).


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $50,000 to keep the Meridian Interns Program alive. 

The majority of the funds, $40,000, will be used to secure a new lease so that the youth interns can stay in their studio here at Meridian Gallery for years to come. This location is so important to the success of the program for a number of reasons: 
1) It is easily accessible from all over the city, making MIP available to all low-income teenagers with a passion for art;
2) It is nearby many galleries, museums, and cultural centers, giving kids who might not otherwise have an opportunity to visit these art and educational institutions a chance to learn and be inspired;
3) It houses an on-site studio fully equipped with art supplies, cooking facilities, and desktop computers for graphic design projects. This studio was installed by co-founders Anne Brodzky and Anthony Williams in 2007, when they renovated the Victorian building's unused basement with the help of MIP interns. 


The Meridian Interns Program's studio is housed in the lowest level of the Meridian Gallery, located in a beautiful Victorian building at 535 Powell Street, just two blocks from San Francisco's historic Union Square.


The remaining $10,000 will support the program itself. This will be used to:
- Pay the youth interns and their artist instructors
- Buy healthy food for snacks and meals prepared in the studio kitchen
- Buy art supplies and equipment
- Cover the costs of installing and promoting exhibitions
- Fund field trips to art galleries, museums, parks and cultural centers
- Produce the annual MIP zine, the "Megazine"
- Provide all interns with memberships to the de Young Museum

MIP interns prepare everyday meals and special treats - like apple pie - in the studio's kitchenette. 


Ensuring the Future of MIP

The Meridian Interns Program has operated successfully for 18 years. We have a wonderful and dedicated staff of professional artist instructors, centrally-located and well-stocked facilities, and years of experience teaching our paid interns to create unique artworks. Given adequate funding, we will no doubt be able to continue our mission of supporting youth arts education in San Francisco. 
The biggest threat to the Meridian Interns Program is that of eviction. If we do not raise the $50,000 necessary to secure a new lease to stay in our current building, the program, and all of its participants, will be displaced. This would present a huge challenge to MIP, as we would have to find, secure, and move into a new studio space, which would be a very difficult, time-consuming and expensive endeavor in the increasingly competitive San Franciscan commercial real estate market. 
We need your help to stay in our beloved building. This alone will ensure the stability of the Meridian Interns Program. Help us keep this amazing program alive.

    Spread the Word!

    Any and all contributions will help us achieve our goal of continuing the Meridian Interns Program in its current home. But there are other ways you can help! Please share this campaign with family and friends, and anyone who loves the arts and youth education. Post this to Facebook, send a tweet, spread the word!

    The Meridian Interns thank you for your support!

story:
Our Story

My name is Robbie Chanin and I am looking to raise 30 grand to build an art gallery called: 'Glitter Gallery'. 

Glitter Gallery has funding for gallery space in San Francisco, California.  Robbie is networking to raise $30,000 to stock the in-house artist's studio with art supplies as well as defray the costs of renovation when the gallery space is acquired.  Robbie is a deaf lipreader who uses glitter to share his view..


"Glitter saved my life," he says.


The Impact

Attended Gallaudet University School For the Deaf and Blind in Washington, D.C, Robbie has sold over 500 paintings in the short span since he began painting.  Today, he offers you a proposition for your help to make his dreams come true.


What We Need & What You Get

Willing to cut costs wherever it's necessary to raise the roof of Glitter Gallery.  Volunteers have come forward to offer expertise and financial planning.  Philip has only money through investors to purchase a gallery but not enough for in-house artist's studio art supplies and renovation to suit the aesthetic vision that will one day be Glitter Gallery.


Other Ways You Can Help

If anyone interested in investing into a minority-owned business or friends and artist who love to follow new work, please forward or share this with them.  There are lots of handmade original rewards created exclusively by the artist, Robbie Chanin.

story:
Hi, I'm Sean Stevens. I apologize if this fundrauser is a bit barebones... lots to do and not much time to do it.

I've been making High Impact, alternative energy art for the past 5 years or so.

I try to create things that bring people together to create a bigger experience.

My most successful example so far is Sustainable Sound, the Bike Pedal Powered Sound System.

it's been to Burning Man, Occupy Boston, Firefly, Figment Boston, Food not Bombs, Honk! and tens of smaller events.

A version also tours with Melodeego, www.melodeego.com, who are amazingly talented musicians.

There was even a story about us on NPR:

http://www.wbur.org/2011/03/25/bike-powered-concerts

Two years ago I created lowRes, an extension of Sustainbale Sound which turned it into a vehicle.

If you fund Sustainable Sound Burning Man 2012+Decom we can:

  • Build Two New Pedal benches - 30%+ more efficient and lighter weight!
  • Drivetrain V3 for... Hopefully being way more efficient moving
  • Misc other mechanical and electrical upgrades
  • Transportation To Burning Man for the project
  • Transportation from Burning Man to San Francisco
  • A month or so of Storage in SF

The first planned SF event is San Francisco Decompression in early October (Still pending getting in touch with organizers etc)... Hoping to do at least one event every few months in SF to start.

Anyways, long story short - Please help me make this happen :)

It's a little last minute & smaller scale than the last few years but I am incredibly excited to share Sustainable Sound with San Francisco for the first time, and Burning man once more.

I've been trying to launch Sustainable Sound in San Francisco (And Oakland!) for the past few years and I think this is the right time!

Please consider contributing early as I have arranged to borrow the money as it comes in so I can do the work in time for the Burning Man truck load. Anything addtional will go toward continued expansion of the project both in San Francisco and Boston areas.

Anyways, long story short - Please help me make this happen :)
It's a little last minute & smaller scale than the last few years but I am incredibly excited to share Sustainable Sound with San Francisco for the first time, and Burning man once more.
I've been trying to launch Sustainable Sound in San Francisco (And Oakland!) for the past few years and I think this is the right time!
Please consider contributing early as I have arranged to borrow the money as it comes in so I can do the work in time for the Burning Man truck load. Anything addtional will go toward continued expansion of the project both in San Francisco and Boston areas.

story:
It's me, an artist with a great passion and even bigger dreams

Hi there, Let me introduce myself:

My name is Brenda Meelker, a female digital artist from The Netherlands.

Embrision Arts is my artistname.

It was in 2008 that I was in need of some distraction and opened one of the First Photoshop elements software that I got from my dad.

A bit of experimenting eventually leed to a revelation of my creativity and a true passion began.

Nowadays, I’m a professional digital artist who is trying to expand her career by working for publishers and attending exhibitions. I've done a couple of projects so far but It doesn’t pay my bills yet.

I’m also working as a registered nurse to tie loose ends.

 

If you like to see all of my art, please go over here:

http://embrisionarts.deviantart.com/gallery/

 

       My dream, my digital art adventure in New York

I have attended some exhibitions in my own country, but I never had the opportunity to be part of a Group exhibition in a foreign country.

The company Basak Malone recently invited me to be part of such a great project: A publication in the second edition of the New Collectors book and a Group exhibition in conjunction with this second edition.

The exhibition will take place from 5 till 18 January 2013 in the Ward Nasse Gallery in New York.

I can fund the participation of the publication and exhibition myself, but it will be difficult for me to finance my attendance for a couple of days in New York

You could help me finance my stay in New York to be phycically present at the exhibition.

This is something that is very important to me and really a dream come true.

   

                     Longing Worlds: Voyage to the beauty of nature

 

         What would you fund and what will you get in return

                                      Funding:

-The return flight from Amsterdam airport to New York.

-The stay in a middle class hotel.

All funding will go to the trip, even if I don’t make it to my goal. All money is welcome.

All extra funding will go to the transportation of my art to NY (this costs about 500 euro, incl. insurance).

 

                                      In return:

A lot of gratitude and of course the perks!

If I succeed in achieving my goal:

I will create an exclusive artwork for one of the donators. The selected person will receive a high resolution file of the creation.

This only applies when more than 10 people have contributed.

 

                             What It means to me

I can ship all of my works to New York and watch all the photo’s of the exhibition in my little room in Holland afterwards, but I rather be physically a part of this wonderful adventure.

I would love to have the ability to actually talk about my work to the visitors in the gallery and be able to network with the people from the industry.

It’s eventually a great way to expand my career and It would be a great reward for all the hard work and passion I’ve put in my art so far.

                                 

                                   Spread the word

Not able to help me financially?  You are doing me a big favor by spreading the word and make people aware of my dream.

Remember to use the share tools at Indiegogo as well.

 

          Many, many thanks in advance for your support!

 

                 My latest personal work: As the story unfolds
