story:
wall [wawl]-noun- any of various upright constructions having a continuous surface.

therapy [ther-uh-pee]-noun- some remedial rehabilitating or curative process.

WALL\THERAPY [wawl.ther-uh-pee]-noun- a public community-level intervention using mural art as a vehicle to address our collective need for inspiration.

WALL\THERAPY Campaign [wawl.ther-uh-pee kam-ˈpān ]-noun- An opportunity to fund even more amazing artists to add their imagery to the walls here in Rochester in 2014. 

In 2013, we helped to shine a positive light on Rochester and its ability to inspire and create. Once again, the Image Capital of the World was in the headlines in all around the world. News outlets and blogs in both hemispheres were clamoring for the opportunity to share photos and stories of the masterful images being created in our city. The artists' work not only gained international attention, but WALL\THERAPY fulfilled its true purpose, as it beautified our urban landscape and inspired dialogue amongst Rochester citizens, and in doing so helped connect distinct areas separated by class and culture, helping to improve our community.

Over 50 articles were written about the event, including in the Huffington Post, Juxtapoz, Brooklyn Street Art, Arrested Motion, 12oz Prophet, Vandalog, and our own CITY and Democrat and Chronicle. You can check out a few here, or see the full list over on our website:

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jaime-rojo-steven-harrington/wall-therapy-street-art-f_b_3679711.html

http://www.juxtapoz.com/tag/wall-therapy

http://www.rochestercitynewspaper.com/rochester/worlds-collide-on-walls-walltherapy-2013/Content?oid=2247008

http://www.democratandchronicle.com/article/20130719/NEWS01/307190022/Wall-Therapy-rochester-mural

Full Recap here:
http://wall-therapy.com/walltherapy-2013-media-recap/

The 2013 WALL\THERAPY event was something never before seen in Rochester. Over 30 world renown artists from across the globe came together to create unique and elegant works of art on various walls all over the city. In span of a week Rochester gained over 60 new murals in locations throughout the city, in neighborhoods including the South Wedge and near the El Camino Trail. These paintings varied in size from only a few feet long to creations over 4 stories. By the end of Fall 2013, we had 35 muralists join us in all. All of this was created thanks to financial and volunteer donations from you, our supporters.

We are asking again for assistance to continuing this forward momentum, to continue to bring unique artists to our city to help inspire and to heal. Your continued support will allow us to purchase the paint and supplies, rent the lifts and ladders needed to support the local and international artists as they produce visually compelling murals in the Rochester cityscape, in turn improving and strengthening our thriving community. 

______________________________________________________________

What your donation means directly to the cause: 

For every $15 you donate, we can afford an artist with 3 cans of spray paint. To show you how much that matters, we offer a set of die cut stickers to those giving $15 or more! 

For every $25 you donate the money goes for 4-5 cans of spray paint or a gallon bucket of primer 

For every $50 that means we can purchase paint brushes, rollers, buckets and cover other supply expenses. 

Donations of $150 or more helps the team supply the artist with food and water as they paint their murals (wouldn't you like to be the person that helped sponsor an artist from Europe to have their first garbage plate!?)

Donations of $500 or more helps us rent a mechanical lift for the week, and our artists don’t have to stand precariously on a ladder to paint their work.

Should you donate $1000, that money goes directly to plane tickets and any sort of car rental needed for the artists

If you donate $5000 ,you are not just solidifying WALL\THERAPY this year and becoming a producer of this event, but you will be instrumental in helping us start focusing on the humanitarian endeavor and sister initiative known as IMPACT! 


Read below to learn more:

As the artists visit and help our city heal through images, they are also taking back with them the understanding of what they can do to help communities in a global fashion. As WALL\THERAPY images has helped heal our city, the artists will begin to spread the word how images can truly save lives. Our sister initiative is doing just that, utilizing imaging to improve and saves lives in developing communities. IMPACT! (IMProving Access to Care by Teleradiology), does its healing by setting up diagnostic imaging sites in developing countries. The connection between art and the medical philanthropy is imagery. Street murals enhance life. Medical X-ray imagery preserves it. 

Both entities are housed under the Synthesis Collaborative, a 501(c)(3) public charity incorporated in New York State. The organization raises funds to set up teleradiology services within these developing communities and grow a network of volunteer radiologists around the world. These doctors use cloud computing to access images, interpret them and recommend treatment. As a result, afflictions that are commonly misdiagnosed, or missed entirely, are properly diagnosed, saving countless lives. Artists travel to these communities as well, improving life with inspirational murals. 

To learn more about WALL\THERAPY, please visit our sites:

http://www.wall-therapy.com

http://www.facebook.com/walltherapyny

http://www.youtube.com/walltherapyny

To learn more about IMPACT! and the Synthesis Collaborative

http://www.impactrad.org

https://www.facebook.com/Synthesis.Collaborative


To donate to the Synthesis Collaborative

Global Giving Donations Page for Synthesis Collaborative


______________________________________________________________

THE PERKS

To make any contribution, just click on the perk you want and it will take you to the next page. To help inspire you to go above and beyond the average donations, the WALL\THERAPY crew put together some amazing perks.

+++

NEW ADDITIONS FOR THE FINAL WEEK!

HOPE by Adam Francey - $150

2013 muralist Adam Francey has created this mixed media original on Arches Water color paper specifically for this fundraiser. The original is 8.5” x 11” and will come framed (shown unframed)
www.adamfrancey.com

(Only 1 available)



WINGS OF PROGRESS - Hand embellished AP print by Sarah C. Rutherford - $100

2013 muralist Sarah C. Rutherford has donated 25 AP laser prints of her Wings of Progress original work and created a WALL\THERAPY exclusive variant just for this fundraiser. The image is 14”x19” on an 18x24” heavy weight stock and are each hand-embellished at the bottom with one of her signature feather illustrations. Delivered unframed.
sarahrutherford.net

(25 Available)


AFTERLIFE cans by Ian Kuali’i - $75
Friend of WALL\THERAPY Ian Kuali’i, an artist working out of New York City, generously donated three of his Afterlife series of cans just to support the cause!  Each one of these unique pieces features hand cut stencils applied to long forgotten spray paint cans. 

Cans will be available on a first-come, first served basis in the order they are purchased, and we will update availability as they are sold.
iankualii.com

(3 available)



Rochester Package curated by The Lobby - $25

Our friends at The Lobby, co-led by 2012 and 2013 muralist Thievin’ Stephen, have curated a Rochester-centric package that includes a sticker/slap pack from a host of Rochester Graffiti writers and Street artists as well as two tickets to any one show presented by The Lobby at The Bug Jar from the list below (You’ll let us know which show after your purchase).

Sticker Pack Details:

Each pack includes a minimum of 1 sticker from the following Rochester Graffiti writers and Street Artists: Thievin' Stephen, RANGE FUA (2013 muralist), BONES FUA (2014 muralist), Spaceman, Ax, YEWS HFK, Frank Bacon, and more!

Show Details (You’ll select two tickets to one show of your choice)

JUNE 27 - ROC WITH YOU: A Tribute to Michael Jackson
Cammy, Enaharo, George Grady, DJ Alykhan, Thievin’ Stephen, and More!
Live Painting/Print Release:  “Off The Wall” with Clayotn Cowles, Jaded, Seed, and Johnnie Lee Smith

JULY 4 - BORED ON THE FOURTH OF JULY
Harmonica Lewinsky, The Televisionaries, Buffalo Sex Change, Paxtor (Record Release)
Art opening:  MONSTERS with Bile, Heather Layton & Brian Bailey, Erich Lehman, Rork Maiellano, Thievin’ Stephen, and Mike Turzanski

JULY 24 - FLOOR THERAPY - A WALL\THERAPY dance party!

Moses Rockwell, DJ Tim Tones, Thievin’ Stephen (vinyl set), Dr. Hambuger (Visuals), Hosted by Lord Krow
Live Painting TBA

AUGUST 1 - MAN VS MACHINE 2
Cody Sparks vs. Brady Mueller
Benny Beyond vs. The Archaelogist
+ More TBA

www.lobbydigital.com

(16 sets available)


$75 - THIS IS WALL\THERAPY hand-embellished print by Lea

2013 muralist and Rochester native Lea has created a run of 13 Prints, with 9 available through the fundraiser. This 18" x 12" piece uses a stencil as well as reference imagery from Lea's original WALL\THERAPY mural. This series features cut paper and acrylic metallic paint mounted on cold press 90lb watercolor paper with spray paint stencil. Each piece is hand shaded and collaged with an acrylic medium, with no two being exactly the same.

www.learizzo.com


$400 - Rochester skyline photo by Mark Deff

Our lead photographer also takes beautiful photographs of our city. He's donating one of his totally unique images of Rochester, a never-before-seen 200+ degree view of the Rochester skyline taken from the Wilder Building. This is a 12"x36" print on metal which is ultra hard, scratch-resistant and waterproof (meaning it can easily be cleaned with any glass cleaner, too!) The print has 18" rounded corners and comes on a 1/2" float mount hanger.

This image will only be available in this format in a WALL\THERAPY edition of 5.

www.markdeffphotography.com

To see more of Mark's images for WALL\THERAPY, visit our gigapan page!
http://gigapan.com/profiles/WallTherapyNY


+++


$15 - WALL\THERAPY DieCut Sticker pack

For your $15 donation, we'll send you 3 5" die-cut WALL\THERAPY logo stickers so you can show your support! Place it on your car and let those people stuck behind you how important artwork is to your city! (Strong enough to survive everything the Rochester weather can throw at it.)

$15 - RYP Event @ 1975 Gallery

Presale tickets for June 18th event at 1975 Gallery - more details here: https://www.facebook.com/events/248961815306608/


$20 - WALL\THERAPY Bandana by Sarah C. Rutherford

2013 muralist and Rochester art powerhouse Sarah C. Rutherford has designed this great single color bandana for us this year! Great for when you forget your mask or it just gets a bit too hot and sweaty outside.

(Image is a mockup)


$25 - WALL\THERAPY Market Bag

Since the beginning, WALL\THERAPY has been rooted in/near Rochester’s Public Market. So we’re bringing you this sturdy tote to carry around paint supplies, fresh vegetables, or whatever else you can fit!

(Image is a mockup)


$30 - WALL\THERAPY LOGO T-SHIRT

To those who donate $30, they will receive a premium cotton, two-color print (white and blue) WALL\THERAPY shirt. It's okay to be a bit cavalier as you wear this shirt around Rochester, letting everyone know that you are part of such a worthy and artistic cause.


$40 - WALL\THERAPY T-SHIRT

To those who donate $40, they will receive a premium cotton, two-sided, two-color print (white and blue) WALL\THERAPY shirt designed by our friend Kari Roberts Petsche.


$50  - Limited Gicleé print by Shawnee Hill

Should you wish to donate $50, Rochester-based artist and upcoming WALL\THERAPY muralist Shawnee Hill has created another of her haunting portraits, printed in a one-run edition of 20 prints. Signed and Numbered, 11”x17” on archival paper.


$55 - WALL\THERAPY Zip-up Hoodie

It can get cold out there making your city more beautiful, so show your pride in the project while doing it. Printed on a premium zip up hoodie with front left chest logo and big back print featuring our new back graphic.


$75 - WALL\THERAPY 2013 Book

Currently in production, the WALL\THERAPY 2013 book will look at all the artists who visited, both during our July event and up through the end of November 2013. The book will by 9.25" x 9.25" and approximately 96 pages (double the size of last year's book!). Created in a a one-time edition of 300 copies.

(Sample spreads forthcoming)



$130 - WALL\THERAPY Supporter Combo Pack

We wanted to make it easy for you to get fully dipped and show your support for our project. This combo features the bandana by Sarah C. Rutherford, the market bag, the original logo shirt and our zip up hoodie!


$150 - TICKET TO THE WALL\THERAPY 2013 WRAP DINNER

Should you wish to donate $150, you'll need to clear your social calendar on July 27, 2014 as you will be our very special guest at the event's wrap-up dinner. Join us at The Yards as we raise our glasses to the artwork created in 2014. To make sure you will always remember the festive occasion, you will be going home with a souvenir as well, a signed spray can used by one of the 2014 WALL\THERAPISTs (This is for one ticket.)

(Six available)


$1000 SPONSOR LEVEL

Would you like to be an official sponsor of WALL\THERAPY 2013? A donation of $1000 will be all that it takes to have your name alongside this project on our website. As sponsor, you are also showered with wondrous thank you gifts like a copy of the WALL\THERAPY 2013 book and the to-be-produced 2014 book,, die-cut logo stickers, a t-shirt featuring the logo, and tickets for two to join us at our wrap-up dinner in July.

(Ten Available)


$5000 PRODUCER LEVEL

For the donor that wants to go all the way and ensure this campaign is a success, $5000 donations will earn them Producer level credit on WALL\THERAPY. Our Producers will receive a copy of the WALL\THERAPY 2013 and the to-be-produced 2014 book, one of our t-shirts emblazoned with the event's logo, and tickets for two to the wrap-up dinner in July. Also, those that generously donate this amount to the campaign will have their name listed on the website in our sponsors and donors section. The logo for your company (or name if preferred) will be added to our website and a Producer credit will be given in the 2014 book.

(Three available)


--------------------------------------

This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Synthesis Collaborative Incorporated, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.

The donation you make is tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

The print has 18" rounded corners and comes on a 1/2" float mount hanger.This image will only be available in this format in a WALL\THERAPY edition of 5.www.markdeffphotography.comTo see more of Mark's images for WALL\THERAPY, visit our gigapan page!http://gigapan.com/profiles/WallTherapyNY+++
$15 - WALL\THERAPY DieCut Sticker pack
For your $15 donation, we'll send you 3 5" die-cut WALL\THERAPY logo stickers so you can show your support! Place it on your car and let those people stuck behind you how important artwork is to your city! (Strong enough to survive everything the Rochester weather can throw at it.)$15 - RYP Event @ 1975 GalleryPresale tickets for June 18th event at 1975 Gallery - more details here: https://www.facebook.com/events/248961815306608/


$20 - WALL\THERAPY Bandana by Sarah C. Rutherford
2013 muralist and Rochester art powerhouse Sarah C. Rutherford has designed this great single color bandana for us this year! Great for when you forget your mask or it just gets a bit too hot and sweaty outside.
(Image is a mockup)

$25 - WALL\THERAPY Market Bag
Since the beginning, WALL\THERAPY has been rooted in/near Rochester’s Public Market. So we’re bringing you this sturdy tote to carry around paint supplies, fresh vegetables, or whatever else you can fit!
(Image is a mockup)

$30 - WALL\THERAPY LOGO T-SHIRT
To those who donate $30, they will receive a premium cotton, two-color print (white and blue) WALL\THERAPY shirt. It's okay to be a bit cavalier as you wear this shirt around Rochester, letting everyone know that you are part of such a worthy and artistic cause.
$40 - WALL\THERAPY T-SHIRT
To those who donate $40, they will receive a premium cotton, two-sided, two-color print (white and blue) WALL\THERAPY shirt designed by our friend Kari Roberts Petsche.

$50  - Limited Gicleé print by Shawnee Hill
Should you wish to donate $50, Rochester-based artist and upcoming WALL\THERAPY muralist Shawnee Hill has created another of her haunting portraits, printed in a one-run edition of 20 prints. Signed and Numbered, 11”x17” on archival paper.

$55 - WALL\THERAPY Zip-up HoodieIt can get cold out there making your city more beautiful, so show your pride in the project while doing it. Printed on a premium zip up hoodie with front left chest logo and big back print featuring our new back graphic.
$75 - WALL\THERAPY 2013 Book
Currently in production, the WALL\THERAPY 2013 book will look at all the artists who visited, both during our July event and up through the end of November 2013. The book will by 9.25" x 9.25" and approximately 96 pages (double the size of last year's book!). Created in a a one-time edition of 300 copies.(Sample spreads forthcoming)
$130 - WALL\THERAPY Supporter Combo PackWe wanted to make it easy for you to get fully dipped and show your support for our project. This combo features the bandana by Sarah C. Rutherford, the market bag, the original logo shirt and our zip up hoodie!
$150 - TICKET TO THE WALL\THERAPY 2013 WRAP DINNER
Should you wish to donate $150, you'll need to clear your social calendar on July 27, 2014 as you will be our very special guest at the event's wrap-up dinner. Join us at The Yards as we raise our glasses to the artwork created in 2014. To make sure you will always remember the festive occasion, you will be going home with a souvenir as well, a signed spray can used by one of the 2014 WALL\THERAPISTs (This is for one ticket.)
(Six available)
$1000 SPONSOR LEVEL
Would you like to be an official sponsor of WALL\THERAPY 2013? A donation of $1000 will be all that it takes to have your name alongside this project on our website. As sponsor, you are also showered with wondrous thank you gifts like a copy of the WALL\THERAPY 2013 book and the to-be-produced 2014 book,, die-cut logo stickers, a t-shirt featuring the logo, and tickets for two to join us at our wrap-up dinner in July.
(Ten Available)
$5000 PRODUCER LEVEL
For the donor that wants to go all the way and ensure this campaign is a success, $5000 donations will earn them Producer level credit on WALL\THERAPY. Our Producers will receive a copy of the WALL\THERAPY 2013 and the to-be-produced 2014 book, one of our t-shirts emblazoned with the event's logo, and tickets for two to the wrap-up dinner in July. Also, those that generously donate this amount to the campaign will have their name listed on the website in our sponsors and donors section. The logo for your company (or name if preferred) will be added to our website and a Producer credit will be given in the 2014 book.
(Three available)
--------------------------------------
This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Synthesis Collaborative Incorporated, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.
The donation you make is tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

story:
Short Summary

Hello to you and thanks for looking! My name is Scott. I am an artist living and working in the Telluride area. Last year, I ventured into sculpture at Burning Man, by bringing to life the Yoga Robot. Don't know what that is?? Just Google it!!

This year I had an idea to do something quite a bit different. The plan is to build a full scale artillery gun. With seats for two, and hand cranks that move and aim it. Except that it will be a large scale Teleidescope, which will be able to spin around with pedals. The barrel of the scope will be somewhere around 30".There will also be a small memorial plaque with exciting details. And possibly a sentry on site from time to time.

A teleidescope is a kaleidescope that looks out into the world, using the field of vision to create the image.

The idea is that you will see a massive out of place gun sitting in the desert, and upon inspection you will find that it is a giant toy.

The importance of this project to me, is that I get to be a part of the Burning Man experience, rather than just a spectator. Also, I am able to make other people's visit that much more interesting and special. I feel that this event is truly one of the largest art venues available, especially in the context of showing strange and obscure art to thousands of people. Plans are also being made for exhibition and placement after the event.

As a donor, you get to be a part of this experience as well. You will make it possible for me to reach my goal and fulfill my vision. Creating art and bringing it to this environment is expensive and time consuming. I will not make any money doing this, I simply do it because I want it to become reality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Building the gun, getting together vintage parts, assembly and transportation is going to get expensive. My overall budget is looking to be over $11,000. This campaign is to get things rolling, get some parts coming this way, and to get us started with construction. Future fundraising campaigns will be coming along to keep things moving. 

Perks: There will be a few nice custom things that I will make or get made for you. These will be simple tokens of appreciation, hand made with love for the people that help make this happen.

While we hope to meet this goal, don't be shy about pushing it above and beyond! Even if we don't reach our goal this time around, we are still going to be lurching forwards with whatever funding we receive. Rest assured, any money donated at this time will get the ball rolling and become a part of our success.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Do you have construction skills and live in the area? Come by and chip in!
  • Do you have some vintage gearing, chairs, or parts you can donate? Contact me!

story:
Purpose

This fundraiser is for the purpose of creating and donating a statue - as a true work of art - of District Judge Otis D. Wright, II in California. Judge Wright recently ordered sanctions against the internet-porn-copyright-troll company Prenda Law, and he has demonstrated his passion for protecting civil rights in cyberspace.

Background story

Prenda Law is an organization that has sued thousands of people for allegedly downloading porn from the internet over the past few years. They then approach the alleged infringers with a settlement designed as an offer you cannot refuse. Pay a few thousand dollars to make the problem go away, or face the embarrassment and costs of defending yourself in a porn-related case in court.

Recently one of their cases fell apart and a federal judge began asking tough questions. The organization has been in collapse ever since. Technology News site Ars Technica has covered most of the story, which finally culminated when Judge Wright officially asked for a criminal investigation.

The final order from Judge Wright has attracted much attention, not only because of his rulings but also because of his widespread use of humor and Sci-Fi references (mainly StarTrek).

This campaign seeks to raise funds to make an original work of art, for example a statue, of Judge Otis D. Wright. Perhaps the first crowd funded spontaneous artwork of its kind, our goal is to show the world that we - the citizens of the internet - honor Judge Wright. With his ruling, he has helped making the internet a better place.

What we need: Cash donations

While the initiator of this fundraiser is a resident of Copenhagen, Denmark, the actual work of art will be created and placed in California (US) where Judge Wright is located. Should the project goal be met, it is the intention to:

  • Get formal permission from Judge Wright. While this is not strictly required, making a statue or work of art of a person is silly if the person involved will have no part of it. 
  • Involve actual artists from California and ask for suggestions and mock-ups for the final work.
  • Let the donators vote between the suggestions, in order to find the artist and actual work of art to be created.

The Impact

People always suggest these kind of crazy ideas when something cool happens in cyberspace. Let's make it happen this time! Let us show the world that we do care - and that the voice of Judge Wright has been heard not just by the few people involved in the Prenda-case, but by millions of internet users who are thrilled to see justice served! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an artist in California, please take a day or two to think about this project. How would you pay tribute to Judge Wright? Can you draw or describe your intended work of art? Your budget will be approx. 7000 USD, perhaps more if this fundraising becomes a big success.

If you are an honest lawyer (heh!) living in California, and you would like to help make this project a success by working pro-bono then please contact me. There is plenty of work to be done, such as handling the donations in a proper manner and paying a local artist in compliance with local laws. Having a local pro-bono lawyer would be a great help.

Exces Funding

Funding above the intended goal will go to a better, bigger or more impressive (and thereby more expensive) piece of art. Should the amount reach ludicrous levels the excess funding will be donated to the EFF - Electronic Frontier Foundation, whose work is very much in the same spirit as Judge Wrights has demonstrated in the Prenda case.

If we don't reach our goal

Should we be unable to raise our goal of 7000 USD we will reevaluate the situation. The first move will be to look for artists willing to make a work within the budget available to us. Failing that we will contact donaters and offer them the option of either a refund or transfering their donation to the EFF - Electronic Frontier Foundation.

Perks are cumulative

All Perks mentioned are cumulative; meaning that all Perks cheaper than the one you choose will also be delivered to you.

Contact information

If you have further questions, suggestions or for some reason need to contact this campaign, please write an e-mail to:

   wrightfundraiser@conceptfactory.dk

story:
Morris is a rural community in West Central Minnesota with an expansive artistic community that includes students, migrant workers, and lifelong residents of the town.  With the juxtaposition of the University of Minnesota's satellite campus against the small, traditional farm town artistic projects manifest themselves in an entire universe of different ways.  However, despite this incredible output of art there is a relatively few places for sonic and visual artists to rehearse and share their work.

{Enter Stage Left} The Platform

This Winter, a group of students, faculty, and community organizers came together to bring a new rehearsal and performance venue to the town to help raise the profile of many of the artists that they know and love.  After searching downtown Morris for potential locations for such a space, we settled on the basement of the Hoffman Realty Building, formerly the home of Keepers Antiques.  After we discovered this space we have been working to clean he remaining antiques from the space and prepare it for our first show on Saturday, June 6th.

We're hoping to give The Platform a firm foundation to give artists the space that they are starved for, to create a whole new generation of artists in Western Minnesota, and an art scene around them.  In order to secure this future we're looking for initial financial backing to establish the organization as a fixture in Morris.  

We want to raise $1500 to get us into the space over the summer and begin realizing our vision of the interior.  Specifically, we'd use raised funds for three months of rent, the completion of the stage, and finishing our registration as a 501(C)3 Nonprofit Organization.  

Your donation to The Platform will not only help make the space a reality, but will give you access to some of our upcoming programming.

story:
About Hayes Valley Art Works:

Under the greater umbrella of Project O, Hayes Valley Art Works  is a community creation space to gather, invite people in, and curate a variety of arts programming at the 38,000 sq. ft of open space that is truly accessible to community.

As visitors to Hayes Valley Art Works, San Franciscans can feel tangible connection and access to the city’s creative community. At the site, artists are woven into San Francisco’s public life and are not separate or alienated from those who live in the city.

Over the course of the next four weeks, we look to our friends and neighbors to come together and help us reach our goal of raising a total of $5,000.

With hundreds of visitors to our “community creation space,” a $10 donation from 10% of us would put us well on our way to keeping HVAW’s “welcoming open space” in Hayes Valley.

Project O is fiscally sponsored by Intersection for the Arts. 

Why Hayes Valley Art Works?

In its short lifetime, Hayes Valley Art Works, with support from Project O, has already created a gathering space where neighborhood residents can mingle with professional artists from all over the Bay Area and feel tangible connection to our city’s creative community. With successful partnership-based exhibitions, performances, activity days, and art residencies behind us, we’re already laying the groundwork for new collaborative exhibitions that showcase the Bay Area’s vibrant systems of creative relationships, network of resources, and spirit of creative innovation.

But we need your help to make this happen: please help us by donating today. $5, $25 or even simply sharing this email with friends will help us reach our goal and keep building our “life-affirming” “secret garden” and infusing creative expression into the urban experience.

Are you one of the artists who called us “their favorite place they have shown their work,” or one of our neighbors who called us "your favorite thing in the neighborhood"? Now is the time to show your support!

How will your donation be used? 

100% of your donations will go to keeping arts and public programming alive at Hayes Valley Art Works!

Which includes: 

  • Artist and curator fees
  • Remain open and free to the public four days a week
  • Improvement Projects - better gates, signage, and movable table set up
  • Promotion - getting the word out about HVAW and our events
  • Basic HVAW Operating Costs

 

WE HAVE PERKS!

$25 Hayes Valley Art Works Official Tee Shirt


$30 Ehren Tool cup made at Hayes Valley Art Works

 


$75 Print by Robert Spertus, 18 x 8" (signed)


$250  Daniel Farnan, Leaf at Hayes, tablecloth, acrylic, 60 x 60"
 


$250 Johnna Arnold, Dinner, 2016, tablecloth, 60 x 60"
 


$250 Emily Wick, Conversation, 2016, tablecloth, 60 x 60"

 


$250 Paulette Humanbeing, Fiesta, 2016, tablecloth, 60 x 60
 


$250 Michelle Echenique, Beach, 2016, tablecloth, 60 x 60"
 


$500 Kate Rhoades, Spaghetti, 2016, acrylic, tablecloth, 60 x 60"

story:
Rachel Timmins (Baltimore, MD) and Jillian Moore (Iowa City, IA) are two makers who have curated a group of emerging American art jewelers who they believe collectively demonstrate the wide range of work that the US has to offer today in this field.  This group will go to SIERAAD, an international art jewelry fair in Amsterdam (November 2013).  Rachel, Jillian and their curated group:  Katja Toporski, April Wood, Laura Wood, Elizabeth Steiner, Satomi Kawai, Katie Poterala, Rebekah Frank and Stephanie Voegele have all earned their MFA degrees at various universities across the United States and have been active participants in the art jewelry community, exhibiting at venues both nationally and internationally.  

By exhibiting at SIERAAD, we hope to further connect the European jewelry community and its corresponding market with that of the United States. This promotion of community will help the individual makers in our group foster connections that will ripple out beyond the confines of this singular event.  It will also give galleries and buyers overseas a fresh look at the diverse range of jewelry that is happening in America due to the nature of our carefully selected group. We want to be better connected: not just through the internet - but in real life, real space, and real time. Your donation can help our ten-person group to cover our costs, and also help to foster much needed growth in the international art jewelry community.

As a group, each of us has already individually signed a contract with SIERAAD, committing to do the show and to pay for the cost of our booth.  In fact, SIERAAD has already started to promote this year's show with some of our images! Regardless of funding, WE ARE GOING!  Our SIERAAD booth costs about $7,500 USD once necessary additions are factored in due to the size of our group. Funding will mean that an enormous group such as ours, made entirely of emerging makers with limited resources, can afford to do this show properly.  All proceeds from this fundraising will go towards paying for our 21 square meter booth - the booth fee, and the accompanying booth furniture.  

In return for your donations, we are happy to offer a variety of rewards!

If we do not reach our entire goal, all the proceeds that we do make will still go to covering our booth costs.  What is left over will need to be covered by the individuals in our group. 

Should we find ourselves fortunate enough to exceed our goal of $7500, all further funding will go toward travel, lodging, and other necessary expenses incurred by our group.

We feel that going to SIERAAD is necessary for our individual careers as it will foster relationships with international gallerists and buyers but it is also necessary in helping to grow and connect the art jewelry community.  We really need this.  Our community needs this.  

Please share this funding campaign with your friends:  on your blogs, mailing lists, and social media sites.  Your support is necessary for our community's growth.

As a group, each of us has already individually signed a contract with SIERAAD, committing to do the show and to pay for the cost of our booth.  In fact, SIERAAD has already started to promote this year's show with some of our images! Regardless of funding, WE ARE GOING!  Our SIERAAD booth costs about $7,500 USD once necessary additions are factored in due to the size of our group. Funding will mean that an enormous group such as ours, made entirely of emerging makers with limited resources, can afford to do this show properly.  All proceeds from this fundraising will go towards paying for our 21 square meter booth - the booth fee, and the accompanying booth furniture.  
In return for your donations, we are happy to offer a variety of rewards!
If we do not reach our entire goal, all the proceeds that we do make will still go to covering our booth costs.  What is left over will need to be covered by the individuals in our group. 
Should we find ourselves fortunate enough to exceed our goal of $7500, all further funding will go toward travel, lodging, and other necessary expenses incurred by our group.


We feel that going to SIERAAD is necessary for our individual careers as it will foster relationships with international gallerists and buyers but it is also necessary in helping to grow and connect the art jewelry community.  We really need this.  Our community needs this.  


Please share this funding campaign with your friends:  on your blogs, mailing lists, and social media sites.  Your support is necessary for our community's growth.

story:
Similar to others who lived in Ethiopia in the 80s, I have been nomadic since. This has led to many interesting things in my life: four academic degrees in journalism, international studies, anthropology and media and cultural studies. I have filmed street dogs in India, gate-crashed climate change conferences and worked on community art projects in places that I do not belong to. I have worked on experimental films in holy cities and struggled to take photography in faraway places just for the pleasure of seeing something beautiful. 

It all confuses me very much too. 

But despite all this, I still keep on coming back to my memories of Ethiopia. Consider the following story: In 1984, one of the worst famines in human history took place. An estimated four million people died of hunger. A tidal wave of compassion emerged as emotional images were streamed live across the world on television screens, and as Live Aid provided the soundtrack to the human tragedy: "We are the world, we are the children ..." Living in Ethiopia at the time, I also vaguely remember this time. I was 8 or 9 years old then.  In one of these memories, I am in the dusty heartlands of this famine in Northern Ethiopia. I remember a scene where we walk past a bridge with stick figure people. Our local guide tells us: “These people will not be here in the morning … the hyenas will get them.” 

In the morning the streets were empty. 

There are many more memories like this. Yet these memories have been coloured by time and my over-active imagination. Memories have become stories and, after many years, I am not always sure what happened and what I have supplemented to fill in the dots of this surreal narrative. Now I have a daughter. How do I tell such stories to her when she grows up? How does one best explain the sometimes cruel beauty of human existence? How does one explain growing up in extraordinary circumstances that, nonetheless, seemed so ordinary to anybody who lived through them? 

Injera Westerns is how.


Injera Westerns** is an art project based on memories of people who grew up in Ethiopia in the 1980s. Yes, this was a time of great famine, civil war, Red Terror, and a Stalinist dictatorship and other not-so-nice things. But, as importantly, this was also a time of growing up, lasting friendship, first kisses, heartbreaks, wild parties and other such life-changing events. Time to put down our soul roots as one participant put it.  Based on these memories, I want to produce an experimental art book that combines fictionalised coming-of-age stories of children and young people with the more sinister political backdrop of this turbulent period in Ethiopian history. 

Why do I want to do this?

I think the untold truth of our lives is simply stranger, more poetic and more surreal than any fiction I have read or any movie I have seen. These stories need to be now heard as widely as possible. Moreover, these stories are not about Ethiopia only but touch on universal themes everybody can relate to in their humane laughter and sorrow.

The book revolves around the core question of  how does one explain the less pleasant side of life - such as human suffering - to my daughter when she grows up? In an effort to do this impossible task, the book creates the mythical world of Injera Westerns that freely combines different visual and textual styles from old propaganda posters, Italian spaghetti western movies, popular culture, critical media theory, existential philosophy, Ethiopian church paintings, comics, children's books, oral history, surrealism, political theory and much much more. These elements are then pulled together with my original design work, photography, watercolour, ink sketches, paintings and writing.

Does this all sound a bit complex?  Well it is.  But I sincerely believe that this is the only honest way I am able to tell the story I want to tell. At least in this book - my sincere hope is - I will be able to shatter some of the simplistic cliches and stereotypes that still plague Western representations of countries such as Ethiopia.  

Below are a few illustrative examples that provide an idea about I am talking about (though the final book will be quite different in form and content):

** The title Injera Western, by the way, is an homage to Italian Spaghetti Westerns movies. Injera is to Ethiopia as what spaghetti is to Italy.


How does Injera Westerns work?

The first phase consisted of a digital storytelling experiment that took place on an invite-only Facebook group. Over 6 months almost 500 people who had lived in Ethiopia in the 1980s discussed and shared their warm, funny and sometimes painful memories of growing up in Ethiopia.

The second phase now aims to use these stories, and many others I have, to produce a beautiful art book. But in order to get all the necessary visual and textual material for the book I need to travel back to Ethiopia. Moreover, what I want to do now is carry out a mythical journey in the high mountains of Ethiopia where I will reminisce over these stories, a kind of pilgrimage during which I meditate on who I have become and what these stories mean for me. During this pilgrimage I will then capture the material needed to make this book what it deserves to be: photography, sketches, paintings, and all other visual material that is still needed.  

I will follow the following route over 20 days:

If you wonder why I need to go all the way to the Ethiopian mountains for this, I hope the following picture will explain why the book simply cannot be done without this majestic landscape forming the existential backdrop for the Injera Westerns stories.


To make this possible, however, I need to fundraise a bit.  This is where I need your help and why I have come to Indiegogo hat in hand for the first time. I need to raise enough funds to cover my costs of traveling to Ethiopia, to organise this pilgrimage in the mountains, as well as for the costs of producing the book professionally.  In particular, I hope to fundraise the following amounts:



My initial fundraising target is thus 7,500 EUR.  Without this nothing will happen.  In other words, the book cannot be done without this amount. Any additional money that is then raised will be then used for the following additional purposes:

1. 7500-12500: to organise a touring art exhibition based on the visual-textual material of the book;

2. 12500-17500: to continue research on this project and write a more classical oral history book based on these stories hopefully published by a publisher; 

3. 17500 - ?: Money above this will be used to launch an Injera Westerns foundation to support organisations in Ethiopia that combine artistic and social work in innovative ways.  We have identified one project we would love to help out.


The good thing about all this is that you can also benefit from my crazy idea!  In order to help you support this project, I have created a wide selections of perks aimed at giving you something nice in return. These range from postcards, posters, electronic versions and  signed copies of my book to original photography, sketches and paintings produced during this trip.

My aim here is not to get rich; simply to get this important book done. These perks are intended to give you different kinds of incentives and pathways that can potentially make this book possible with your help. I will naturally offer additional perks over the duration of the fundraising project - and before Christmas - so please do also come back here often and see how this experiment continues.

Please check the list on the right for the different perks that I am offering as well as the visual breakdown of the perks below. Select whatever feels good to you as any small bit will help (the images are for illustration purposes only).



I am a researcher, writer and visual artist working at the intersection of media anthropology, philosophy and emerging digital cultures. Somewhere along the way I found out that the best way to learn about things is to just do them. So I started Injera Westerns as a way to learn about myself, about my artistic practice, and about how to tell interesting bedtime stories to my daughter when she grows up.  My website can be seen HERE. 

This was me in Ethiopia:

And this is my daughter to whom the book is dedicated for:


If you cannot give money for the project but think I am onto something unique here, there are all kind of other ways you can give us a helping hand. Spread the noise, tell friends and family about this project and how they can help.  Get your uncle journalist to write about me.  Shout it out on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram!  Thank you!

Here's our shortlink again: Injerawesterns

Here's our website: Injerawesterns

Here is our Facebook group (public): Facebook

You can also use the links below the image/video to share!

story:
Summary 

In the time of killing comes this baby. In the time of departure comes this bird. 

In times of depression comes this very small cloud of hope. This book is historical evidence on the creativity of the Syrian revolution. It documents the Syrian revolution art. Working closely with tens of artists and with extensive data sets. Day after day the violence escalated in Syria and so did the lies. Day after day the option of studying art and documenting the Syrian visual expressions in a systematic way and within an institutional context proves validity.

What We Need & What You Get 

We need to put this whole detailed work in a book. This will enable a handy and easy way to retrieve content: artists work, Syrians visual creative expressions, relevant documents, visual analysis and studies. Content that will be saved for generations to come. To continue the work we need to continue the needed funding after securing 3000 British pounds on June 2013, thanks to British council policies and the team there who realized the importance of this project. We still need to secure the remaining amount of 16800 Euros. This will be used to update the research work (currently only from 2011 till March 2013), put the book design, layout, do the proof reading, translation, book production, and start the website initial planning work. But we are quite sure that other partners will join on at next project phases and make this website and visual research and documentation center a reality

Why do we need money and where your money will go: 


في وقت الموت الذي تصنعه الحرب يأتي هذا المولود. في زمن الرحيل يأتي هذا العصفور.

 في أمسيات الكآبة تأتي غيمة من بين غيمات الأمل الكثيرة هذا كتاب يوثق ابداع الثورة السورية وبشكل خاص فنونها. بعد عمل مع عشرات المبدعين والفنانين السوريين. والكثير من البيانات والانتاج الفني. يوماً بعد يوم يتصاعد العنف في سوريا وتتصاعد الأكاذيب معه. يوماً إثر يوم يبدو خيار دراسة فنون الثورة وتوثيق التعبير البصري السوري بطريقة علمية أمراً يستحق الانتباه.

نحتاج لوضع البحث في كتاب والتهيئة للمرحلة الثالثة من المشروع وهي العمل على تأسيس مركز التوثيق البصري واطلاق منصة اعلامية تفاعلية تمكننا من حفظ الأعمال لأجيال قادمة مع سهولة الاسترجاع بحسب موضوع الاهتمام. حصلنا على مبلغ ثلاثة آلاف باوند من المركز البريطاني ونحتاج لتأمين ١٦٨٠٠ يورو لإنجاز المرحلة الثانية أي اطلاق الكتاب والاستعداد لإطلاق المرحلة الثالثة وهي المركز والمنصة.

لا تتركز الأهمية النسبية فقط في جوانب التوثيق والحفظ والاسترجاع بل أيضاً في تقديم قيم ايجابية تتصل بالهوية السورية كالجمال و الابداع والتنوع بعيداً عن روابط ومعاني الدم و الاقتتال والانحياز. على الجانب الوطني تبرز أهمية هذه المسألة خاصةً حين يتصل الأمر عملياً بالمستقبل السوري. فاستمرار ربط سوريا بالمعاني السلبية المنفرة سيحد من فرص المستقبل على كل الأصعدة وفي مقدمتها تلك الفرص الثقافية الاقتصادية٫ ففي نهاية المطاف من سيطمح لزيارة بلد قتل أو اجراء صفقات تجارية مع دولة كل ما رسخ في ذاكرته القريبة عنها أنها مسكونة بالدمار.

لزم الأشقاء في لبنان حوالي العقدين كي يدركوا أن التعافي من الحرب لا يكون من خلال دفن ذاكرتها بل عبر المكاشفة والتصالح. لعل الفن في حالتنا السورية يكون شاهداً ومحضر خير باكراً قدر الامكان.

 

لماذا نحتاج هذا المبلغ وأين ستذهب نقودكم/ن

لزم الأشقاء في لبنان حوالي العقدين كي يدركوا أن التعافي من الحرب لا يكون من خلال دفن ذاكرتها بل عبر المكاشفة والتصالح. لعل الفن في حالتنا السورية  يكون شاهداً ومحضر خير باكراً قدر الامكان.

story:
Kindred Muze Photography Presents:

The mission of the Kindred Muze Photography is to support the alternative modeling industry and to shed light on the unique alternative culture, including models, hairstylists, makeup artists and clothing designers within Toronto and the surrounding areas.

Kindred Muze Photography works closely with all walks of the alternative fashion industry, from emerging designers, to expert makeup artists and best-in-class hairstylists. By building relationships with event planners, industry leaders and new innovators in the alternative community, Kindred Muze helps to discover some of the best new talent in the field.

The Alternative Horoscope Calendar is Kindred Muze’s first calendar, but one that has taken years to perfect. The calendar spotlights some of the most talented models and fashion designers from all fields of the alternative scene, including pinup, steampunk, fetish and gothic.

The 2015 Calendar:

The 2015 Kindred Muze Alternative Horoscope Calendar is a full-color, 9" x 12" wall calendar featuring each sign of the horoscope represented in human form. Each month features an experienced alternative model born under the horoscope they are representing. Unique designer styles, from leather to latex reflect the diversity of the alternative industry.  In 2015, you'll not only be reminded of the horoscope the month falls under, but also enjoy the creative art direction of a carefully planned out photograph.

Our target goal of $5000 will allow us to offset the many costs associated with the calendar, ensuring we can get it out to the world, including our alternative supporters, Kindred Muze fans, and hopefully to any independent bookstores and book communities before the Holiday Season. It also shines a light on Kindred Muze Photography’s proud history of supporting the alternative arts, and will assist in helping future models, photographers, makeup artists, hairstylists and designers get the recognition they deserve.

The Impact:

Kindred Muze Photography is well known among the alternative industry. By teaming up with the local fashion and modeling industry, we hope to build greater understanding and support for the processes and community of alternative artists, designers, photographers, makeup artists, models and hairstylists.

This is Kindred Muze Photography’s first alternative horoscope calendar. It's an exciting moment for us, and we hope for you!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute, or can't buy your calendar now, please give us a share in your social media tools.  Help us get the word out, on your blog, on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, wherever you hang out and new supporters can be found.


Gallery pictures are behind the scenes and alternative shots to what will appear in the calendar. I will post more samples soon along with a contact sheet of the actual calendar pictures in the next few days.

are representing. Unique designer styles, from leather to latex reflect the
diversity of the alternative industry.  In 2015, you'll not only be reminded of the
horoscope the month falls under, but also enjoy the creative art direction of a
carefully planned out photograph.
Our target
goal of $5000 will
allow us to offset the many costs associated with the
calendar, ensuring we can get it out to the world, including our alternative
supporters, Kindred Muze fans, and hopefully to any independent bookstores and
book communities before the Holiday Season. It also shines a
light on Kindred Muze Photography’s proud history of supporting the
alternative arts, and will assist in helping future models, photographers,
makeup artists, hairstylists and designers get the recognition they deserve.
The Impact:
Kindred Muze
Photography is well known among the alternative industry. By teaming up with the
local fashion and modeling industry, we hope to build greater understanding and
support for the processes and community of alternative artists, designers,
photographers, makeup artists, models and hairstylists.
This is
Kindred Muze Photography’s first alternative horoscope calendar. It's an
exciting moment for us, and we hope for you!
Other Ways You Can Help:
If you can't
contribute, or can't buy your calendar now, please give us a share in your
social media tools.  Help us get the word out, on your blog, on Facebook,
Twitter, Pinterest, wherever you hang out and new supporters can be found. Gallery pictures are behind the scenes and alternative shots to what will appear in the calendar. I will post more samples soon along with a contact sheet of the actual calendar pictures in the next few days.

story:
I just signed a lease on ARTsonality's very first studio space (yay!) in Cincinnati's Pendleton Art Center! The biggest opportunity for artists to meet the public and show their work is the last weekend of each month for Final Fridays and Second Look Saturdays. I get my keys October 1st, which only gives me 3.5 weeks to get the studio ready for its Final Friday/Second Look Saturday debut! This is where I need your help!

This studio is an early stage---one stair step---for ARTsonality! Eventually, I'd love to have a storefront space that's entirely community-focused, but without clientele and referrals, it would fail. This is why a well-put-together studio space is crucial to ARTsonality's success! (Also, since female entrepreneurs aren't taken nearly as seriously as male entrepreneurs, this would make a storefront space that much more difficult without a middle step.) 

Bottom line: I am taking a big, creative, entrepreneurial plunge and I'd LOVE for you to be a part of it! 

Let's rip the bandaid off quickly: I'm asking for $12,000. 

Here's how your generosity will be put to use: 

1. Rent. 
2. Equipment such as a window air conditioner, space heaters, a commercial-grade sewing machine, a serger machine, a yarn swift, a yarn winder, and several easels. 
3. Materials needed to set up the studio for success such as paint, gallery-style lighting, fixtures to hold art prints, fixtures for sewn and knitted items, paint brushes, etc. 
4. Furniture such as a work desk, shelving to hold materials, shelving to feature completed projects, seating for the knitting lessons area, etc. 
5. Creative business courses (such as SpringBoard or Bad Girl Ventures so I can work smarter, not just harder. 
6. Attaining a tax ID. 
7. Insurance. 
8. Fees (like ones to Indiegogo, Paypal, and an extra $100 to the Pendleton Center during the summer). 

Taking a big leap of faith has many challenges and rewards! When you come alongside me with your generosity, here's what you can receive: 

  • Website recognition with advertisement for your business 
  • Original limited-edition artwork---either a signed print or a signed and numbered canvas---that will never be available to the public. (Think of it as an insider's collector's item!)
  • Invitation to an exclusive members-only soirée with a sneak peek of the finished studio space. And, trust me, it'll be a pretty sweet party you won't want to miss.
  • Custom artwork created especially for YOU and your unique story. 

How else can you help? 

With so much money needed in a short period of time, it's important to get the word out! Share with your family, friends, the lady down the street, the dude who makes your lattes, your elementary school art teacher, etc. If they donate, have them tell me you sent them by sending a line to give@artsonality.com. 5 referrals = a handmade item of your choosing! (Yesssss!) 

If the goal is exceeded (man, wouldn't that be amazing?), the remaining part will be put into a nest egg for when ARTsonality opens a storefront space. 


What challenges might be faced AFTER this project is fully funded?


The biggest challenge I see is time! When the campaign is over, I'll have 2.5 weeks to paint and install fixtures.

story:
My name is James Arndt. I'm a game developer who has been working in the industry for 7 years now. You can see more of my work here: 
http://www.jamesarndt3d.com/

This is a campaign to release a pack of animated dinosaurs for game developers targeting mobile games or web streaming applications. I'm putting my heart into making these dinosaurs look visually awesome, making them move as realistically as possible, all while staying in the constraints of what works well on mobile platforms. I've loved dinosaurs ever since I was a small kid in the early 80's and I hope my love for them will show in what I am offering you.

Currently (5) of the (6) dinosaurs are completed (modeling and texturing). Only (1) dinosaur, the Velociraptor, is currently rigged and animated. This campaign is meant to fund the modeling and texturing of the final (6th) dinosaur and to fund the rigging and animation of all (6) dinosaurs. I am hoping to reach the funding goal, but if I do not, these assets will still be delivered. It may take a bit longer to complete the entire pack if that were to happen.

As you will see below there is quite a bit of work already completed.

The dinosaur packs will be delivered digitally via download link. The entire asset archive will be in a ZIP file and include the following files:  Maya. mb source model files, FBX model files, OBJ model files, the PSD and TGA texture files, Unity shader file and lastly a Unity Package File for easy one button import into Unity. The animations will be delivered as FBX files as well, with full support for both Mecanim and Legacy Animation.

This is what you will be receiving: 

  • 1.) Tyrannosaurus Rex 3D Model
  • 2.) Pteranodon 3D Model
  • 3.) Brachiosaurus 3D Model
  • 4.) Velociraptor 3D Model
  • 5.) Stegosaurus 3D Model
  • 6.) Ankylosaurus 3D Model (To Be Completed During Campaign)

1024 x 1024 pixel layered file textures for each dinosaur. Each layer group is organized and appropriately named making customization easy.

Each dinosaur will include a mobile optimal "Dino Shader", that includes rim lighting and a detail texture overlay. The detail texture overlay allows for some very neat customization for stripes, patterns, birthmarks, etc.

Each dinosaur will include animations for the following:

  • Idle Animation
  • Walking Animation
  • Running Animation
  • Eating Animation
  • Attacking Animation
  • Getting Hit Animation
  • Death Animation
The dinosaurs will be delivered to backers near the end of the campaign. If I don't make the funding goal, they will still be delivered, and it may take a bit longer to finish them all up.

Enough talking, let's have a look at the visuals of what is completed so far!


I have all of the skills necessary to finish up the modeling of the last and sixth dinosaur (Ankylosaurus) and all of the animations completed for all six dinosaurs. My only hurdle will be paying for the time spent animating each of these creatures. This is where I need your help. The sooner we can reach that funding goal the sooner everyone can take delivery of their own dinosaur pack! If I don't reach the entire funding goal, these assets will still go out to all backers. It will simply take longer to finish them up without the goal met.

I know some of you out there just don't have any funds. That's okay! There have been many times I have been without funds myself. You can help though by using the Facebook and Twitter and Google + sharing tools. Help me spread the word, and we'll get these assets uploaded to my online store where you'll be able to acquire them later!

story:
What's Fulmicotone about?

Life. It's only life.
There are muddled lives that never manage to undo those knots formed even earlier than the umbilical cord. Sad, rather unlucky lives, for which the wheel never seems to turn. Angry lives, shaky lives, short, broken lives, that in turn gave life though.Once I saw a yellow butterfly seal its fate, flying and uncertainly fluttering its wings just a few centimetres from the asphalt, scorching in the Summer; I thought risk is exciting, though free flight is less insidious.The yellow of the butterfly’s wings, stark against the black, scorching of asphalt, switched on in my mind the full, indelible awareness of the infinite, divine quantity of beauty that exists in the world.

What's Fulmicotone?

Nitrocellulose (also: cellulose nitrate, flash paper, flash cotton, guncotton, flash string) is a highly flammable compound formed by nitratingcellulose through exposure to nitric acid or other powerful nitrating agent. When used as a propellant or low-order explosive, it was originally known as guncotton.

The dream

At times it happens that a dream comes true in the most unpredictable ways.  That is what is happening to Virginia Bettinelli, author of “Fulmicotone”, a book that has had great success among its online readers, a book that has not been marred by the logic of a lazy and greedy editorial market.  The book, selected for the LA GIARA prize in the Friuli Venezia Giulia region of Italy, characterized by its disruptive sense of freedom that characterizes the work as well as its author, is free of the contractual obligations of a publisher.  The book, independently published, was sold out after its first printing.  It is now available on line in the form of an e-book.  It consists of 36 stories describing the life of a family and our Northeastern region from the 1970s to today.

Fulmicotone – says the author – is explosive, and the book has had that same effect on me and on those who read it.  It was written from an almost impassioned necessity - that of freeing all of the tangled knots that haunted the author through the years.  Fulmicotone brings to light a world that overwhelms the reader.  Bettinelli has a writing style that is immediate, direct, a perpetual balance between the written language, rich with musical citations, and the ebook version that has a warm soundtrack and images that are raw, crude and piercing. 

The plot follows the narrator as a girl come woman who tells the tale of a father who is excessive in all senses, from whom one must escape, but inevitably will return to for a sort of inexplicable, fascinating, visceral contradiction that is he.

“I wrote it at night, during the day, in every free moment that I had.  There was some unstoppable force that pushed me on – to the rhythm of one story each week.” (Feb 2014. Article written by Mr. Gabriele Giuga, translated by Mr. Anthony Abbott).

Fulmicotone was noticed by Mr. Edoardo Fainello, Director of Piccolo Teatro Dante (a theatrical academy near Venice, Italy), and is being made into a play. Fulmicotone, the play, will soon begin touring in Italy.

What people think about Fulmicotone?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=thwieZ_vtCc

(50% of the comments are translated in English)

What I say about Fulmicotone?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PVXKQz1BSmo

(only Italian version)

Why so expensive?!

€3600 Translation from Italian to English.
€783 Paperback copies (300)
€2700 Shipping
€54 Enevelopes
€285,5 Indiegogo fees 4%
€267,21 PayPall fees 3.6%

TOT = €7689 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is to make Fulmicotone Go-Global.

Check Fulmicotone Facebook page if you like:

https://www.facebook.com/fulmicotone.virginiabettinelli?ref=hl

There are not risks involved. If we don't reach the goal, you will get the money back at the end of the campaing. (free of charge)

Check out the perks and if you have more ideas just let me know, it could be fun to hear your voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help me getting the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Grazie for make it real! Let’s get Fulmicotone translated into English. 

I feel like it's going to happen with a little help, from my friends.

story:
Short Summary

     Good Day, my name is Nicholas Castañon and I have a vision to support artist with my art form but first let me introduce myself. I am a 23 year old California native. I happened to be born and raised in the Northern parts of California. San Joaquin County, in a city by the name of Stockton. There I spent the majority of my 23yrs surrounded by life long friends and loving family. Which made this journey of mine extremely difficult to pursue than the comforts of my hometown.

     Some may say I am still young, unexperienced, or unaware. But my drive is what has gotten me to Los Angeles in pursuit of greater and meaningful substance for this earth. 5 years ago is when it all began in this industry. At one point I was signed with 3 different agencies so I got to take in an unforgettable experience one always dreams of. What it ALWAYS chizzled down to was that I wanted more. I did not want to be just a model anymore. I want to create, be the model with the brain. What better way than to help all those I have encountered and are within my network than help them reach where they needed to be.

     With any support from you, you would be doing exactly the same for this vision of this company to progress. This campaign is to help with all necessary start up expenses. Ranging but not limited to, website design/domain/app, branding, publishing and distribution, artists contributions, and event planning. By helping in any means would assure you every cent will be put to great use. For all funds left over, will be donate to a Children's Charity yet to be choosen. We are still in search of an outstanding non-profit we feel would be great. 


What We Need & What You Get

     Website/Domain/App - $2,000+ - We are in the works and have hired an amazing artist who is designing all the ins and outs of our vision for the webpage so it's efficient and as user-friendly as possible via desktop & mobile. Expenses will be going toward hiring the artist, necessary content for the webpage, additional add-ons for the purchasing of the magazine, and for the actual rights to our very own domain name (website). Also, the creation of an app for android and apple users so you can take us on the go. 

     Branding - $2,000+ - We would like to eventually hire a company to handle all forms of brand awareness for us via all social media updates/content, managing the website, newstand expenses, sticker prints, sign prints, the hiring of the rest of the UN team to keep creating this spectacular vision for each and everyone who has their very own art skill set.

     Publishing & Distribution - $3,000+ - We have several outlets we would like to take advantage of to get this publication all across the world. But since we're starting up, the funds will cover the printing of issues, the reoccurring dues, prints that will not be making the final draft, issues to be stock on websites/newstands, and shipping/handling. 

     Artist Contributions - $2,000+ - As an artist and understand the struggles of being paid for your time, effort, and any form of contribution this paragraph is extra special to me. For the first issue, I want to be able to pay the artist/s who does the cover, Biggest 12 pg spread within the publication and all creatives involved, creator of logo (graphic designer),  future creative director, writers, interviewers, etc.

     Event Planning - $1,000+ - These expenses will go towards hosting the launch of the magazine and sustaining. The launch party for magazine release, all events sponsored/endorsed by Unfashion, step and repeat (backdrop), the rental of any items, hiring of any artist (dj's/performances).


Risks & Challenges


     We all understand there are so many magazines in this world and how much of a risk it is to take this project on. A vision is only a vision unless put into play. With great minds  and outstand people on board backing us up this can be bigger than expected.

     We are only here to spread the world of the well respected world of Men's Fashion all across the world but also showcase the many extraordinary talents this world has in store.

     Challenges will be meeting specific deadlines, finding eligble content for the magazine, finding eligble artist to be featured constantly, trustworthy personnel to carry on this vision.

     Luckily, Unfashion Magazine is published twice a year so finding content can, will, and is stacked up so we can take our pick of who we think would best fit the upcoming issue. Content is a  matter of how creative with ones running the show can get. Poems, short stories, many thoughtful interviews, lookbooks, possible trends, minimal advertising (within the magazine), etc. As for trustworthy personnel, I, as editor-in-cheif, have already sorted out who I would love to help keep creating this publication that are already around me. I am just looking to see if I will corss paths with anyone whom is over qualified who already has this vision embedded within.


Other Ways You Can Help


     Can't help in any of the ways previously stated? Do not fret! You can help way more than you possible could even imagine. Not only Unfashion magazine but me personally, Nik Castañon, would love for you to spread the word anyway/shape possible. If that means sharing posts, reblogging on Tumblr, reposting on IG, telling friends and family. Not only spreading the word, but if you know someone or come across content you think would be perfect send it on over. But not only that, pass this link along to someone you know who would love to donate to this cause. We say cause because all the proceeds left over plus all the money raised from the purchases of the first issue will be donated. 
Make some noise for us. Spread the love not only for us but to everything in your life.  Thanks so much for your time and for believing with us.
