Expenses will be going toward hiring the artist, necessary content for the webpage, additional add-ons for the purchasing of the magazine, and for the actual rights to our very own domain name (website). Also, the creation of an app for android and apple users so you can take us on the go. 
     Branding - $2,000+ - We would like to eventually hire a company to handle all forms of brand awareness for us via all social media updates/content, managing the website, newstand expenses, sticker prints, sign prints, the hiring of the rest of the UN team to keep creating this spectacular vision for each and everyone who has their very own art skill set.
     Publishing & Distribution - $3,000+ - We have several outlets we would like to take advantage of to get this publication all across the world. But since we're starting up, the funds will cover the printing of issues, the reoccurring dues, prints that will not be making the final draft, issues to be stock on websites/newstands, and shipping/handling. 
     Artist Contributions - $2,000+ - As an artist and understand the struggles of being paid for your time, effort, and any form of contribution this paragraph is extra special to me. For the first issue, I want to be able to pay the artist/s who does the cover, Biggest 12 pg spread within the publication and all creatives involved, creator of logo (graphic designer),  future creative director, writers, interviewers, etc.
     Event Planning - $1,000+ - These expenses will go towards hosting the launch of the magazine and sustaining. The launch party for magazine release, all events sponsored/endorsed by Unfashion, step and repeat (backdrop), the rental of any items, hiring of any artist (dj's/performances).


    Risks & Challenges 
     We all understand there are so many magazines in this world and how much of a risk it is to take this project on. A vision is only a vision unless put into play. With great minds  and outstand people on board backing us up this can be bigger than expected.
     We are only here to spread the world of the well respected world of Men's Fashion all across the world but also showcase the many extraordinary talents this world has in store.
     Challenges will be meeting specific deadlines, finding eligble content for the magazine, finding eligble artist to be featured constantly, trustworthy personnel to carry on this vision.
     Luckily, Unfashion Magazine is published twice a year so finding content can, will, and is stacked up so we can take our pick of who we think would best fit the upcoming issue. Content is a  matter of how creative with ones running the show can get. Poems, short stories, many thoughtful interviews, lookbooks, possible trends, minimal advertising (within the magazine), etc. As for trustworthy personnel, I, as editor-in-cheif, have already sorted out who I would love to help keep creating this publication that are already around me. I am just looking to see if I will corss paths with anyone whom is over qualified who already has this vision embedded within.
   Other Ways You Can Help

     Can't help in any of the ways previously stated? Do not fret! You can help way more than you possible could even imagine. Not only Unfashion magazine but me personally, Nik Castañon, would love for you to spread the word anyway/shape possible. If that means sharing posts, reblogging on Tumblr, reposting on IG, telling friends and family. Not only spreading the word, but if you know someone or come across content you think would be perfect send it on over. But not only that, pass this link along to someone you know who would love to donate to this cause. We say cause because all the proceeds left over plus all the money raised from the purchases of the first issue will be donated. 
Make some noise for us. Spread the love not only for us but to everything in your life.  Thanks so much for your time and for believing with us.

story:
5 dancers, 2 choreographers, 2 musicians, 1 costume designer and 1 lighting designer, have created 2 world premieres dance works for Stages, a compelling evening of dance with world class artists. 

About Stages 

Kemi Contemporary Dance Projects (Kemi) is a not-for-profit dance company with Jennifer Dallas, founder and artistic director, at the helm.

September 18-21, 2013 at the Winchester Street Theatre in Toronto, Canada Kemi presents its third full-length evening of dance entitled Stages. The production includes 2 premieres: Time Now, a trio for 3 women by Jennifer Dallas, and Thirst by Tedd Robinson, a duet for Michael Caldwell and Jennifer Dallas.

The seed for Time Now came from Jennifer’s interest in Duke Ellington’s Big Band music and in women of the 1920s. The work has evolved as a broad study of women. Empowerment, feminine unity, women’s place in social structure, the female silhouette, sexuality and language were all of interest to Jennifer in the creation of Time Now. Ultimately in Time Now the relationships between the 3 dancers reveal feminine power. The dance is set to an original score by three-time Canadian Juno nominee Elizabeth Shepherd and recorded at the Glenn Gould Studio by renowned recording engineer John MacLean.

Photo of Time Now in rehearsal by Omer Yukseker 


Thirst brings together seasoned and celebrated artist Tedd Robinson as choreographer, mid-career artists Michael Caldwell and Jennifer Dallas as dancers, and Quebec sensation Charles Quevillon as composer. Tedd Robinson’s work is challenging for the performer and inviting to the audience; it reveals truths of humanity though candour and humour.

Thirst is a work that flowed out of us naturally, with the weight of a desert dune. – Tedd Robinson

Photo of Thirst at Centre Q by Tedd Robinson 


What We Need and What You Get

The Impact

Stages celebrates the work of emerging and established dance artists and musicians. For the artists involved it has been an opportunity to create, connect and learn with some of Canada’s most inquisitive and compelling performing artists. For the audience that fills the seats Stages it is an opportunity to see the fruits of artistic labour, to be transported through the imagination, questioned, challenged, touched and inspired.

"An increasingly virtual culture has altered our understanding of ourselves, our bodies, our relationships and our responsibilities. Dance helps to remind, reflect and reconnect audiences by engaging the shared vessel of the human body. For Kemi, the dance studio/stage is where human interaction can enjoy the beauty and freedom of transcending age, race and experience.” – Jennifer Dallas 

We are 4-weeks away from opening night! Arts funding has been decided and while we are so grateful for the creation funding received from the Toronto Arts Council in 2011 for Time Now, the fact remains that we have not received any funding for the production of Stages. 

Dear friends, admirers and wonderers, we need your help. 

Funds from this campaign will first and foremost go to THE ARTISTS, fees for their time, expertise and brilliant work. The expenses of self-presented dance are vast and include the following: rehearsal studio space, theatre rental, lighting design, costuming and set design, materials and construction, technical staff, publicity, documentation (video and photography) and administrative staff.

If we don’t reach our goal we will have to cut back on production expenses and artists will receive a less than ideal fee. If we EXCEED our goal, however, we'll be able to more fairly compensate our team AND increase our marketing and audience reach, bringing Stages to even more people!

By contributing to Stages, in addition to the warm satisfaction of supporting dance art, you will receive a unique perk from Kemi. Among other things we have a collection of cloth from West Africa, music from the show, photographs from the studio, and knitted wear to keep your ankles cozy among other charming things. Check out your choices in the column on the right!


Other Ways You Can Help

Come to the show!

Most importantly we want our work to be seen! Come see Stages and tell your friends and community about it. Bring someone who adores contemporary dance or jazz music, or someone who has never been to dance show before – take a chance!

Tweet/Blog/Facebook

Give us a shout on your favorite social media platform. Ask us for an interview or tell someone who might be interested in learning more about us. Success comes with the backing of community, help grow our web of supporters, and of course share this campaign through the indiegogo share tools.

Volunteer

Many hands makes light work, we are looking for people in Toronto to support Stages by offering their time.

For more information on Stages visit: www.kemiprojects.ca

If you’re interested in getting in touch with us with questions or to volunteer: info@kemiprojects.ca


About the Artists:

Jennifer Dallas, Artistic Director of Kemi, Choreographer for Time Now, dancer for Thirst

Jennifer Dallas is a Toronto-based dancer, choreographer, teacher and costume designer. In 2010, Dallas was the Metcalf Foundation-funded intern for 10 Gates Dancing under the direction of Tedd Robinson. She was also a K.M. Hunter award nominee that year. In 2005, Dallas received a DanceWEB scholarship for study at ImPuls Tanz in Vienna, Austria. She currently sits on the board of directors for the Canadian Alliance of Dance Artists – Ontario Chapter.

Dallas is a graduate of The School of Toronto Dance Theatre. Her work has been presented in Burkina Faso, Nigeria, and Toronto. She has created commissioned works for the Scream Literary Festival, The Crazyfish Collective and The School of Toronto Dance Theatre. Dallas has performed in works by Tedd Robinson, Marc Boivin, Susie Burpee and Adedayo Liadi. She has an ongoing collaborative partnership with Bienvenue Bazié of Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso.

In July 2012 Dallas was a guest teacher and artist-in-residence in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso as part of the project Engagement Féminin. In August 2012 she was artist-in-residence at Kolban Dance in Jerusalem, Israel.

Joanie Audet, Dancer for Time Now

Upon her graduation from The School of Toronto Dance Theatre, she has been working with Kemi on Jennifer Dallas' new creation Time Now. She has also danced in work by Susanna Hood, Leslie-Ann Glen, Amy Hampton, Andrew Hartley, and Keiko Ninomiya.

In July 2012, Audet was invited by Jennifer Dallas to take part in Projet Engagement Féminin, an initiative to engage women in dance in Africa. While travelling, she taught and performed in several Moroccan cities as part of Festival Action Danse 5. 

Emma Kerson, Dancer for Time Now

Kerson graduated The School of Toronto Dance Theatre in 2011. She is a recipient of a Millennium Excellence Award, the Kathryn Ash Leadership Award, and a Metcalf Foundation Performing Arts Internship grant. Independently, Kerson has had the pleasure of working with artists such as Sharon B. Moore, Patricia Beatty, Elizabeth Chitty, Jennifer Dallas, and Mary Jo Mullins, and she continues to work with Kemi and Niagara Dance Company.

Ana Claudette Groppler, Dancer for Time Now

Ana Claudette Groppler Graduated from The School of Toronto Dance Theatre in 2011. Since graduating Groppler has danced for; Toronto Heritage Dance in David Earle’s Miserere, Kemi, for Nancy Latoszewski’s, Signal Theatre, Parahumans, and as a rehearsal assistant for Michael Caldwell’s Ash Unravel presented by Dance: Made in Canada.

Elizabeth Shepherd, Musical Director/Musician for Time Now 

www.elizabethshepherd.com

Elizabeth Shepherd is a singer/songwriter pianist, combining elements of jazz, soul and world rhythms. Her music has garnered the attention of both jazz aficionados and pop critics alike with three vocal jazz JUNO nominations (2007, 2009, 2013) and a nomination to the Polaris Prize long-list (2010).

John MacLean, Recording Engineer/Musician for Time Now

Saxophone, composition and audio production have taken Ottawa native John MacLean great distances. His collected technical and artistic experience attracts international recording artists to his studio in Toronto as well as to the Glenn Gould Studio where he is a Recording Engineer and Broadcast Technician.

Photo of Time Now by Omer Yukseker | Dancers Joanie, Emma, Ana 


Tedd Robinson, Choreographer for Thirst 

www.tengatesdancing.ca

Robinson first rose to prominence as Artistic Director of Contemporary Dancers in Winnipeg, Canada (1984-1990). Having returned to Ottawa in 1990 to pursue a solo career, he is now firmly established as a choreographer, educator and solo artist whose critically acclaimed, award-winning works have won him a multitude of commissions and an international schedule of touring and teaching.

Robinson is Artistic Director of 10 Gates Dancing Inc, formed in 1998 His work is influenced by his 6 years of study as a monk in the Hakukaze soto zen monastery, Ottawa. He now lives and works from le Centre Q: a centre for questioning near Quyon Québec, a renovated 3300 square foot building devoted to residencies for dance artists and artists in related fields.

Michael Caldwell, Dancer for Thirst

Michael Caldwell is a Toronto-based choreographer/performer. A graduate of The School of Toronto Dance Theatre, he has interpreted roles for esteemed dance creators, including Peggy Baker, Sylvie Bouchard, Danny Grossman, Guillaume Côté, Maxine Heppner, Sasha Ivanochko, James Kudelka, Louis Laberge-Côté, Tedd Robinson, William Yong, Coleman Lemieux & Compagnie, Corpus Dance Projects, Kaeja d’Dance and Kaha:wi Dance Theatre, among others. Michael was an interpreter at Le Groupe Dance Lab, studying with Peter Boneham. 

Charles Quevillon, Composer/Musician for Thirst 

www.charlesquevillon.wordpress.com

Charles Quevillon completed his studies in classical guitar and composition at Cégep de St-Laurent in 2008. Since then, he has concentrated on electroacoustic and instrumental composition under the guidance of Yves Daoust and Serge Provost at the Conservatoire de musique de Montréal.

Photo of Tedd Robinson and Charles Quevillon at Centre Q by Michael Caldwell


Ron Snippe, Lighting Designer

Roelof Peter Snippe began his professional lighting design career with Toronto Workshop Productions under the direction of George Luscombe. In 1973, he began a long working relationship with Toronto Dance Theatre, creating designs for over 150 works in the repertoire. Mr. Snippe has worked with major dance, theatre and opera companies across Canada and abroad. In 2010, Mr. Snippe was awarded the Dance Ontario Lifetime Achievement Award.

story:
STICKER NERDS 3

Sticker Nerds 3 is a one night event which will take place on March 29th, 2014 in Portland Oregon. It will be a celebration of adhesive art with contributors from all over the world. It is an open call for art- anyone who sends in stickers or posters will be added to our installation. The event is comprised of the following:

  • Huge install walls 
  • Interactive surfaces for stickers and posters and tags by the visitors of the show
  • Tables with blank stickers and markers for creating your own adhesive art
  • Live screen printing
  • Fine art
  • Slideshows and short films
  • Merchandise for sale 
  • Live music
  • Drinks

What We Need & What You Get

Contibutors that donate 20 dollars or more will receive goodies as a thank you for helping us make this event happen! Anything less than 20 bucks is very much appreciated, your name will appear as a contributor in the official Sticker Nerds 3 video. 

  • $10 donators will receive a shout out on our SN3 video 
  • $20 or $40 donators will receive a custom sticker pack from Portland Artists
  • $50, $75, or $100 donators will receive custom sticker packs, uncut sticker sheets, and a rare hand screen printed poster from the show.
  • The first 5 $200 donators will receive all of the above AND the official Portland Street art book signed by local artists. 
  • All funds go toward renting the gallery space, lighting and sound equipment, and art supplies. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out! If we don't raise enough money, this show will not happen. Share this fundraising page on your social media sites so we can get enough funding to make this show happen. If you have other ways to help us raise money for Sticker Nerds 3- contact us via email:

Skamsticker@yahoo.com

Arrexstore@gmail.com

Here is our Facebook event page where you can learn more and see the stickers that have been coming in for the show:

https://www.facebook.com/events/207166032804304/

Sponsors

Day in the Lyfe Magazine
Sticky Ricks
Ren One
Cascadian Canvas Craft
www.portlandstreetart.com
Urban Muse
Blaq backpacks

P.S......

Are you a sticker artist!?

Consider sending us some stickers or posters to be put up in the event! 

Send your artwork to:

Sticker Nerds 3

PO BOX 13492

Portland OR 97213

USA


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Hello friends!

I have been extended an invitation to attend and participate in the 6th International Women's Conference hosted by the Art of Living Foundation in Bangalore, India February 7 through 9, 2014.  I will be representing my church - St. Paul AMEC Lanett, AL (where my dynamic and heartbreakingly handsome hubby is the pastor) and the non-profit I co-founded - the Jewell Jackson McCabe Emerging Leaders Institute, Inc.  The total cost of the trip is $2,500 (airfare, food, and lodging) and I am reaching out to you to ask to help defray the cost of this trip with any donation your spirit moves you to make.  The IWC is a bi-annual event, and will include powerful renowned speakers from around the world on women and children's issues (my passion!), health and wellness, spirituality, and community resourcefulness. 

Learn more about my goal and the International Women's Conference in the video in this campaign!

Thank you in advance!

story:
Support the Arts – Help Us Go Digital

Your help is needed for industry mandated digital cinema conversion

For nearly 75 years the Fine Arts Theatre Place in Maynard has been a staple of the regional community, providing residents and families with access to some of the world’s most popular motion pictures. But this year, our small town theatre is faced with an unprecedented challenge – the film industry’s mandated January 1, 2014 conversion from the traditional 35mm film to digital projection. Though this transformation will maintain the theatre’s ability to bring first-run movies, it also requires substantial costs, which is why the Fine Arts Theatre Place has launched the“Support the Arts – Help Us Go Digital” campaign.



This campaign has set a fundraising goal of $200,000, which will cover the cost of new projection equipment, computers and a sound system necessary to support the digital format. The film industry has used 35mm film since it first launched in 1910, but it is now making the transition to digital projection. New movies will cease being released on 35mm film by the end of 2013, meaning that theatres must have the updated equipment to show new films.

Since purchasing the Fine Arts Theatre Place last April, new owners, Steve Trumble and his business partner and Maynard resident Melanie Perry, have breathed new life back into the theatre investing more $500,000 in restoration efforts.

With the budget depleted, the theatre needs the strong support from the community for the new “Help Us Go Digital” campaign. This is an opportunity for residents and community and business leaders to make a direct and sustained investment in this community and to help ensure the future of this local historic gem.

To thank those around the community who are Helping the Fine Arts Go Digital, we have created gift packages. For those who have already supported the Go Digital campaign thank you for your donation and please contact Melanie Perry at finefacemama@gmail.com  to claim your packages.

  o Recognition on a permanent lobby plaque at the Fine Arts Theatre for “Fine Arts Film Philanthropist For Life” with a love and commitment for the theater

story_txt:
Support the Arts – Help Us Go Digital
Your help is needed for industry mandated digital cinema conversion
For nearly 75 years the Fine Arts Theatre Place in Maynard has been a staple of the regional community, providing residents and families with access to some of the world’s most popular motion pictures. But this year, our small town theatre is faced with an unprecedented challenge – the film industry’s mandated January 1, 2014 conversion from the traditional 35mm film to digital projection. Though this transformation will maintain the theatre’s ability to bring first-run movies, it also requires substantial costs, which is why the Fine Arts Theatre Place has launched the“Support the Arts – Help Us Go Digital” campaign.


This campaign has set a fundraising goal of $200,000, which will cover the cost of new projection equipment, computers and a sound system necessary to support the digital format. The film industry has used 35mm film since it first launched in 1910, but it is now making the transition to digital projection. New movies will cease being released on 35mm film by the end of 2013, meaning that theatres must have the updated equipment to show new films.
Since purchasing the Fine Arts Theatre Place last April, new owners, Steve Trumble and his business partner and Maynard resident Melanie Perry, have breathed new life back into the theatre investing more $500,000 in restoration efforts.
With the budget depleted, the theatre needs the strong support from the community for the new “Help Us Go Digital” campaign. This is an opportunity for residents and community and business leaders to make a direct and sustained investment in this community and to help ensure the future of this local historic gem.
To thank those around the community who are Helping the Fine Arts Go Digital, we have created gift packages. For those who have already supported the Go Digital campaign thank you for your donation and please contact Melanie Perry at finefacemama@gmail.com  to claim your packages.Fine Arts Film story:
EHaatNow is a unique platform that provides local artisans linkage to one of the fastest growing markets (online market) and maximizes the share of their profits by making itself a not-for-profit venture and getting funded through CSR corpuses.

It has been felt that there is a sudden shift among the Indians to popularize and promote the local arts & crafts. But, there exists very limited or no platforms for such customers to satisfy their needs. Providing an online platform is the first of its kind initiative to such customers.

Year 1 – With only few months left for the year to end, the company expects no substantial sales in 2014-15. This year will be more of a preparatory year with major expenditures on salaries, website building, design & promotion and internet marketing constituting upto $91800.

Year2 – EhaatNow expects to earn a revenue of $65570 in 2015-16 based on excessive marketing and promotion activities undertaken in the last year. However, with increased expenditures during hiring of new candidates and other activities, the company would not break even.

Year 3 – Year 5 – The company would break-even from year 3 onwards with annual sales moving up from Rs. 1 crores ($163,930) in year 3 to Rs. 10 crores ($1,639,344)in year 5 based on the projections of e-commerce industry and excessive marketing and promotion activities. By now, EHaatNow would have added more than 1,000 products sourced from local artisans. During this period, based on the momentum and customer response, the company might have also thought of opening up to international customers.

The company would invest heavily on capacity building of the artisan clusters connected to the grass-root NGOs. As the business expands the company would grow its network and expand its tie-up with C&F agents for easy procurement and shipping of finished goods. The company expects to invest heavily on human resource by recruitment and training.

story:
Art loves Science and Science loves art

 It's always been that way but these days Bio-Art is fashionable which is great for me because my research-led art practice is all about biology.  I'm a grad student in my final year of a fine art program so without classes to attend I've fallen in love with a plan to trek to NYC to take a class at the School of Visual Art. The class is called Biological Imaging: The Use of Microscopy to Observe and Photograph Life. Which is right up my alley.
Coincidentally during the same time in NYC the SVA is hosting a three day international conference called Naturally Hypernatural: Visions of Nature with visiting bio artists from around the world. Which is fantastic luck for me.

Also in November Genspace, NYC's public biolab is offering a class on Synthetic Biology which fits in with my bio art practice perfectly.

AND the New York Science Center is displaying an exhibit of Art inspired by Science, Particularly the brain. (Did I mention that my thesis is an art project about how our brains work?)

This expedition will be invaluable to my practice and career as an artist and residency director. 

I'm going to do this on a shoestring because I don't have any student loans, grants or funding of any kind apart from what I raise here so please consider purchasing a print.  I'm asking for $1000 to cover tuition at the SVA ($210) and Genspace ($300), The Naturally Hypernatural Conference ($25), bus and train fare from Ottawa ($225), NYC metro pass ($112), and accommodation (I'll mostly be couch surfing but don't want to arrive empty handed). And the printing/postage of the work sold in this campaign.

NEW PERK! NYC under a microscope postcard! I've been photographing NYC under a microscope and the results are beautiful. I'll send you one as a thank you for donating $10 to my campaign. You can choose which one you like here. Just say which one you want right on the photo, I'll print it up on a dye sublimation printer and pop it in the mail. 


Since this is an underwater themed research project and I am a printmaker I am offering marine-life related prints to my supporters.


Stickers: ART <3'S s SCIENCE plus these 2 beauties and more


Gyotaku prints: Gyotaku is a traditional Japanese technique used by fishermen to record their catches. See my process here.

George  4 x 6 inches                                               Tania 10 x 16 inches          

Tommy the Turbot


School of Life  22 x 36 inches                              Eyeshine 20 x 30 inches           


The Salmon and the Sparrow 22 x 36 inches


Octopus 22 x 36 inches


Sophie Black as Ink                                              Ethereal Sophie  12 x 22 inches     


I Love Jellies! digital prints on clear film  12 x 36 inches


Garrison Creek Graphite Rubbing on rice paper 16 x 36 inches


Puddles of Living Light  digital print on fine art paper 17 x 22 inches


Artist Books:
Drift


                                                                           
Salamander in the Snow                                Moksha: An Illustrated book about Death  

Extending our Scope of Vision: Telescopy & Scanning Electron Microscopy


Check out this catalogue of my prints


I run the Ayatana Artist Research Program for artist to study science with experts. I am very excited about this expedition not only because of the science research that will benefit my own art practice (Looking at tiny marine organisms through microscopes and tinkering with living cells!) but also because as an art/science mediator I will be able put more artists and scientists in touch with each other. I have joined the New York SciArt Center and am looking forward to meeting its members and participating in its events while I am in town.

Thank your for your support and encouragement!

If you know people who are interested in art and science or who collect underwater art please hit the share button.

story:
The Tan 1415 4th St SW

August 2011 - December 2014


In Plain English__

The Tan is coming to a close. in January, I will be moving on. However, it is my aspiration to put on a couple more great shows before I'm out in the New Year. This time, the scale is such that we will need your support if they are to be possible. Your contributions will go towards the production of three (+?) final shows at the Tan and the creation of a small book collecting all the many wild and weird things that have gone on here in the past thee years.

Money, What Money?__

The Tan is trying to raise $1,000 for the materials, paint, and auxiliary costs for three final shows. Any remaining funds will go towards the production of a small book that will be released at a Tan Closing Closing Show in late December. The more funds left over, the more special-er we can afford to make the book.

The Tan has been a proud part of this community for its three year run. We will be immensely grateful if you would help directly support a last blast of DIY weirdo art. Every show produced to date at the Tan has been out of pocket. It feels an odd turn to have to ask here at the end, but, currently unemployed, there are no pockets to pull from.

Ways to help__

Please just share this campaign and spread the word. Come out to the shows. Be a friend. Be inspired and make art. This is but a simple small space amidst so much greater activity. Keep on keeping on. Have the fun.

Transcript__

Hi, hello, this is Andrew Lyman of The Tan gallery. I have developed the ability to speak through my computer using nothing more than the power of my focused mind. I am here now to officially inform you all that after three fantastic years, The Tan will be coming to a close. I believe, for my part, we've had an incredible run of it, however, in the new year I will be moving on, and it comes time to pass the torch. I am so proud of the many artists I've had the pleasure of meeting and working with here and the shows we have been able to accomplish. Truly DIY non-commercial spaces are fleeting and rare, and I feel quite privileged to have had the pleasure to run this space here in Barelas for as long as I have.

In addition to making this announcement, I am here also to beg for money. To date, every show we have put on at The Tan has been out of pocket. There have been no donations, no percentages of sales, and no profits. At this time I am recently laid off from my job and just about run out of pocket however I have one more big show I would like to deliver before it is all said and done. The details are to be a closely guarded secret, but the show will open on Black Friday twenty fourteen. In addition to this special show, there are two other shows planned: one in September and one in October. The details of both will be forthcoming. We will also be throwing a closing bash just before the new year to celebrate and say adios to everything we've done here together.

100% of the proceeds raised will go towards the funding of these three finals shows and to the production of a small book that is to be the printed record of the activity of this space under the guise of The Tan. So, if you'll have me, if you'll chip in and support The Tan phynancially this one time - will you help to produce the last gasp of a space that has been a proud part of this community for the past three years?

It is my hope that I can turn this space over to a new chapter of energy and excitement and that it may continue to be the special anomaly that it has been in the past. Thank you and hello. There is nothing. We have not, done.

story:
GTAA (Global Tamil Artist Association) and Tamilithal have jointly organised an awarding function called Saathanai thamizha awards. European Tamil artists are going to be honoured through this awarding event.

This function is going to be held on 20th of June, in London. All the featured films, short films and songs which were released in 2013 in Europe are going to be considered towards the awards.

Purpose:

  • Ø   Recognition of our artists.
  • Ø   Encouraging and honouring them.

Saathanai thamizha team has decided to organise this awarding function in different countries in coming years. According to this plan, next year’s function is going to be in Switzerland.

 Methodology of awarding:

Our judges are going to analyse every of the feature films, short films and songs released in 2013, and select 6 artists or 6 products for nomination for each category.

Chosen artists and products are going to be left out for a worldwide voting. European universities based Tamil community and worldwide Tamil communities are going to be able to vote for their favourites.

Final decision is going to be made considering the votes and the quality of the product. This decision will be approved by our judges.

Methods for voting:

Via website (www.saathanaithamizha.com)

Short Messaging Service

Telephone

Mobile phone application

All kind of arts have to be honoured, respected and encouraged. This award has been introduced to honour our artists and their products. Saathanai Thamizha team expresses its heartiest happiness by doing this honour to our Tamil artists.

story:
Honour a woman in your life today through our 10,000 Women Campaign. Tell her she matters, while telling a nation of female artists that they matter!


PLEASE INCLUDE THE NAME OF THE WOMAN/WOMEN YOU HONOURED IN THE COMMENTS SECTION ABOVE! WE ALSO INVITE YOU TO SHARE A STORY OR MESSAGE.


WHO WE ARE

For 35 years, Nightwood Theatre has been Canada’s national woman’s theatre. We have been helping women develop their skills, get their foot in the door in Canadian theatre, and forge creative alliances among women in the arts.  We produce shows, mentor artists, and advocate. We’ve become something like a home for Canadian women in theatre.

At the heart of our work is a belief in the power of what women bring to the world through theatre. Our work is cut out for us:

  • 72% of theatres in Canada are run by men.
  • Of the 1006 credited playwrights produced in Canada in 2010 only 288 were women. That is only 29%.
  • Only 33% of the plays produced are directed by women. 
There’s an equity gap, a big one. And it doesn’t make sense. Women have so much more to say. 


10,000 WOMEN CAMPAIGN

With our 10,000 Women Campaign, we are giving you the chance to tell one woman that she matters to you by contributing just $10. An opportunity to tell us her name, share her story, honour her.

Through this campaign we will gather 10,000 names, and 10,000 stories. But today we have a smaller goal. We’re asking you to help us gather 600 names by July 15.  When we hit our goal of 10,000 names, we will recognize these remarkable women with a groundbreaking art exhibit. In the meantime:

  • When you honour one woman ($10), her name is listed on our website
  • When you honour two women ($20), their names get listed on our website and you all get a special shout out on social media
  • When you honour five women ($50), you get all of the above benefits PLUS you receive an invitation to an open rehearsal of HER2, a powerful story of a group of women finding strength and humour while facing an aggressive form of breast cancer
  • When you honour 10 women ($100), you get all of the above benefits PLUS you receive an invitation to all opening night performances in our 2014/2015 season!
  • When you honour more than 10 women ($100+), you get all of the above benefits PLUS our fabulous Artistic Director Kelly Thornton will treat you to a coffee and a chat!


WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES

By supporting Nightwood Theatre now, you’re giving emerging playwrights a voice; you’re providing a stage manager with a valuable career opportunity; you’re giving women the chance to share their stories with the world. With this $10, you’re not only telling one woman that she matters.  You’re telling a nation of female artists that they matter. 

Our work is risky and provocative, and it couldn't happen without support from people who support the promotion of women's voices - people like you. Become part of this powerful group of people who support women in the arts!


PLEASE INCLUDE THE NAME OF THE WOMAN/WOMEN YOU HONOURED IN THE COMMENTS SECTION ABOVE! WE ALSO INVITE YOU TO SHARE A STORY OR MESSAGE, WHICH CAN BE MADE PUBLIC OR KEPT PRIVATE.

story:
NEW LINK


[english below]

cosa è ALTO FEST? 


Un progetto che promuove la cultura come fattore essenziale per la crescita del territorio e i suoi abitanti, fatto in collaborazione con i cittadini di diverse zone di Napoli e con organizzazioni artistiche diffuse lungo il territorio nazionale e oltre i suoi confini.


ALTO FEST nel tempo si è impegnato a prendersi cura di una comunità permanente, sempre in crescita, che ha deciso di abitare una condizione extra-ordinaria, come costitutiva del proprio quotidiano vivere e sentire. NOI ne facciamo parte, completamente, e felicemente compromessi con l’architettura umana di questo paesaggio, composto da chi si riconosce nella capacità di fabbricare il futuro, immaginare insieme, condividere il desiderio, per dare luogo e farsi spazio, giorno dopo giorno.


Fin dalla sua nascita, avvenuta nel 2011, ALTO FEST è dimora per pratiche d'arte innovative e condivise; abbattere ogni muro possibile tra spettatore e scena, seminare bellezza, far fiorire orizzonti, camminare lo stupore. In 4 anni abbiamo dedicato alla città il nostro tempo, i nostri soldi, le nostre competenze e conoscenze. Lo abbiamo fatto non solo perché la cultura è il nostro lavoro, ma perché prima di tutto noi stessi siamo spettatori curiosi, affamati di coraggio e innovazione, e non vogliamo più sentirci isolati dai movimenti culturali internazionali, prendere treni e macinare chilometri per vedere e godere di opere che in nessun modo arriveranno qui, dove abitiamo. Abbiamo coltivato questo progetto, contenti della fatica, insieme ai tanti cittadini che ci hanno donato i loro appartamenti, negozi, giardini, spazi d'ogni sorta, che hanno accolto artisti provenienti da terre lontane, che a loro volta hanno condiviso con gli spettatori opere d'arte coraggiose e innovative, portando a Napoli la voce della cultura contemporanea internazionale. Anche quest’anno, dal 22 al 28 settembre 2014, Napoli sarà casa per artisti che arriveranno da tutto il mondo. Ancora una volta i cittadini ospiteranno gli spettacoli nei loro spazi domestici. La Rete Ospitale si comporrà di nuove persone che doneranno gratuitamente i loro alloggi agli artisti e ai volontari che arriveranno da ogni dove per animare le giornate di ALTO FEST.


Tutto questo sarà possibile ancora una volta perché una città intera ha deciso di difendere il proprio diritto ad una cultura differente, sempre viva.
ALTO FEST 2014 vuole crescere, avere la possibilità di ospitare molti più artisti, di moltiplicare gli spazi e diversificare gli interventi che lo compongono, di accogliere progetti trasversali, coinvolgere molte più organizzazioni, di invitare osservatori culturali internazionali che possano poi raccontare oltre confine l’esperienza che la comunità di ALTO FEST mette in moto. 


per questo ABBIAMO BISOGNO DI TE. Per garantire il carattere internazionale del festival, e preservare la sua qualità. Noi continueremo ad investire come fatto fino ad oggi, ma abbiamo bisogno di un aiuto per sostenere almeno le spese di viaggio degli artisti in programma. 


La maggior parte dei costi destinati all’organizzazione di ALTO FEST sono coperti direttamente da TeatrInGestAzione. Alcuni servizi sono donati da collaboratori e sponsor tecnici. Gli aggiornamenti sui sostenitori e sul programma del festival, si possono seguire sulle pagine del sito www.altofest.net e sui social network ad esso collegati. 

COME SPENDEREMO IL TUO CONTRIBUTO?

La tua quota servirà a coprire i costi di viaggio di circa 50 artisti provenienti da tutto il mondo. La somma di denaro che vogliamo raggiungere è stata calcolata sulla base del totale delle spese di viaggio sostenute dagli artisti nelle passate edizioni del festival.  

CONTRIBUISCI con una tua quota alla nostra raccolta fondi! 

CONDIVIDI con tutti i tuoi amici! 

COINVOLGI!

VIENI AD ALTO FEST!!!!


PER VERSARE LA TUA QUOTA:
la procedura si presenta in questo modo:
prima di essere indirizzati al pagamento esce la seguente scritta:

Pay with PayPal

After clicking this button, you’ll be redirected to PayPal’s site where you can pay with your credit card or PayPal account.

e poi si clicca sul pulsante fucsia GO TO PAY PAL
a questo punto sarete indirizzati in una pagina, dove potrete scegliere di pagare con le varie carte sia di debito che di credito, se non avete un conto paypal.

Nello specifico: sotto la compilazione dati paypal c'è un'altra stringa che si riferisce alle carte dove c'è scritto:

Pay with a credit or debit card



***


[english version]



What is Alto Fest ? 

It is a project promoting culture as an essential element for the development of a territory and of its inhabitants. A festival made in collaboration with citizens from different areas of Naples and national and international organizations.

ALTO FEST undertook to care a permanent, always growing community that doesn’t give up to live an extra-ordinary condition, as an essential feature of its own every-day life and feeling. WE are part of it, completely and happily involved in this human architecture of this landscape, made up of who recognize themselves as people able to build future, imagine together, share desire, making space and making our own space, day after day.


Since from its birth, in 2011, ALTO FEST is the home of shared new art practices, were every tearing down every possible wall between scene and audience, seeding beauty, letting the horizons bloom, inhabiting the wonder. During the last 4 years we chose to give to the city our time, our money, our skills and knowledge. We did this, not only because culture is the core of our work, but also because we are curious spectators, hungry for courage and innovation, and we don’t want to feel isolated from international cultural movements, catching trains and stacking up miles to see and enjoy works that will never be presented here, where we live. We have nurtured this project, being happy about the effort, together with many citizens who gave us their homes, shops, gardens, every sort of spaces, who housed artists coming from distant lands. On their side, the artists shared innovative and courageous works with the spectators, bringing to Naples the voice of contemporary international culture. Also this year, from 22 to 28 of September 2014, Naples will be the house of artists coming from all around the world. The citizens will host the shows in their domestic spaces. The hosting network will add new persons who will donate free accommodation to artists and volunteers coming from everywhere to light up ALTO FEST days.


This all will be possible again because an entire city decided to defend its own right to a different always living culture. ALTO FEST 2014 aims to grow, to have the possibility to host many much artists, increasing the spaces and extending the actions that make it, embracing transversal projects, including more organizations, inviting international cultural observers, who will then tell abroad the experience that ALTO FEST community creates. 

That’s why WE NEED YOU. To grant the international feature of the festival, preserving its quality. We will keep on investing as we have done until today, but we need some help almost to support the travel costs of the artists.
The majority of the costs of ALTO FEST are born by TeatrInGestAzione.
Some services are offered by collaborators and technical sponsors.
On www.altofest.net you can follow the updates about supporters and festival’s program. 

HOW WILL WE SPEND YOUR DONATION? 

The amount will cover the travel expenses of almost 50 artists coming from all over the world. The money we aim to raise was estimated according to the total costs that the artists had to bear for their travels during the past editions.

CONTRIBUTE to our fund raising! 

SHARE with your friends! 

INVOLVE! 

COME TO ALTO FEST!!!!


Free_Bella REWARDS

story:
We Need Paint!

The Art Camper is intended to bring art supplies to share with the community during events like Burning Flipside, Art Outside, and other regional art events. The camper has been painted on 2 sides by graffiti artist Teryn M. Scaff, but we have run out of paint and funding! Please help us complete the remaining two sides of the camper with your contributions.

About The Artist

The artist's name is Teryn M. Scaff. In the graffiti world, he is known as EMD1. He has been painting for about ten years, but has been a graffiti artist for most of his life. His love and passion for this art form and way of personal expressions can be seen and felt by most. Teryn loves the daily challenges and pushing what can be done with paint (it is amazing to watch him in action!). His influences are from CAMO1, peeta and next. Teryn strives to teach this art form to others and hopes to one day have a non-profit organization in low income areas to teach kids the right way to express themselves with graffiti art legally, and to do so with taste.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to contribute in other ways, we need:

  • Ironlak spray paint.
  • Art supplies of all kinds (used is ok as long as there is life left in the supplies).
  • A talented photographer with professional camera willing to volunteer time.

story:
I recently graduated from CU and began working at a non-profit. I quickly realized that I need to do something meaningful with my life as well as do something to improve the world. My issue, however, was working in an office. Despite it being for a good cause, it wasn't nearly creative enough.

There Karma was born.

Karma allows all aspiring artists, like myself, to get some recognition, show off their talent and contribute to a good cause. When artwork is purchased, half the proceeds go to small charities, charities that are still truly focused on their goals and have low operational costs. Karma not only helps artists, but also has the potential to help the world.

We need help to create this space and to make sure our artists know we love them!

Where your money goes!

  • Sponsoring our artists
  • Building our website
  • Business Cards
  • Shipping
  • Supply Costs

What you get!

  • We will donate to a charity of YOUR choice
  • You get some recognition in our online gallery
  • We will give you a discounted piece of artwork

 

If we don't reach our goal we will start by building our website then paying our artists!


If you can't give us those dollar dollar bills, we understand.
Talk about us! Spread the word! Spread the love!
Like us on Facebook! www.facebook.com/coloradokarma

story:
Help us bring “The Wicker Wookiee” to Ignition! He's the centerpiece, guest of honor, and needs some love in order to join us at the festival! Artist Brennan Steele and the NOLA Burners regional Fire Art Safety Team are creating an incredible giant Wicker Wookiee effigy of “Chewbacchus the Sacred Drunken Wookiee.” He will be seated in a transcendental state of divine repose and will invoke the spirit of cosmic collaboration that embodies the ethos of IGNITION. We will CHEW-BURN-IT-ALL on Saturday night as the CLIMAX of the festivities... won't you join us?  

Want to be involved in the intersection of science and art in the form of Sacred Drunken Wookiee himself?  You do? Thats awesome because there are lots of fun perks for doing so... check them out in the perk section. You can pick them up at Ignition or we will send them to you!



The Wicker Wookie is comprised of special sacramental wood and enlightening LEDs and other special effects. The $4,200 goes directly towards the hard costs of wood, lights, Wookie skin and burn materials. Build materials are estimated at $3,081.00. Lighting and effects are $530. Burn Materials are $589. Magically totaling $4,200. Help bring the Wicker Wookie to life and light! Then watch him burn in all his flaming glory!


Below is the awesomeness that will be on the patch, sticker and posters. Get this swag now by donating $5, $10 or $20! 

ALL HAIL OUR SACRED DRUNKEN WOOKIEE... ON FIRE!

Below is the awesomeness that will be on the patch, sticker and posters. Get this swag now by donating $5, $10 or $20! ALL HAIL OUR SACRED DRUNKEN WOOKIEE... ON FIRE!

story:
MADArt Creative is proud to present “Morphing Me”, a pop-up multidisciplinary arts experience taking place in Lower East Side, Manhattan. “Morphing” is the first of a series of performances that will feature a reimagined version of MADArt’s UV light water/dance installation “Glow”, incorporated into an immersive setting with an expanded performing arts portion. "Morphing" will also involve award-winning composer Jeremy Howard Beck, one of America’s leading modern trombone quartets Guidonian Hand, artist Leonardo Castaneda, and MADArt's choreographer Lauren Camp.

All the artists are ready to go! Quite simply, your contribution will able to support us in producing the show, as well as achieving our mission of engaging communities that often lack access and benefits of the arts. In 2013, we want to expand our reach and invite more children to come see the show, read on about our impact on Two Bridges, a mid- low-income housing community by East River.

Our impact and how we need your help to grow -

MADArt Creative is honored to be awarded the 2013 Fund for Creative Communities Grant (The Fund) and the 2013 Manhattan Community Arts Fund Grant (MCAF) from Lower Manhattan Cultural Council. The Fund is supported by New York State Council on the Arts. MCAF is supported by the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council. This is a great stamp of approval from the arts community, but we need your help to really further our impact.

Last year, we started our partnership with Two Bridges Neighborhood Council, a subsidized housing community between Manhattan Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge in Manhattan. We began by hosting six weeks of open rehearsals at Two Bridges' 2300 sq. ft. community room, during which MADArt artists, including musicians, dancers, and choreographers,  interacted with members of this Lower East Side community while rehearsing newly-commissioned chamber pieces and original choreography.

We then transformed the venue into a 70-seat theater and held two free performances, and had nearly full houses each night.  We achieved our goal of reaching audiences who were new to the performing arts, including children. Some of these children were diagnosed with ADHD, and they were engaged for the entirety of the show, and even returned for the second night! Following the performances, audience members expressing how the show changed their perspective on the arts as elitist and that the performances had a positive impact on their neighborhood.

Where your contributions will go -

Your contribution will be absorbed into our 2013 budget, and in turn help with logistical solutions and artist fees. We are also planning to support free admission for children, giving them access to this great experience.  

Your contribution will also have perks! You’ll become part of the MADArt family, receive updates on how we are doing, and more! Read along to see perks detail.

Other Ways You Can Help -

Please, even if you can’t donate at this time, remember to share this with your friends! Check out our website and find us on facebook to keep up-to-date to what we’re doing! You can also get in touch with us to volunteer!

story:
Hey guys! thank you for looking at my campaign. My name is Rose and im 19, I have just finished a three year college course and I am now looking to kick start my career. I love to draw and I'm especially passionate about design. I'm trying my best to make an income out of selling my tattoo designs but I need a little help! :)

My campaign is to raise money to get some decent drawing materials and equipment so i can produce work that's up to a high standard for selling.

This campaign is also to help me get noticed by the puplic so I can find people I can design for.

Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. 

For me, this is as much about reaching an audience for my art work as it is about raising funds to puchase the art matericals I require. At the moment, the only people that know about my designs are close family and friends, so having people help me spread the word even if they're not able to put money in will help me out so much and I'll be so gratful!

What I need and what you get.

The money I hope to raise will be spent on art materials such as Prismacolours. I researched into these and they seem to be the best for what I want to do and i found a kit that has 150 pencils! Unfortunately, these are very expensive but apparently worth the money! The rest of the money will be spend on decent art books, drawing pads, pencils, and quality pens. At the moment Ionly have really cheap equipment that doesn't work very well.

THE PERKS! as a thank you reward, I will be offering customised tattoo designs or anything of that nature! Ranging from outlines to big coloured in drawings! all my work can be emailed over to you or posted on your facebook wall or any other social networking site so all your friends know what a great help you have been :)

If i dont raise all the money I'll just have to buy what i can out of it and just continue to save up, hopefully out of this though, I will have at least gained a little publicity for my designs.

So even if you can't donate i would very VERY much appreciate you spreading the word! :)

Thank you for checking out my campaign

Wish me luck! :) xXx

story:
De campagne op deze site is inmiddels gesloten, maar bijdrages zijn nog altijd meer dan welkom!!

Bijdrages kunnen overgemaakt worden op NL18 INGB 0002 3403 06, t.n.v. Dienke Groenhout

Alvast super bedankt voor je support!

Bezoek ook onze site www.maakfabriekopreis.nl!

=============

The campaign on this site is closed, but donations are still more than welcome!!

Contributions can be paid on IBAN bankaccount NL18 INGB 0002 3403 06, on the name of Dienke Groenhout

Thanks for your support!

Also visit our site www.maakfabriekopreis.nl!

=============

Intro

(for English see below)

Wij zijn Oscar en Dienke, en wij willen graag met onze vier kinderen van 9, 8, 5 en 4 een jaar op wereldreis. Onderweg gaan we met onze kinderen en met kinderen die we ontmoeten de Maakfabriek doen. De Maakfabriek is een soort kunstacademie voor kinderen, waar ze leren dat bijna elk idee de moeite waard kan zijn om te veranderen in een kunstwerk, een uitvinding of een project. Bij de Maakfabriek leer je mogelijkheden te zien en beperkingen de baas te worden. In Nederland bestaat de Maakfabriek al een poosje, en verschillende kinderen die eraan mee deden hebben prijzen gewonnen met hun werk. Nu gaat de Maakfabriek dus naar het buitenland. Op www.dienkegroenhout.nl/category/kids kun je er meer over te weten komen.

Van onze avonturen die we met de kinderen beleven maken we tekeningen en soms misschien collages of animaties. Zo verzamelen we een beeldverslag dat een tekenboek vol wordt!

Wat hebben we nodig & en wat krijg je ervoor terug

Om onze reis mogelijk te maken denken we 25.000 euro nodig te hebben.

Als jij wilt helpen om onze droom werkelijkheid te laten worden, krijg je in ruil daarvoor een verslag van onze avonturen met de Maakfabriek op reis. De verslagen zijn niet geschreven, maar getekend, geverfd, geanimeerd, of op een andere manier verrassend. Aan het einde van onze reis worden alle getekende verslagen verzameld en gebundeld in boekvorm, en kun je ons verhaal helemaal lezen op papier.

De donaties in de rechter kolom zijn éénmalig. Wil je doneren, maar heb je geen creditcard of PayPal? Stuur ons dan een berichtje (bijv. via het tabblad 'Comments'), dan zorgen wij dat je donatie hier terecht komt.

Achtergrond

Veel dingen in het leven lijken vanzelfsprekend, onvermijdelijk, onveranderbaar. Maar door afstand te nemen en vanuit een ander standpunt het geheel te overzien, wordt opeens duidelijk dat het ook anders kan. Dit afstand nemen en mogelijkheden zien is een belangrijk element van de Maakfabriek. Al door een kleine bijdrage te geven draag je er voor jezelf en voor anderen aan bij dat dit niet vergeten wordt.

Tenslotte

Door ons project te liken en te delen via de sociale media worden we ook al enorm geholpen, simpelweg omdat we daarmee een grote groep potentiele supporters kunnen bereiken. Bedankt!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Summary

We are Oscar and Dienke, and we are planning to make a big journey around the world with our four children aged 9, 8, 5 and 4 years old. While we are on the road we will teach children how to make art with our "Make Factory". The Make Factory teaches children that almost any idea can be used to turn into a work of art, an invention or a project. Even if it may look crazy at first!

Art has no boundaries and there is no "truth" that needs to be proven. It is all about personal experience and that makes it a very usefull tool to teach children almost anything. And to teach them how you can just change your everyday way of looking at things by stepping into the world of art. In the Make Factory children learn how to develop ideas and think of solutions rather than the bounderies.

In the Netherlands the Make Factory has been around for a while, and several children that participated in it have won awards with their works. Now the Make Factory is going on tour. If you want to learn more about the Make Factory (or join one!) please visit www.dienkegroenhout.nl/en/category/kids

What We Need & What You Get

To make our trip possible, we will need 25,000 euro

During our trip we will draw all of our adventures and experiences with the Make Factory children. They will not just be simple drawings but mixed with collages, pictures, tape or even animations. In any way, the results will always be surprising and inspiring! When we made it all around the world, we will put together all of our drawings and pieces of art in a beautiful book!

Do you want to follow our drawn adventures? And help us to sent the Make Factory on tour?

Background

Many things in life seem obvious, inevitable, unchangeable. But by taking distance and overseeing the whole thing from a different point of view it suddenly becomes clear that it can also be different. Taking this distance and seeing opportunities is an important element of the Make Factory. By participating even with a small amount you contribute for yourself and for others that this is not forgotten.

Finally

By liking our project and sharing it through social media you help us tremendously, simply because we will then reach a large group of potential supporters. Thank you!

And to teach them how you can just change your everyday way of looking at things by stepping into the world of art. In the Make Factory children learn how to develop ideas and think of solutions rather than the bounderies.
In the Netherlands the Make Factory has been around for a while, and several children that participated in it have won awards with their works. Now the Make Factory is going on tour. If you want to learn more about the Make Factory (or join one!) please visit www.dienkegroenhout.nl/en/category/kids
What We Need & What You Get



To make our trip possible, we will need 25,000 euroDuring our trip we will draw all of our adventures and experiences with the Make Factory children. They will not just be simple drawings but mixed with collages, pictures, tape or even animations. In any way, the results will always be surprising and inspiring! When we made it all around the world, we will put together all of our drawings and pieces of art in a beautiful book!
Do you want to follow our drawn adventures? And help us to sent the Make Factory on tour?
Background
Many things in life seem obvious, inevitable, unchangeable. But by taking distance and overseeing the whole thing from a different point of view it suddenly becomes clear that it can also be different. Taking this distance and seeing opportunities is an important element of the Make Factory. By participating even with a small amount you contribute for yourself and for others that this is not forgotten.
Finally
By liking our project and sharing it through social media you help us tremendously, simply because we will then reach a large group of potential supporters. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

This campaign has been established to connect individuals and organizations that enjoy supporting community art to the fundraising and sponsorship opportunities of Copper State Poetry Slam.  

Any individuals or organizations that would like to support this developing program financially can do so by making an individual contribution, or by becoming an official sponsor of the event with a minimum donation of $50.  Official sponsorship includes the option of a personalized name or organization logo on official marketing materials, including our website (www.copperstatepoetryslam.com). 

ALL donors, however, will be offered an optional gift for contributing.  Because this program is being developed as a community resource, not for profit, all contributions made through this site will be offered tickets to the event commensurate with the amount of the donation.  In other words, if you want to donate AND go to the event, you can get two birds with one stone by contributing through this fundraising website.  

Please make sure to select the option to accept the gift, when making your contribution.

 

What We Need

Copper State Poetry Slam is only in it's second year, and we are still trying to develop a budget.  As a result, budgetary needs are being kept as basic as possible.  The primary need will be going toward the cost of venue.  Phoenix Center for the Arts, our official venue for 2013, has agreed to help us develop this program by offering a discounted rate.  Part of this cost has already been covered by other sponsors.

  • Remaining cost for venue: $400

Secondly, we have established a small budget for raw materials.  These include marketing materials, poet and volunteer badges, and the like.  

  • Raw materials cost: $100

 *The campaign CAN exceed the goal of $500.

FULL DISCLOSURE:  Because this program is not yet attached to any organization or business, funds will be processed through the Event Director, Jeremiah Blue.  ALL donations will be used exclusively for the purposes outlined in the above section "What We Need".

 

The Impact

Of course, the direct impact of your contribution will go to ensure that Copper State Poetry Slam can happen successfully this year, and hopefully, establish a formidable base for continued success into the future.  

Your contribution, however, will have a couple other points of direct impact:

  • A percentage of the event's proceeds will be offered to all teams from across the state that are sending poets to national competitions in 2013, i.e. National Poetry Slam and Brave New Voices (youth nationals).
  • The official venue for this year's event is the not for profit, community arts organization, Phoenix Center for the Arts.  By establishing a relationship with the center, we are hoping to help not only develop our own program into the future but to also contribute to the role that the center plays on a daily basis for the community, as one of Phoenix's premier venues for the arts.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support by donating, please consider helping get the word out:

  • Re-post the link to the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter
  • Send your family, friends, or others an email with the link
  • Post the information in your work place
  • Tell your family and friends the next time you see them
  • Mail a note or letter with the campaign information

story:
irevuo Magazine will be a quarterly magazine dedicated to promoting unknown artists. We want to publish the first issue in January 2013.

The magazine will be available in both digital and printed editions. It will contain reviews, interviews, and a special showcase for visual artists (one artist will be chosen each issue, and promoted.) Also, we'll have articles and essays on art and related subjects.

What We Need

Basically we need to cover expenses with:

Typesetting and layout. We need to buy specialized software to do that.

We'll need to order proof copies of our printed magazine, so we can make sure that the fonts, the images, everything's perfect.

Last but not least, we'd like to pay our artists for the art they're showcasing in our magazine (paintings, sketches, fiction, etc.) We know how important this is to an artist, maybe not as much for the intrinsic value of the amount they receive, but because it acts as a sort of validation mechanism.

So we would love to be a paying magazine and pay our artists for their art.

What You Get

  • The magazine, in printed or digital format
  • Advertising. We're selling ad space at affordable rates.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any money? No problem. Let's make some noise, let's tweet and share this campaign, let more folks now about this new magazine and what it's trying to achieve.
