story:
Our Story

The Haight-Ashbury movement left an undeniable impact upon the world and the reverberations of the psychedelic sixties are still being felt today. Strangely there is no museum dedicated to keeping the history alive and relevant for the millions of visitors who come to San Francisco searching for inspiration and authenticity. A non-profit community supported museum will permanently cement San Francisco as the home of psychedelia. Our intention is for the museum to become an attraction in and of itself that will educate and inspire visitors for generations to come to reinvent the world according to how they want to live.


Help co-create the world's first museum dedicated to psychedelic art and history as well as the first museum to be established through crowdfunding. You can make this museum a reality by generously donating funds and memorabilia to the Haight-Ashbury Museum of Psychedelic Art and History. Working together we can make this happen. Thanks for your support!!!


What We Need

This initial fundraising campaign is the first step to making the Haight-Ashbury Museum a reality. The funds we raise through this fundraiser will allow for us to begin establishing the museum. The more money we raise, the better the experience the museum will deliver and the greater impact it will have upon visitors. If we reach our stated fundraising goal of $30,000 we still encourage you to contribute because we need much more than $30,000 to establish the museum.


The funds raised in this fundraiser will pay:

-To rent and prepare a space in San Francisco in time for the summer flood of tourists.

-For artists and designers to create an amazing space for the museum.

-For a dedicated grant writer to raise more funds.

-For a lawyer to file the official 501(c)(3) IRS application.

-For promotion at events, festivals, and conferences throughout the West Coast.

-For the ongoing efforts to make this museum a reality (compensating work, website, fees, etc.)


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! - Please forward this fundraiser to everyone you know.

Find the perfect building! - Help us find an amazing location for the museum in San Francisco.

Send photos of psychedelic memorabilia to donate or loan! - Looking for all things related to psychedelia.

Volunteer! -  We need your help to co-create this museum!
story_txt:
Our Story


The
Haight-Ashbury movement left an undeniable impact upon the world and
the reverberations of the psychedelic sixties are still being felt
today. Strangely there is no museum dedicated to keeping the history
alive and relevant for the millions of visitors who come to San
Francisco searching for inspiration and authenticity. A non-profit
community supported museum will permanently cement San Francisco as
the home of psychedelia. Our intention is for the museum to become an
attraction in and of itself that will educate and inspire visitors for generations to come to
reinvent the world according to how they want to live.


Help co-create the world's first museum dedicated to psychedelic art
and history as well as the first museum to be established through
crowdfunding. You can make this museum a reality by generously donating funds and memorabilia to the Haight-Ashbury Museum of
Psychedelic Art and History. Working together we can make this happen. Thanks for your support!!!


What We Need


This initial fundraising campaign is the first step to making the
Haight-Ashbury Museum a reality. The funds we raise through this
fundraiser will allow for us to begin establishing the museum. The more money we raise, the better the experience the museum will deliver and the greater impact it will have upon visitors. If we reach our stated fundraising goal of $30,000 we still encourage you to contribute because we need much more than $30,000 to establish the museum.

The funds raised in this fundraiser will
pay:

-To rent and prepare a space in San Francisco in time for the summer flood of tourists.

-For artists and designers to create an amazing space for the museum.

-For a dedicated grant writer to raise more funds.

-For a lawyer to file the official 501(c)(3) IRS application.

-For promotion at events, festivals, and conferences throughout the
West Coast.

-For the ongoing efforts to make this museum a reality (compensating work, website, fees, etc.)


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! - Please forward this fundraiser to
everyone you know.

Find the perfect building! - Help us find an amazing location for the museum in San Francisco.
Send photos of psychedelic memorabilia to donate or
loan! - Looking for all things related to psychedelia.
Volunteer! -  We need your help to co-create this museum!

story:
Ein Boot auf Land, die Kraft des Windes und ein Künstler, der allen Unwägbarkeiten zum Trotz vorwärts strebt.
Für die deutsche Version nach unten scrollen...

LAND-SAILOR

The desert, the sea, lonesome landscapes or simply the view from a mountain’s peak. Vastness, in which your view is not disturbed by anything and you find nothing to focus on has always fascinated me.

Surrounded by nature’s forces you realize your true size, social problems become less important, your own horizon is broadened and the things that absorb you in your everyday life become less important.

Whoever has been seized by this longing for freedom, vastness and silence, can’t get it out of his head....

 

WHAT IT IS ABOUT

For my next art project I am going to travel into the vastness of Patagonia. Here, I hope to find permanent wind, most of the time from a south-southeastern direction, which, in connection with the plain, apparently infinite scenery along the coast and in the pampas, will provide me with the ideal condition for my plan. I will leave in the best, as windiest, time of the year in February, two months on the go will follow!

 

HOW IT HAPPENS

With a sailing boat which has been equipped with wheels I am going to sail across the country on the road E3 and on small lonesome side streets from the south of Patagonia which is nearly unsettled across the pampas northward towards civilization.

Only powered by the force of the wind, I will be completely dependent on this element. In contrast to sailing on water it is not possible for me to cruise against the wind on the street. The direction of the wind has to be the right one to make headway. I will have to sit out a calm or headwind, always hoping that the next wind will soon make amends for it.

Thus, I will proceed northwards according to wind, course of roads and weather, aiming at Buenos Aires. I will go as far as the wind becomes a breeze, too weak to power the boat or civilization represented by traffic lights and power lines over the streets, or a bigger amount of traffic or traffic policeman will make my underpinning impossible...

As a result of this trip I will produce a video installation on several channels integrating my real, converted sailing boat.

THE FINANCING

To be able to realize this project, 39,000 US$ are necessary. This sum consists of material sponsorship, personal contribution and crowdfunding (18.000US$):

  • 17,500 US$ for the sailing boat, rebuilding it and the transport to Argentina
  • 17,000 US$ for film production and post production
  • 4,500 US$ for collages (photograph development and shipping)

If need be, I am happy to send you a detailed cost calculation of the project.


Crowdfunding

Everybody who likes the idea can support me according to his or her means and possibilities. Besides that, it is about gaining a bit more (creative) freedom with your help. According to each sum every supporter receives a service in return.

*The collages and fine art prints will be produced and delivered after the sailing trip. If the project should not take place due to unknown reasons, I will guarantee that you get back your money instead of the collages and fine art prints. An early failure of the project in Patagonia is not implied here. 

To every supporter it is guaranteed that the provided means are only used for this restricted purpose.

Further needs:

Who would like to support me otherwise, can get in touch with me directly.
In addition to the crowd funding, further sponsors are needed to gain the entire required material. Moreover, there is the possibility to get engaged with the project, to offer know-how or to take part organizationally. The expenses can be considerably lowered thereby. This engagement will be paid with postcards and collages, too.

The following support is searched for right now:

  • shipment of the sailing boat: does somebody know a lot about prices, containers and duty regulations for products shipped to Argentina? Personal contacts with international forwarding agencies and shipping company would be very helpful
  • we search for a fold-up bicycle as "a dinghy". If somebody has a functioning one, I would be very grateful
  • translations: the plan is to be translated into good Spanish.
  • who is in touch with Argentinian art facilities, curators, institutions, etc. to support the project – an official letter of a big institution could tune a crusty policeman more leniently...
  • generally exhibition possibilities for this project
  • tips and contacts with material sponsors and supporters
  • press contacts to help the project to more publicity
  • tell about this project your friends and colleagues, to all that might enjoy it.

I hope that it will be possible to realize this project with your help and support!

 


Showcase projects

With this project I am referring to two of my former works. They are based on similar questions, as the given examples will show. You can find further work on my web page: www.danielbeerstecher.de

Outdoor-Mobil 
2010 | Photos, slide show | 6:40 min

On a small, converted truck I hit the road to Rimini. The loading area of the truck has been transformed into an Outdoor-Mobil with a real lawn, bushes, a tent and a fireplace, which one can all together set up into a wild natural camping area immediately. The slide show presents the course of my 10-day trip over the Passo del San Gottardo to the Lago di Como and further to the beaches of Rimini, as well as the way back via Venice and the Passo del Brennero. This reflects the classical holiday itinerary to Italy that many Germans chose during the times of the wirtschaftswunder, the so-called economic miracle of the 1950s. 
More information here

 

 

Sand by the Sea
2010 | video | 31:20 min

I crossed the Sahara desert dressed in a surfer´s outfit and carrying a surfboard under my arms. For half an hour one can watch me trying to come closer and closer towards the sea. The desert inhabitants who I meet are asked to tell me the way. Through the photographs that tell a story and the especially composed music a certain dense atmosphere for this absurd journey is created, which initiates reflection also of the medium film itself. It is a cinematographic picture story between movie, art and performance.
More information here

 

 

German version

 

LAND-SAILOR

ein Kunstprojekt von Daniel Beerstecher

Die Wüste, das Meer, einsame Landschaften oder einfach die Sicht vom Gipfel eines Berges. Weite, in der der Blick durch nichts gestört wird und kaum einen Halt findet, hat mich schon immer fasziniert.

Umgeben von Naturgewalten wird man sich seiner wahren Größe bewusst, gesellschaftliche Probleme verlieren an Bedeutung, der eigene Horizont erweitert sich und die Dinge, die uns in unserem Alltag fesseln und überlebenswichtig erscheinen, treten in den Hintergrund.

Wer einmal von dieser Sehnsucht nach Freiheit, Weite und Ruhe ergriffen wurde, den lässt sie nicht mehr los...

 

WORUM GEHT'S

Für mein nächstes Kunstprojekt begebe ich mich in die Weite Patagoniens. Hier finde ich stetig anhaltenden Wind, meist aus süd-südöstlicher Richtung, der in Verbindung mit der flachen, unendlich scheinenden Landschaft entlang der Küste und in der Pampa, die ideale Voraussetzung für mein Vorhaben bietet. Zur besten Jahreszeit im Februar geht es los, zwei Monate lang werde ich etwa unterwegs sein!

 

WIE PASSIERT'S

Mit meinem Segelboot, das mit Rädern ausgestattet wird, möchte ich über Land auf der Hauptstraße E3 und auf kleinen einsamen Nebenstraßen vom beinahe unbesiedelten Süden Patagoniens durch die Pampa nordwärts Richtung Zivilisation segeln.

Allein angetrieben von der Kraft des Windes, bin ich ganz und gar von diesem Element abhängig. Im Gegensatz zum Seglen auf dem Wasser ist es mir auf der Straße nicht möglich, gegen den Wind zu kreuzen. Die Windrichtung muss stimmen, um voranzukommen. Eine Flaute oder Gegenwind müssen ausgesessen werden, immer in der Hoffnung, dass es sich bald bessert.

So geht es je nach Wind, Straßenverlauf und Wetter gen Norden, Richtung Buenos Aires. So weit, bis der Wind zu schwach wird, das Boot anzutreiben oder bis die Zivilisation durch Ampeln und Stromleitungen über den Straßen, ein großes Verkehrsaufkommen oder Verkehrspolizisten mein Unterfangen unmöglich macht...

Als Resultat dieser Reise soll eine Mehrkanal-Videoinstallation entstehen, in deren Zentrum mein originales, umgebautes Segelboot steht.

 

Die Finanzierung

Um dieses Projekt realisieren zu können, sind 30.000€ nötig.
Diese Summe setzt sich aus Crowdfunding (14.000€), Materialsponsoring und Eigenleistung so zusammen: 

  • 13.500,- € für Segelboot, Umbau und Transport
  • 13.000,- € Filmproduktion + Postporduktion
  • 3.500,- € Collagen (Fotoausdrucke, Rahmung, Versand)

Auf Wunsch schicke ich gerne auch eine detaillierte Kostenkalkulation des Projektes zu.

Crowdfunding

Jeder, dem die Idee gefällt, kann mich nach seinen Mitteln und Möglichkeiten unterstützen. Dabei geht es um nichts weniger, als mit eurer Hilfe ein Stück Freiheit zu erlangen. Je nach Höhe des Betrags erhält jeder Unterstützer eine Gegenleistung. Siehe Perks.

*Collagen und Fine Art Prints werden nach dem Segeltörn erstellt und ausgeliefert. Falls das Projekt aus unbekannten Gründen doch nicht stattfinden sollte, besteht die Möglichkeit, anstelle der Collagen und Fine Art Prints sein Geld zurück zu bekommen. Ein frühzeitiges Scheitern des Projektes in Patagonien ist hier nicht eingeschlossen.

Jedem Unterstützer wird garantiert, dass die zur Verfügung gestellten Mittel ausschließlich zweckgebunden verwendet werden. 

 

Weitere Hilfen:

Zusätzlich zum Crowdfunding werden Sponsoren für Materialen und den Transport des Bootes angefragt, um die Kosten möglichst niedrig zu halten.

Außerdem besteht die Möglichkeit, mit anzupacken, Know-how einzubringen oder sich organisatorisch zu beteiligen. Dadurch können die Kosten erheblich gesenkt werden. Auch dieses Engagement wird mit Postkarten und Collagen honoriert. Folgende Unterstützung wird gebraucht:

  • Verschiffung des Segelbootes: kennt sich jemand mit Preisen, Containern und Zollbestimmungen für Ware nach Übersee aus? Persönliche Kontakte zuinternationalen Speditionen und Redereien wären sehr hilfreich.
  • Wir suchen ein Klappfahrrad als „Beiboot“. Falls jemand ein gebrauchfähiges hat, bin ich sehr dankbar.
  • Übersetzungen: das Konzept soll in gutes Spanisch übersetzt werden... Meine  Sprachfähigkeiten reichen hierzu leider nicht aus
  • Wer hat Kontakt zu argentinischen Kunsteinrichtungen, Kuratoren, Institutionen, um das Projekt abzusichern- ein offizielles Schreiben von einer großen Institution könnt einen schlecht gelaunten Polizisten gnädiger stimmen...
  • Ausstellungsmöglichkeiten im Allgemeinen für dieses Projekt. Tipps und Kontakte zu Sponsoren und FördererPressekontakte, um dem Projekt zu mehr Öffentlichkeit zu verhelfen
  • Postet das Projekt auf eurer Facebookseite und ladet eure Freunde ein, dass Projekt auf Indiegogo zu besuchen. 
  • Das Weitersenden dieses Konzepts an Freunde und Bekannte- vor allem an jene, bei denen ihr euch vorstellen könnt, dass sie an diesem Projekt gefallen finden. Ihr findet in der Galerie eine PDF-Version zum runterladen.

Ich hoffe, dass es mit eurer Hilfe und Unterstützung möglich wird, das Projekt Land-Sailor zu realisieren!

Referenz-Projekte

Mit diesem Projekt knüpfe ich an meine früheren Arbeiten an. Sie basieren auf ähnlichen Fragestellungen, wie die ausgewählten Beispielprojekte zeigen. Weitere Arbeiten findet ihr auf meiner Webseite: www.danielbeerstecher.de

 


OUTDOOR-MOBIL 
2010 | Fotos, Diaistallation | 6:40 min

In einem kleinen, umgebauten LKW mache ich mich auf den Weg nach Rimini. Die Ladeflächen des LKWs wurden mit einer Wiese, mit Büschen, Zelt und Feuerstelle zu einem Outdoor-Mobil umgestaltet, das bei jedem Halt sofort in ein wildes Naturcampingareal verwandelt werden kann. Die Diashow zeigt den Verlauf meiner zehntägigen Reise über den Gotthard bis zum Lago di Como und weiter zum Strand in Rimini, sowie die Rückreise über Venedig und den Brennerpass. Dies entspricht etwa der klassischen Reiseroute nach Italien, wie sie viele Deutsche zur Zeit des Wirtschaftswunders gewählt haben.
Mehr Informationen zu diesem Projekt hier

 

 

Sand am Meer
2010 | Video | 31:20 min

Im Surferoutfit und mit Surfbrett unter dem Arm durchquere ich in „Sand am Meer“ die Sahara. Eine halbe Stunde lang ist zu sehen, wie ich Schritt für Schritt versuche, dem Meer näher zu kommen. Die Wüstenbewohner, denen ich begegne, frage ich nach dem Weg. Die erzählerisch fotografierten Bilder und die extra komponierte Filmmusik verleihen der absurden Reise eine spezielle, dichte Atmosphäre, die auch auf der Ebene des Mediums Film Reflexion erlaubt. Eine kinematografische Bildergeschichte zwischen Kino, Kunst und Performance. 
Mehr Informationen zu diesem Projekt hier

 

 
 

Portuguese version

 

LAND-SAILOR

Um projeto de Daniel Beerstecher

Deserto, mar, paisagens solitárias ou, simplesmente, a vista do pico de uma montanha. Uma vastidão em que não nos fixamos em algum ponto específico sempre me fascinou.

Estar cercado pela natureza faz com que nos demos conta de nosso real tamanho, problemas sociais parecem menos importantes, o nosso horizonte é ampliado e as questões do dia-a-dia, que parecem fundamentais para a sobrevivência, tornam-se menos relevantes.

Quem quer que tenha sido tocado por esse desejo por liberdade, vastidão e silêncio, não pode tirar isso da cabeça...


                                       O QUE ESTÁ EM QUESTÃO

O meu próximo projeto de arte é uma viagem pela vastidão da Patagônia. Lá, espero encontrar vento constante, sul-sudeste na maior parte do tempo, que, somado ao relevo de planície -- uma paisagem aparentemente infinita ao longo da costa e nos pampas -- irá possibilitar as condições ideais para o meu plano. Vou partir no melhor período do ano, com as melhores condições de vento: fevereiro. A partir daí, dois meses irão passar!

 

COMO ISSO VAI ACONTECER

Com um veleiro equipado com rodas, irei velejar pela rodovia E3 e por pequenas e solitárias ruas do sul da Patagônia, praticamente inabitadas nos pampas no sentido norte, em direção a Buenos Aires.

Contando apenas com o vento como combustível, estarei totalmente dependente dele para me movimentar. Diferente de velejar na água, em terra não terei a opção de ir contra o vento. A sua direção tem que estar de acordo com o roteiro que preciso seguir.  Terei que abrir mão também das brisas, sempre esperando que o vento que vem a seguir faça as pazes comigo. 

Indícios de civilização podem ser obstáculos para a passagem da embarcação, como sinais de trânsito e fios de alta tensão... Há ainda outros possíveis adversários, como a presença de tráfego ou guardas de trânsito. 

Como resultado da viagem, irei produzir uma videoinstalação em diferentes canais, onde também estará presente o meu veleiro.

Financiamento

Para realizar o projeto são necessários 30 mil euros. Essa soma consiste em patrocínio(16.000€) e crowd funding (14.000 €):

  • 13.000 € para o veleiro, reforma e transporte
  • 12.000 € para a produção e pós-produção do filme
  • 3.500 € para o desenvolvimento das colagens (fotografia e postagem)
     


Crowd funding

Todos os que gostarem da ideia podem apoiar de acordo com suas possibilidades. De acordo com a contribuição, cada apoiador receberá algo em troca:

*As colagens serão enviadas para os destinatários após a viagem. Se o projeto não ocorrer por alguma razão, garanto a devolução do seu dinheiro ao invés do envio das colagens. Se houver a impossibilidade de dar continuidade ao projeto (razões climáticas, policiais, mecânicas etc), quando já estiver em andamento na Patagônia, não haverá devolução dos recursos, pois estes já terão sido aplicados na viagem e adequação do veleiro. 

Para todos os apoiadores, há a garantia de que os recursos serão utilizados apenas para os propósitos aqui listados. Se houver interesse, posso enviar o custo detalhado do projeto. 

 

Outras necessidades:

Quem quiser apoiar o projeto de outra forma, pode entrar em contato comigo (veja abaixo). Além do crowd funding, outros patrocinadores são necessários. Fora isso, há a possibilidade de se engajar com o projeto, oferecendo know how ou participando da organização. Dessa forma, os gastos podem ser consideravelmente reduzidos. O engajamento será pago com cartões postais e colagens. O apoio a seguir é necessário no momento:

  • transporte do veleiro: alguém tem conhecimento de preços, containers e regulação de impostos para produtos transportados para a Argentina? Contatos de pessoas em agências de exportação e transportadoras são bem-vindos.
  • preciso de bicicletas dobráveis . Se alguém tiver alguma disponível, ficarei muito grato.
  • tradução: o plano é traduzir esse material também para o espanhol.
  • alguém tem contato com espaços de arte argentinos, curadores, instituições etc para dar apoio? Uma carta oficial de uma grande instituição pode facilitar negociações com algum policial mais “truculento”.  
  • possibilidades de exibição do projeto.
  • dicas e contatos de possíveis patrocinadores e apoiadores.
  • contatos de imprensa para divulgar o projeto.
  • enviar esse conceito para amigos, para todos aqueles que possam curtir a ideia.

Espero que seja possível realizar o projeto com a sua ajuda e apoio!

Outros projetos:

O projeto que acabo de apresentar tem relação com dois anteriores. Eles se baseiam em questões similares, como você pode conferir a seguir. Outros trabalhos podem ser conferidos em meu site: www.danielbeerstecher.com

 


OUTDOOR-MOBIL 
2010 | fotos, slide show | 6:40 min

Numa caminhonete adaptada eu peguei a estrada para Rimini. A caçamba da caminhonete foi transformada em um outdoor móvel com gramado, arbustos, uma barraca e uma lareira, podendo ser percebida como uma área de camping selvagem. O slide show mostra momentos de minha viagem de 10 dias pelo Passo del San Gottardo para o Lago di Como, e também para as praias de Rimini. O caminho de volta foi por Veneza e Passo del Brennero. Muitos alemães faziam esse roteiro clássico de viagem para a Itália, em épocas de feriado, no período chamado wirtschaftswunder,  conhecido como milagre econômico dos anos 1950. 

Mais informações AQUI

 



Sand am Meer

2010 | vídeo  | 31:20 min

Eu cruzei o deserto de Saara com roupas de surfista, carregando uma prancha. Por meia hora, é possível assistir a minha tentativa de me aproximar do mar. Eu pergunto aos  habitantes do deserto que encontro pelo caminho por onde devo seguir. Através das fotografias que contam uma história e da composição musical, é criada uma densa atmosfera para essa jornada absurda, que detona reflexões sobre o próprio meio filme. Esse é um trabalho entre o cinema e a performance.

Mais informações AQUI

Die Wüste, das Meer, einsame Landschaften oder einfach die Sicht vom Gipfel eines Berges. Weite, in der der Blick durch nichts gestört wird und kaum einen Halt findet, hat mich schon immer fasziniert.
Umgeben von Naturgewalten wird man sich seiner wahren Größe bewusst, gesellschaftliche Probleme verlieren an Bedeutung, der eigene Horizont erweitert sich und die Dinge, die uns in unserem Alltag fesseln und überlebenswichtig erscheinen, treten in den Hintergrund.
Wer einmal von dieser Sehnsucht nach Freiheit, Weite und Ruhe ergriffen wurde, den lässt sie nicht mehr los...
 
WORUM GEHT'S 

Für mein nächstes Kunstprojekt begebe ich mich in die Weite Patagoniens. Hier finde ich stetig anhaltenden Wind, meist aus süd-südöstlicher Richtung, der in Verbindung mit der flachen, unendlich scheinenden Landschaft entlang der Küste und in der Pampa, die ideale Voraussetzung für mein Vorhaben bietet. Zur besten Jahreszeit im Februar geht es los, zwei Monate lang werde ich etwa unterwegs sein!
 
WIE PASSIERT'S
Mit meinem Segelboot, das mit Rädern ausgestattet wird, möchte ich über Land auf der Hauptstraße E3 und auf kleinen einsamen Nebenstraßen vom beinahe unbesiedelten Süden Patagoniens durch die Pampa nordwärts Richtung Zivilisation segeln.
Allein angetrieben von der Kraft des Windes, bin ich ganz und gar von diesem Element abhängig. Im Gegensatz zum Seglen auf dem Wasser ist es mir auf der Straße nicht möglich, gegen den Wind zu kreuzen. Die Windrichtung muss stimmen, um voranzukommen. Eine Flaute oder Gegenwind müssen ausgesessen werden, immer in der Hoffnung, dass es sich bald bessert.

So geht es je nach Wind, Straßenverlauf und Wetter gen Norden, Richtung Buenos Aires. So weit, bis der Wind zu schwach wird, das Boot anzutreiben oder bis die Zivilisation durch Ampeln und Stromleitungen über den Straßen, ein großes Verkehrsaufkommen oder Verkehrspolizisten mein Unterfangen unmöglich macht...
Als Resultat dieser Reise soll eine Mehrkanal-Videoinstallation entstehen, in deren Zentrum mein originales, umgebautes Segelboot steht.
 

Die Finanzierung
Um dieses Projekt realisieren zu können, sind 30.000€ nötig. Diese Summe setzt sich aus Crowdfunding (14.000€), Materialsponsoring und Eigenleistung so zusammen: 

13.500,- € für Segelboot, Umbau und Transport
13.000,- € Filmproduktion + Postporduktion
3.500,- € Collagen (Fotoausdrucke, Rahmung, Versand)

Auf Wunsch schicke ich gerne auch eine detaillierte Kostenkalkulation des Projektes zu.
Crowdfunding
Jeder, dem die Idee gefällt, kann mich nach seinen Mitteln und Möglichkeiten unterstützen. Dabei geht es um nichts weniger, als mit eurer Hilfe ein Stück Freiheit zu erlangen. Je nach Höhe des Betrags erhält jeder Unterstützer eine Gegenleistung. Siehe Perks.
*Collagen und Fine Art Prints werden nach dem Segeltörn erstellt und ausgeliefert. Falls das Projekt aus unbekannten Gründen doch nicht stattfinden sollte, besteht die Möglichkeit, anstelle der Collagen und Fine Art Prints sein Geld zurück zu bekommen. Ein frühzeitiges Scheitern des Projektes in Patagonien ist hier nicht eingeschlossen.
Jedem Unterstützer wird garantiert, dass die zur Verfügung gestellten Mittel ausschließlich zweckgebunden verwendet werden. 
 

Weitere Hilfen:

Zusätzlich zum Crowdfunding werden Sponsoren für Materialen und den Transport des Bootes angefragt, um die Kosten möglichst niedrig zu halten.
Außerdem besteht die Möglichkeit, mit anzupacken, Know-how einzubringen oder sich organisatorisch zu beteiligen. Dadurch können die Kosten erheblich gesenkt werden. Auch dieses Engagement wird mit Postkarten und Collagen honoriert. Folgende Unterstützung wird gebraucht:

Verschiffung des Segelbootes: kennt sich jemand mit Preisen, Containern und Zollbestimmungen für Ware nach Übersee aus? Persönliche Kontakte zuinternationalen Speditionen und Redereien wären sehr hilfreich.
Wir suchen ein Klappfahrrad als „Beiboot“. Falls jemand ein gebrauchfähiges hat, bin ich sehr dankbar.

Übersetzungen: das Konzept soll in gutes Spanisch übersetzt werden... Meine  Sprachfähigkeiten reichen hierzu leider nicht aus
Wer hat Kontakt zu argentinischen Kunsteinrichtungen, Kuratoren, Institutionen, um das Projekt abzusichern- ein offizielles Schreiben von einer großen Institution könnt einen schlecht gelaunten Polizisten gnädiger stimmen...
Ausstellungsmöglichkeiten im Allgemeinen für dieses Projekt. Tipps und Kontakte zu Sponsoren und FördererPressekontakte, um dem Projekt zu mehr Öffentlichkeit zu verhelfen
Postet das Projekt auf eurer Facebookseite und ladet eure Freunde ein, dass Projekt auf Indiegogo zu besuchen. 
Das Weitersenden dieses Konzepts an Freunde und Bekannte- vor allem an jene, bei denen ihr euch vorstellen könnt, dass sie an diesem Projekt gefallen finden. Ihr findet in der Galerie eine PDF-Version zum runterladen.

Ich hoffe, dass es mit eurer Hilfe und Unterstützung möglich wird, das Projekt Land-Sailor zu realisieren!



Referenz-Projekte
Mit diesem Projekt knüpfe ich an meine früheren Arbeiten an. Sie basieren auf ähnlichen Fragestellungen, wie die ausgewählten Beispielprojekte zeigen. Weitere Arbeiten findet ihr auf meiner Webseite: www.danielbeerstecher.de



 

OUTDOOR-MOBIL 2010 | Fotos, Diaistallation | 6:40 min
In einem kleinen, umgebauten LKW mache ich mich auf den Weg nach Rimini. Die Ladeflächen des LKWs wurden mit einer Wiese, mit Büschen, Zelt und Feuerstelle zu einem Outdoor-Mobil umgestaltet, das bei jedem Halt sofort in ein wildes Naturcampingareal verwandelt werden kann. Die Diashow zeigt den Verlauf meiner zehntägigen Reise über den Gotthard bis zum Lago di Como und weiter zum Strand in Rimini, sowie die Rückreise über Venedig und den Brennerpass. Dies entspricht etwa der klassischen Reiseroute nach Italien, wie sie viele Deutsche zur Zeit des Wirtschaftswunders gewählt haben.
Mehr Informationen zu diesem Projekt hier



 

 
Sand am Meer2010 | Video | 31:20 min
Im Surferoutfit und mit Surfbrett unter dem Arm durchquere ich in „Sand am Meer“ die Sahara. Eine halbe Stunde lang ist zu sehen, wie ich Schritt für Schritt versuche, dem Meer näher zu kommen. Die Wüstenbewohner, denen ich begegne, frage ich nach dem Weg. Die erzählerisch fotografierten Bilder und die extra komponierte Filmmusik verleihen der absurden Reise eine spezielle, dichte Atmosphäre, die auch auf der Ebene des Mediums Film Reflexion erlaubt. Eine kinematografische Bildergeschichte zwischen Kino, Kunst und Performance. Mehr Informationen zu diesem Projekt hier
 


 
 
Portuguese version
 


LAND-SAILOR
Um projeto de Daniel Beerstecher
Deserto, mar, paisagens solitárias ou, simplesmente, a vista do pico de uma montanha. Uma vastidão em que não nos fixamos em algum ponto específico sempre me fascinou. Estar cercado pela natureza faz com que nos demos conta de nosso real tamanho, problemas sociais parecem menos importantes, o nosso horizonte é ampliado e as questões do dia-a-dia, que parecem fundamentais para a sobrevivência, tornam-se menos relevantes. Quem quer que tenha sido tocado por esse desejo por liberdade, vastidão e silêncio, não pode tirar isso da cabeça...                                       O QUE ESTÁ EM QUESTÃO

O meu próximo projeto de arte é uma viagem pela vastidão da Patagônia. Lá, espero encontrar vento constante, sul-sudeste na maior parte do tempo, que, somado ao relevo de planície -- uma paisagem aparentemente infinita ao longo da costa e nos pampas -- irá possibilitar as condições ideais para o meu plano. Vou partir no melhor período do ano, com as melhores condições de vento: fevereiro. A partir daí, dois meses irão passar!
 
COMO ISSO VAI ACONTECER
Com um veleiro equipado com rodas, irei velejar pela rodovia E3 e por pequenas e solitárias ruas do sul da Patagônia, praticamente inabitadas nos pampas no sentido norte, em direção a Buenos Aires. Contando apenas com o vento como combustível, estarei totalmente dependente dele para me movimentar. Diferente de velejar na água, em terra não terei a opção de ir contra o vento. A sua direção tem que estar de acordo com o roteiro que preciso seguir.  Terei que abrir mão também das brisas, sempre esperando que o vento que vem a seguir faça as pazes comigo. 

Indícios de civilização podem ser obstáculos para a passagem da embarcação, como sinais de trânsito e fios de alta tensão... Há ainda outros possíveis adversários, como a presença de tráfego ou guardas de trânsito. Como resultado da viagem, irei produzir uma videoinstalação em diferentes canais, onde também estará presente o meu veleiro.

Financiamento
Para realizar o projeto são necessários 30 mil euros. Essa soma consiste em patrocínio(16.000€) e crowd funding (14.000 €):

13.000 € para o veleiro, reforma e transporte
12.000 € para a produção e pós-produção do filme
3.500 € para o desenvolvimento das colagens (fotografia e postagem)
 


Crowd funding
Todos os que gostarem da ideia podem apoiar de acordo com suas possibilidades. De acordo com a contribuição, cada apoiador receberá algo em troca:
*As colagens serão enviadas para os destinatários após a viagem. Se o projeto não ocorrer por alguma razão, garanto a devolução do seu dinheiro ao invés do envio das colagens. Se houver a impossibilidade de dar continuidade ao projeto (razões climáticas, policiais, mecânicas etc), quando já estiver em andamento na Patagônia, não haverá devolução dos recursos, pois estes já terão sido aplicados na viagem e adequação do veleiro. 
Para todos os apoiadores, há a garantia de que os recursos serão utilizados apenas para os propósitos aqui listados. Se houver interesse, posso enviar o custo detalhado do projeto. 
 



Outras necessidades:
Quem quiser apoiar o projeto de outra forma, pode entrar em contato comigo (veja abaixo). Além do crowd funding, outros patrocinadores são necessários. Fora isso, há a possibilidade de se engajar com o projeto, oferecendo know how ou participando da organização. Dessa forma, os gastos podem ser consideravelmente reduzidos. O engajamento será pago com cartões postais e colagens. O apoio a seguir é necessário no momento:

transporte do veleiro: alguém tem conhecimento de preços, containers e regulação de impostos para produtos transportados para a Argentina? Contatos de pessoas em agências de exportação e transportadoras são bem-vindos.
preciso de bicicletas dobráveis . Se alguém tiver alguma disponível, ficarei muito grato.
tradução: o plano é traduzir esse material também para o espanhol.
alguém tem contato com espaços de arte argentinos, curadores, instituições etc para dar apoio? Uma carta oficial de uma grande instituição pode facilitar negociações com algum policial mais “truculento”.  
possibilidades de exibição do projeto.
dicas e contatos de possíveis patrocinadores e apoiadores.
contatos de imprensa para divulgar o projeto.
enviar esse conceito para amigos, para todos aqueles que possam curtir a ideia.

Espero que seja possível realizar o projeto com a sua ajuda e apoio!




Outros projetos:

O projeto que acabo de apresentar tem relação com dois anteriores. Eles se baseiam em questões similares, como você pode conferir a seguir. Outros trabalhos podem ser conferidos em meu site: www.danielbeerstecher.com



 

OUTDOOR-MOBIL 2010 | fotos, slide show | 6:40 min

Numa caminhonete adaptada eu peguei a estrada para Rimini. A caçamba da caminhonete foi transformada em um outdoor móvel com gramado, arbustos, uma barraca e uma lareira, podendo ser percebida como uma área de camping selvagem. O slide show mostra momentos de minha viagem de 10 dias pelo Passo del San Gottardo para o Lago di Como, e também para as praias de Rimini. O caminho de volta foi por Veneza e Passo del Brennero. Muitos alemães faziam esse roteiro clássico de viagem para a Itália, em épocas de feriado, no período chamado wirtschaftswunder,  conhecido como milagre econômico dos anos 1950. 
Mais informações AQUI


 


Sand am Meer
2010 | vídeo  | 31:20 min
Eu cruzei o deserto de Saara com roupas de surfista, carregando uma prancha. Por meia hora, é possível assistir a minha tentativa de me aproximar do mar. Eu pergunto aos  habitantes do deserto que encontro pelo caminho por onde devo seguir. Através das fotografias que contam uma história e da composição musical, é criada uma densa atmosfera para essa jornada absurda, que detona reflexões sobre o próprio meio filme. Esse é um trabalho entre o cinema e a performance.
Mais informações AQUI

story:
Hyperflesh Markup Language at the Banff Centre


I am a queer, HIV-positive artist living and working in Montreal, Quebec. Since graduating from the Intermedia/Cyberarts program at Concordia University in April 2011, I have been working extremely hard at fostering my emerging art practice. Recently I was accepted to participate in a thematic residency entitled Art and the effects of the Real at the Banff Centre in Banff, Alberta. Directed by Vancouver-based artist and academic Ken Lum, the residency will take place over 50 days in January and February 2012. It is a unique opportunity to dedicate myself to producing art work and developing my art practice in an exciting new direction. I only recently found out about my acceptance and therefore need to raise the necessary funding in a short period of time. This is why I am turning to you through IndieGoGo in order to make this great opportunity to grow as an artist into a reality.


Hyperflesh Markup Language is the title of my proposed program of research and creation at the Banff Centre. The title is a play on the technical term "hypertext markup language" ie: the coding language used to program websites. As such, the art that I will be making will examine the space where the body, identity, and the Internet intersect. My focus will be on creating performative works that draw upon queer cyberspace as sites for personal disclosure and play. Using the print, video, and studio resources of the Banff Centre, I will be making work that exists both online (as animated GIFs and videos) and as physical objects like large-scale photographic prints, sculptural installations, and text-based wall works made with materials like vinyl, styrofoam, and neon signage. I will also being using web broadcasting and social media tools as venues for live performances. The subject matter for these works will come from online sources and digital artifacts such as chat transcripts, user profiles on cruising websites, blogs, pornographic images and videos. 


[To get a better idea of what some of this might look like as well as my past work, check out my website: www.vincentchevalier.ca]


The Impact


This residency is an amazing chance for me to grow as an artist and to push my emerging art practice into a professional context. It will be my first residency opportunity outside of university and I will be making links with my artistic peers from all over the country. As a program of work that uses the internet as a point of creation and dissemination, the audience for my work will be far-reaching and diverse.  


This is important because I present an important point of view in terms of the art that I am producing. As a queer, HIV-positive artist, the action of disclosure is prevalent in all of my work; it is a relentless process through which I situate myself towards others and within the world. Some – many – of my works deal with personal disclosure: for example, I discuss my HIV status, expose my queerness or report my sexual history. Some – most – examine the structures of disclosure (discursive, formal, cultural). I employ disclosure as a means to initiate a circuit of information, feeling, and/or action between myself and the viewer. It is in this evolving process of exchange that my art works are reproduced from my everyday experience. So far, I have found that my work does a lot to stimulate a discussion around what it means to live with HIV/AIDS. The internet has been a really useful tool to do this and I am excited to engage in an artistic residency program that will allow me to push my engagement with an online audience even further.


Without your help I may have to greatly reduce the amount or quality of work that I would like to produce during my residency, or in the worst case scenario not attend the program at all. I am doing everything that I am capable of to make this happen, however as a recent University graduate and struggling artist, I have limited resources for raising this money in such a short period. 


What I Need & What You Get


As previously mentioned, I received my acceptance into the program at the end of September, which leaves a very short turn around time to raise the money to go. Right now, I have just enough money to pay for the tuition cost of the program. Unfortunately, I do not have the time to raise the money for any other expenses related to my residency. This is why I am turning to you through this IndieGogo campaign. The $3000 raised with this campaign will go towards covering three things: my materials budget, travel expenses, and living expenses other than room and board at the Banff Centre. 


Here is a breakdown of those expenses:


$1500 materials


This consists of the biggest portion of the money that I need to raise in order to have a successful residency.  Some concrete expenses that I will need to cover are a new hard drive and printing costs at the Banff Centre digital labs. Furthermore, as an experimental residency, I need to have a materials budget that allows for me to try things out and adapt to new demands in my production. 


$1000 travel


The residency begins on January 4th and I will be traveling to Banff from Montreal between January 1st and 3rd, depending if I can afford to fly or have to take the bus. This is the peak season for air, train, and bus travel and as such everything will be more expensive.


$500 living expenses


Although my room and board are covered in my tuition fee for the program, I will still need money to help pay for any other daily/monthly living expenses for the 50+ days that I will be at or traveling to and from the Banff Centre. This includes subsidizing the payment of two months of my HIV medication before leaving Montreal.


While I have applied for a grant from the Conseil des arts et des lettres du Quebec, I will only find out if I received the grant in January. Considering the current funding climate for the arts, this granting program is highly competitive and there is no assurance that I will receive the money. Therefore it is imperative that I raise this money before I go to Banff. 


The great thing about contributing to this project is that you will receive a piece of my artistic production in the process. Depending on how much you donate, this will include items from previous projects including a set of 5 postcards from my PWIFd project and temporary tattoos versions of my hanky code tattoo project, as well as new art works that I will produce while I am in Banff. These will take the form of personalized animated GIFs and accompanying mail art works that I will send to you from Banff. I am excited at the opportunity to use the residency as a way to get my art out to new audiences in fun and innovative ways. As a contributor to this IndieGoGo campaign, you will be participating in this process.


Other Ways You Can Help


Tell your friends, family, internet acquaintances, art lovers, fellow queers, allies and individuals interested in supporting queer/activist oriented practices.

story:
Short Summary

Revolv is a collective of Masters photography students and alumni from the University of Portsmouth. Founded in 2017 by Krasimira Butseva and Lina Ivanova, Revolv aims to provide emerging photographers with a platform for exposure.

Whilst we organise free events, workshops and exhibitions, we create opportunities for talented and undiscovered individuals. We are dedicated to supporting artists expand on their professional knowledge and advance in their creative careers.

Meet the team:

Krasimira Butseva, Laura Gowing, Lina Ivanova and Vera Hadzhiyska.

After graduating from University, we found it difficult to continue producing work and expand our artistic practice. It is challenging to constantly enter paid competitions and open calls, as well as attending paid lectures, workshops and talks that are important for any practitioner’s career. This is why we decided to create an independent, non-profit platform to showcase the work of emerging artists for free. Until now we have used our Instagram account and website to showcase the images of talents that we have discovered or that have submitted work to us. We believe that by hosting free events we will help students, graduates and emerging artists to enrich their practice, develop their skills and expand their knowledge, hence this campaign is very important to us!

Until now we have been funded by the University of Portsmouth, which has helped us to secure a gallery space in London. We are going to have the exhibition from the 6th to the 9th of September at Four Corners Gallery. As part of the show we would like to host two additional events. The first one, happening on the 8th, would be a collaborative workshop between Revolv and other collectives. Together we would work on the creation of a self-published zine, featuring the works of the artists that we have already showcased on our respective platforms. The zine will be available free of charge for our visitors. The second event will take place on the 9th of September and will consist of talks by four guest speakers from the creative industry. They will introduce their practice and give advice on creative topics drawing upon their own experiences of the art world. One of our guests is the award-winning artist Felicity Hammond. We would like to make this happen whilst keeping our events free but ensuring that our guests get compensated for their time and contributions.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £500 to be able to cover the travel expenses for our contributing artists. On the Friday (8th of September) we have planned to host a collaborative zine workshop – the participants will be members from other collectives, who have been invited to get involved. The event will start at 10:30 and finish approximately 15:30 – by the end of which we would have a complete zine and start producing more free copies for visitors.

The first collective we are working with is London Alternative Photography Collective, led by three artists. Melanie King and Almudena Romero will be our guests. The collective specifically focuses on how analogue and alternative photography processes are used in contemporary art. The London Alternative Photography Collective organises talks, symposia, exhibitions, 
workshops and demonstrations. Through these activities, the London Alternative Photography Collective aims to support practitioners who use traditional photographic processes in new ways.

The second collective is Pupil Sphere, created by Daniel Ainsworth whilst undertaking a BA in Photography. The Pupil Sphere is aimed at student photographers post & present and provides a platform to publish work within the photographic community. The Pupil Sphere features regular articles by selected photographers. Unlike other websites we are aimed at students of all genres of photography. 

Image by: Maciej Krzyminski

And the last guests that we will have for this event are Chrono Collective. Their aims are to showcase the best young and unexposed talent within photography- those who are somehow reflecting our times within pictures, and present this work within a magazine format.

 

On Sunday 9th of September, we will set up the second event, which is also why we need funding.

Our first speaker is Russell Squires, who is a multi-faceted artist, primarily using photography within a fine art and conceptual based context. His current practice is concerned with the very construct and formation of photography and its dissemination into popular culture. He is going to speak about the subject of Artist Educators, how teaching influenced his work, and can develop one as an artist.

Our second guest speaker will be Felicity Hammond, whose work focuses on photography and installation. She is interested in political contradictions within the urban landscape and her work explores construction sites and obsolete built environments. Her recent awards include, British Journal of Photography International Photography Award: Winner 2016, Catlin Art prize: Finalist 2015, Magnum and Photo London Inaugural Photographer award: nominated 2015. She will share her advice on how to apply for open calls and grants, giving her most recent commissions as an example.

Our third speaker is Philip Serfaty, a curator and director of the new exhibition space Black Tower Projects, in South London. He holds an MA in Curation from Goldsmiths University and has worked with a number of galleries as well as a wide range of artists. We have invited him to give our audience an insight into the world of curation, how to approach gallery spaces and gain exposure from exhibitions.

And our fourth guest artists is Carole Evans, she is one of the founders of Portrait Salon. As well as she worked for seven years as Gallery Coordinator at Photofusion in Brixton, where she met many influential photographers and honed her skills in organising events and curating. She is Senior Lecturer in Contextual Studies at Ravensbourne, sessional tutor on BA Photography at UCA Farnham, and works independently as a photographer and curator.

Perks

£1 - Thank you!

You will receive a Thank You email and your name will be featured on our website and exhibition poster!

£5 - Set of 4 Postcards

You will receive a random selection of 4 Postcards with our works & your name will be featured on our website and exhibition poster.

£10 - A4 Print 

A4 print from our works (of your choice) & your name will be featured on our website and exhibition poster. Choose one print from our artists.

Lina Ivanova

1) St. Kliment Ohridski

2) St. Kliment Ohridski

Laura Gowing

1) Erased                                                                2) Erased

Krasimira Butseva

1) The death of a country

2) The death of a country

Vera Hadzhiyska

1) Kingdom of Chamla

2) Kingdom of Chamla

 

£20 - Revolv's Mystery Box

The Mystery Box will contain different surprises made and packed by us (items vary from handmade sketchbooks, coffee mugs, prints, posters, soaps and stickers) & your name on our website and poster.

£30 - A3 Print 

A3 print of our works (of your choice), your name on our website and exhibition poster, a postcard & your name on our website and poster.

£40 - A4 print in a frame 

A4 print in a frame, a postcard, your name featured on our website and exhibition poster.

£60 - A3 Print with a Frame & a postcard & your Name on our Website and Poster

A3 print in a frame, a postcard and your name featured on our website and exhibition poster.

 

£120 - Meet the Artists! 

Meet the Artists! Have a coffee and a portfolio review with Revolv Collective + Everything else above: an A4 print with a frame, set of 4 postcards, a mystery box and your name featured on our website and exhibition poster

Goal

Whether we reach our goal or not, the exhibition will still take place. However, without the full amount, we wouldn’t be able to host both events we have planned. Since we have put so much time and effort into this endeavour, we would deem it successful if we deliver more than one creative event for our visitors. We would like to form a temporary creative hub; a space for discussions, networking and ideas, which is why it is so important to us that we reach and exceed our goal.

The Impact

We believe the creative events we have planned would be extremely valuable for current students, new graduates and emerging artists. We have experienced the harshness of the creative industry ourselves, which is why we are so passionate about making a difference for our audience by offering them a wide variety of industry advice and insight. 

So far, we have given portfolio reviews and delivered talks to current university students about our experience of the art world after graduation. On both occasions, we received a lot of questions about issues concerning our audience directly. Being able to draw upon our experience whilst building up a network has been very rewarding.

An important part of our plan is that we are timing our events with the start of the academic year. We hope that students who are about to start a creative degree gain inspiration and ideas about what they could aim to work towards during their time at University. Recent graduates, who have only just had their Degree Shows and might be unsure of their next step, can also come along to gather momentum, discover opportunities and gain confidence to continue producing and promoting their work. 

We are committed to making an impact and we have no restrictions on who can get involved. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of any size would be very much appreciated.

There are also other ways you can get involved! Every share and like will help us spread the word of our campaign.

Thank you!
story_txt: Short SummaryRevolv is a collective of Masters photography students and alumni from the University of Portsmouth. Founded in 2017 by Krasimira Butseva and Lina Ivanova, Revolv aims to provide emerging photographers with a platform for exposure.Whilst we organise free events, workshops and exhibitions, we create opportunities for talented and undiscovered individuals. We are dedicated to supporting artists expand on their professional knowledge and advance in their creative careers.Meet the team:Krasimira Butseva, Laura Gowing, Lina Ivanova and Vera Hadzhiyska.After graduating from University, we found it difficult to continue producing work and expand our artistic practice. It is challenging to constantly enter paid competitions and open calls, as well as attending paid lectures, workshops and talks that are important for any practitioner’s career. This is why we decided to create an independent, non-profit platform to showcase the work of emerging artists for free. Until now we have used our Instagram account and website to showcase the images of talents that we have discovered or that have submitted work to us. We believe that by hosting free events we will help students, graduates and emerging artists to enrich their practice, develop their skills and expand their knowledge, hence this campaign is very important to us!Until now we have been funded by the University of Portsmouth, which has helped us to secure a gallery space in London. We are going to have the exhibition from the 6th to the 9th of September at Four Corners Gallery. As part of the show we would like to host two additional events. The first one, happening on the 8th, would be a collaborative workshop between Revolv and other collectives. Together we would work on the creation of a self-published zine, featuring the works of the artists that we have already showcased on our respective platforms. The zine will be available free of charge for our visitors. The second event will take place on the 9th of September and will consist of talks by four guest speakers from the creative industry. They will introduce their practice and give advice on creative topics drawing upon their own experiences of the art world. One of our guests is the award-winning artist Felicity Hammond. We would like to make this happen whilst keeping our events free but ensuring that our guests get compensated for their time and contributions.What We Need & What You GetWe need £500 to be able to cover the travel expenses for our contributing artists. On the Friday (8th of September) we have planned to host a collaborative zine workshop – the participants will be members from other collectives, who have been invited to get involved. The event will start at 10:30 and finish approximately 15:30 – by the end of which we would have a complete zine and start producing more free copies for visitors.The first collective we are working with is London Alternative Photography Collective, led by three artists. Melanie King and Almudena Romero will be our guests. The collective specifically focuses on how analogue and alternative photography processes are used in contemporary art. The London Alternative Photography Collective organises talks, symposia, exhibitions, workshops and demonstrations. Through these activities, the London Alternative Photography Collective aims to support practitioners who use traditional photographic processes in new ways.The second collective is Pupil Sphere, created by Daniel Ainsworth whilst undertaking a BA in Photography. The Pupil Sphere is aimed at student photographers post & present and provides a platform to publish work within the photographic community. The Pupil Sphere features regular articles by selected photographers. Unlike other websites we are aimed at students of all genres of photography. Image by: Maciej KrzyminskiAnd the last guests that we will have for this event are Chrono Collective. Their aims are to showcase the best young and unexposed talent within photography- those who are somehow reflecting our times within pictures, and present this work within a magazine format. On Sunday 9th of September, we will set up the second event, which is also why we need funding.Our first speaker is Russell Squires, who is a multi-faceted artist, primarily using photography within a fine art and conceptual based context. His current practice is concerned with the very construct and formation of photography and its dissemination into popular culture. He is going to speak about the subject of Artist Educators, how teaching influenced his work, and can develop one as an artist.Our second guest speaker will be Felicity Hammond, whose work focuses on photography and installation. She is interested in political contradictions within the urban landscape and her work explores construction sites and obsolete built environments. Her recent awards include, British Journal of Photography International Photography Award: Winner 2016, Catlin Art prize: Finalist 2015, Magnum and Photo London Inaugural Photographer award: nominated 2015. She will share her advice on how to apply for open calls and grants, giving her most recent commissions as an example.Our third speaker is Philip Serfaty, a curator and director of the new exhibition space Black Tower Projects, in South London. He holds an MA in Curation from Goldsmiths University and has worked with a number of galleries as well as a wide range of artists. We have invited him to give our audience an insight into the world of curation, how to approach gallery spaces and gain exposure from exhibitions.And our fourth guest artists is Carole Evans, she is one of the founders of Portrait Salon. As well as she worked for seven years as Gallery Coordinator at Photofusion in Brixton, where she met many influential photographers and honed her skills in organising events and curating. story:
About Gender Unbound Art Fest

Gender Unbound Art Fest is a multi-discipline art festival that exclusively features transgender and intersex creators. We use art, music, and performance to celebrate an often marginalized community, empower gender diverse creators, and educate the general public in a context outside of celebrity coming out stories and bathroom legislation. We also connect attendees to much-needed services and organizations.

The second annual Gender Unbound Art Fest will take place on Saturday, Sept. 2, 2017, at Vuka North Lamar (5540 N Lamar Blvd, Austin, TX 78756). The event is run by Gender Portraits, a sponsored nonprofit project of Austin Creative Alliance that documents and advocates for gender diverse people through art.

We need your help to make Gender Unbound 2017 a success!

What We Need

Gender Unbound is funded in part through a grant by the City of Austin Cultural Arts Division of Economic Development. After our fiscal sponsor’s fees are taken out, our $3,750 city grant pays for most of Vuka’s venue rental fee. Many elements of the event will be sourced from donated goods—like alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, snacks, merchandise (shirts and stickers), and signage.

But we still need your help to pay for other expenses. Our $3,000 funding goal (minus 5%-10% in Indiegogo fees) will pay for:

  • The remainder of Vuka’s venue rental fee
  • Event insurance (required by both city and venue contracts)
  • Screen printing for shirts
  • Supplies for reward levels: badges, packaging for art bundles, etc.
  • Event supplies: posters, pamphlets/flyers, wristbands, cups, etc.
  • Equipment rentals: audio equipment, assistive listening devices, etc.
  • Performer stipends: payment for musicians, performers, event emcee, etc.
  • Administrative stipends: payment for the event organizer, stage manager, volunteer coordinator, etc.
  • Contractor stipends: payment for the photographer, videographer, sound tech, etc.

If we pass our $3,000 goal, we will build toward things like:

  • Artist stipends: payment for exhibiting visual artists
  • Travel stipends: payment to bring in out-of-state artists
  • Increasing all stipends: raising payment amounts to market rate for all talent and organizers
  • Gender Unbound Art Fest 2018: start-up funds for next year’s event

We have taken great care to minimize the amount of Indiegogo money that is spent on perk rewards. We've created substantial Indiegogo perks using high-value items that will already be created as a part of the festival like tickets, shirts, and art. This ensures that the maximum amount of raised funds will be spent on the festival. In addition, no Indiegogo funds will be used for shipping or handling of perks.

Perks

All perks will be delivered digitally or picked up in-person at the event. As mentioned in the section above, this is to ensure that more funds are spent on the festival rather than on perk fulfillment. If you are wanting to support Gender Unbound but can't make it to Austin for the festival, we recommend selecting perks for sponsored tickets and/or projected ads.

Get an advance ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 for $5 (will be $7 at the door) or sponsor a ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 for a community member!

Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Make it a date night or bring a friend! For $10 you get two tickets to Gender Unbound 2017 (will be $7 each at the door) and you'll get two Gender Unbound stickers to remember your awesome night together.

You don't have to choose between pampering yourself and giving back to the community. For $10 you get your own advance ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 (will be $7 at the door) and sponsor a ticket for a community member and you'll get two stickers to double your fun!

Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Wear your support for trans and intersex artists on your sleeve! For $20 you get a Gender Unbound shirt that is screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).

In addition, you'll receive a ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 and a Gender Unbound shirt and two Gender Unbound stickers.

Impress your +1 with Gender Unbound shirts for two! Remember the good times you shared at Gender Unbound and look great while doing it. For $35 you get two tickets to Gender Unbound and two Gender Unbound shirts and two Gender Unbound stickers!

Gender Unbound shirts are screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).

Sponsor a bounty of tickets! For $50 you will be responsible for giving 10 tickets to 10 community members. In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!

Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Boost your message! For $50 you will get a personal shout out ad* during Gender Unbound 2017! Your shout out ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the festival. Your shout out will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening! (For business ads, see "commercial ad" perk below.)

* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.

Bring the festival home with you! For $65 you get an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value). In addition to your new art collection, you'll get a ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles)!

Become an art patron extraordinaire! For $80 you get a special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event. These badges and the early entry that they grant are rare. Less than 30 will be given out! 

In addition, you'll get your name listed on our website as a patron and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!

Boost your business! For $100 you get a commercial ad* during Gender Unbound 2017 for your small business, non-profit, solo entrepreneurship, or large organization! Your commercial ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the festival. Your commercial ad will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening!

* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.

Sponsor a cornucopia of tickets! For $100 you can bring joy to the community by giving 20 tickets to 20 community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!

Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Sponsor an avalanche of tickets! For $250 you can bring joy to the community by giving 50 tickets to 50 community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!

Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Harness the power of time to bring more Gender Unbound 2017 to everyone! For $300 you will allow us to extend the event by one hour, giving every attendee more art, more interaction with artists, more performances, and more fun! And you'll get an on-stage shout out from the event emcee acknowledging your role in expanding Gender Unbound 2017!

In addition, you will get one special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event and your name in a special place on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and your name in a special place on our website and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!

Become an ultra sponsor and rub elbows with the founder of Gender Unbound and artist of Gender Portraits, Drew Riley! For $500 you will get an exclusive meet up to chat about anything you'd like—her artistic work, how Gender Unbound came to be, the weather—it's up to you!

In addition, we want to shout your name from the rooftops! You'll get an on-stage shout out from the event emcee acknowledging your role in expanding Gender Unbound 2017 and a shout out ad or commercial ad of your choice* during the festival. Your ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the event. It will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening!

Plus you will get a special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event and  your name in a special place on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and your name in a special place on our website and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!

* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.

The Impact

Gender Unbound is an event dedicated entirely to uplifting transgender and intersex creators. Last year, we featured and paid 13 artists and 3 musicians. We were also able to pay for the travel of one artist, Catherine Graffam, from New Hampshire to attend the festival as both an artist and a speaker. According to survey feedback, our artists were able to make over $2500 in art sales at the event, with many reporting that the festival was their most successful show of the year. Financially empowering trans and intersex artists enriches the entire community by amplifying their voices with creative and visible expression.

In that vein, Gender Unbound is an opportunity for the general public to see the strength, complexity, and beauty of transgender and intersex voices in contrast to the misinformation and hostility that transgender and intersex people increasingly face. Around 400 people attended Gender Unbound Art Fest 2016, and of those who responded to our follow-up survey, 89% said that they knew more about gender diverse people, communities, and/or issues after attending the festival. We hope that through the vibrant creators showcased in Gender Unbound 2017 will spark an interest in transgender and intersex issues for even more attendees.

We also use the festival as an opportunity to connect our artists and attendees to some vital services. At our inaugural event, we had community social and support organizations tabling with info, Aids Services of Austin providing free HIV testing, and nonpartisan voter registration. Almost a third of our survey respondents said that they connected with a service or resource at the event.

Risks & Challenges

Risks: Because grant funding is already secured for the majority of the venue rental cost, and the event is run in large part by volunteers, there is no risk of Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017 being cancelled for lack of funding. The quality and the nature of the festival may change depending on the amount of Indiegogo funding, but Gender Unbound will still happen in some form.

Challenges: We anticipate that our biggest challenge will be raising enough money to be able to pay artists, performers, and organizers fairly. While we had help from many dedicated volunteers in 2016, Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017 will shine brightest if we raise enough money to ensure that artists, performers, and organizers can participate without asking them to shoulder any financial stress.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us spread the word about Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017. Please share our campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share tools!

If you plan to attend Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017, we welcome you as a volunteer! We are looking for talented individuals to help us with every aspect of the festival, from running stage tech to tending the bar (trans and intersex volunteers are preferred).  Please fill out the volunteer application here. See you at the event!
