Gender Unbound shirts are screen printed by a local artist. These upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly and come in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors (picked up at the festival).

Sponsor a bounty of tickets! For $50 you will be responsible for giving 10 tickets to 10 community members. In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!
Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Boost your message! For $50 you will get a personal shout out ad* during Gender Unbound 2017! Your shout out ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the festival. Your shout out will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening! (For business ads, see "commercial ad" perk below.)
* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.

Bring the festival home with you! For $65 you get an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value). In addition to your new art collection, you'll get a ticket to Gender Unbound 2017 and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles)!

Become an art patron extraordinaire! For $80 you get a special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event. These badges and the early entry that they grant are rare. Less than 30 will be given out! 
In addition, you'll get your name listed on our website as a patron and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!

Boost your business! For $100 you get a commercial ad* during Gender Unbound 2017 for your small business, non-profit, solo entrepreneurship, or large organization! Your commercial ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the festival. Your commercial ad will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening!
* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.

Sponsor a cornucopia of tickets! For $100 you can bring joy to the community by giving 20 tickets to 20 community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!
Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Sponsor an avalanche of tickets! For $250 you can bring joy to the community by giving 50 tickets to 50 community members! In addition, your name will be listed on our website as a community sponsor and your name on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall!
Sponsored tickets are dispersed to trans, intersex, and LGBTQ+ organizations in Texas to be distributed where they are needed most in the community. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to be financially distressed. Sponsored tickets help keep the festival accessible to the people we represent.

Harness the power of time to bring more Gender Unbound 2017 to everyone! For $300 you will allow us to extend the event by one hour, giving every attendee more art, more interaction with artists, more performances, and more fun! And you'll get an on-stage shout out from the event emcee acknowledging your role in expanding Gender Unbound 2017!
In addition, you will get one special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event and your name in a special place on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and your name in a special place on our website and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!

Become an ultra sponsor and rub elbows with the founder of Gender Unbound and artist of Gender Portraits, Drew Riley! For $500 you will get an exclusive meet up to chat about anything you'd like—her artistic work, how Gender Unbound came to be, the weather—it's up to you!
In addition, we want to shout your name from the rooftops! You'll get an on-stage shout out from the event emcee acknowledging your role in expanding Gender Unbound 2017 and a shout out ad or commercial ad of your choice* during the festival. Your ad will appear in a slide show of photos and art from Gender Unbound that will be projected during the event. It will be seen and appreciated by attendees throughout the evening!
Plus you will get a special patron badge to Gender Unbound 2017 that gives you early access to the event and  your name in a special place on the Gender Unbound 2017 patron wall and your name in a special place on our website and two Gender Unbound Stickers and a Gender Unbound Shirt (upcycled and screenprinted by a local artist with various colors/sizes/styles) and an impressive bundle of art from the exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound 2017 (over a $100 value)!
* Event organizer reserves the right to refuse offensive or harmful ads.


The Impact
Gender Unbound is an event dedicated entirely to uplifting transgender and intersex creators. Last year, we featured and paid 13 artists and 3 musicians. We were also able to pay for the travel of one artist, Catherine Graffam, from New Hampshire to attend the festival as both an artist and a speaker. According to survey feedback, our artists were able to make over $2500 in art sales at the event, with many reporting that the festival was their most successful show of the year. Financially empowering trans and intersex artists enriches the entire community by amplifying their voices with creative and visible expression.
In that vein, Gender Unbound is an opportunity for the general public to see the strength, complexity, and beauty of transgender and intersex voices in contrast to the misinformation and hostility that transgender and intersex people increasingly face. Around 400 people attended Gender Unbound Art Fest 2016, and of those who responded to our follow-up survey, 89% said that they knew more about gender diverse people, communities, and/or issues after attending the festival. We hope that through the vibrant creators showcased in Gender Unbound 2017 will spark an interest in transgender and intersex issues for even more attendees.We also use the festival as an opportunity to connect our artists and attendees to some vital services. At our inaugural event, we had community social and support organizations tabling with info, Aids Services of Austin providing free HIV testing, and nonpartisan voter registration. Almost a third of our survey respondents said that they connected with a service or resource at the event.

Risks & Challenges
Risks: Because grant funding is already secured for the majority of the venue rental cost, and the event is run in large part by volunteers, there is no risk of Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017 being cancelled for lack of funding. The quality and the nature of the festival may change depending on the amount of Indiegogo funding, but Gender Unbound will still happen in some form.
Challenges: We anticipate that our biggest challenge will be raising enough money to be able to pay artists, performers, and organizers fairly. While we had help from many dedicated volunteers in 2016, Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017 will shine brightest if we raise enough money to ensure that artists, performers, and organizers can participate without asking them to shoulder any financial stress.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us spread the word about Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017. Please share our campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share tools!
If you plan to attend Gender Unbound Art Fest 2017, we welcome you as a volunteer! We are looking for talented individuals to help us with every aspect of the festival, from running stage tech to tending the bar (trans and intersex volunteers are preferred).  Please fill out the volunteer application here. See you at the event!

story:
We are a group of artists who are mutually inspired by the Mississippi River and the natural world. We are gathering together, partnering with the Mississippi Watershed Management Organization, to share that passion with the Twin-Cities community during Art-a-Whirl, one of the largest art crawls in the nation. We will use a variety of mediums (social practice art, ceramics, boat building, photography, music, poetry) to address the ever-important conversation about water and environmental stewardship as the river flows a mere 50 yards from the performance space. We hope to inspire visitors to view the watershed with the same wonder, respect and care that has been inspired in us.

MWMO has generously funded half of our budget. We are seeking to raise $1,600 in order to cover the remaining costs, including support for the artists’ time, materials and transport costs. Donations will allow us to bring work by artist Anna Metcalfe, composers Katherine Bergman, Joshua Clausen and Daniel Nass, the ensembles Zeitgeist, the Stone Arch Collective, the River Singers, and poet and songwriter Ben Weaver. 

In recognition of your gifts, donation perks include prints of Anna’s work, downloads of all the music, ceramic story cups from Anna’s installation, and personalized collaborative pieces, made one-of-a-kind from Anna and Josh.

story:
I'm Gretchen Baer, artist, activist, and creator of the Hillary Clinton "Hillcar" art car. I live in Bisbee Arizona, an arts community 6 miles from the U.S./Mexico Border wall, on which my group,The Border Bedazzlers are painting the world's longest kids mural. I am a Hillary Clinton Super Volunteer and I support my candidate with my Hillary-themed art car. The Hillcar is a 1989 Toyota Corolla, painted with images of Hillary Clinton, decorated with jewels, toys, game pieces, and lots of glitter. The Hillcar has campaigned for Hillary in 15 states since 2008.

We recently campaigned with the Hillcar on the East Coast in 6 states during their Democratic primaries. We got out the vote in a burst of color, smiles and fun in New York, Conneticut, Rhode Island, Delaware, Maryland and Pennsylvania. We also talked about the need for more art in schools, more free art programs for kids, as well as advocating for good border relations through art. 

Now we would like to drive the colorful Hillcar to California to campaign in the biggest primary of them all. 475 delegates are at stake. A win in California is essential in preventing a contested Democratic Convention. The delegate math says Hillary will win the nomination, but she needs to win big so that Bernie supporters and Hillary supporters can join forces and begin to hard work that's ahead.

I would also like to continue to advocate on a national level for the importance of art in schools and the power of free art programs for kids. Hillary has dedicated her life to championing quality education, which includes the arts. Your donations will also ensure the continuation of my free, grassroots art programs such as Border Bedazzlers, Art Envoys, and Paint Your Town! 

The power of Hillcar is that it can get Hillary's message to a lot to people at a very low price. We drive the Hillcar through as many neighborhoods as we possibly can, stopping and talking to people all along the way. We offer photo opportunities and inspire people to feel included and excited. The Hillcar is also a press magnet on the campaign trail. Stories about the Hillcar have appeared in TIME, Huffington Post, Sky News, NPR, National Geographic, TIME LIVE, Politico, Hillary's Fickr and Snapchat, Washington Post, New York Times, plus lots of local news. 

 We think Hillary's California campaign needs the sparkly magic of the Hillcar. But money is tight and we need your help. The Hillcar needs about $2,000 in repairs and 10 days of travel for two will cost another $2000, making it a total of $4000. 

Help us make this trip possible. Make a donation and watch your dollars directly at work in a really fun way on the campaign trail on Facebook Twitter gretchenbaer.com and more!

The Hillcar is a grassroots project and not affiliated with Hillary's campaign in any way. 100% of your donations goes to car repair, gas, lodging, food and glitter. This is just you and me making cool things happen! 

I've got some great gifts for donations $100 and up, but any small contributions, from a cup of coffee to a tank of gas, are more important than you might think. It lets us know you appreciate our service, and that we are all in this together. When people see the Hillcar come down their street they associate Hillary with bright colors, smiles, good vibes and a positive message. Together we can make history happen.

Sparkle on!

Gretchen Baer and the Hillcar

story:
Abstract: Typically, yearbooks are churned out by big companies that carelessly cram the photos into a basic template. This is impersonal and strips the school/students of character. Instead of following that thoroughly-beaten path, this project will provide an opportunity to exemplify the truly unique and progressive qualities of Toussaint L'Ouverture High School for Arts & Social Justice.


Project Purpose: To produce a book of portraits that embodies the character and vision of TLHS, under the moniker, ‘yearbook’. Yearbook in this case is used as shorthand and is simply the starting point, to be expanded upon, to be creatively manipulated. This first yearbook will serve as a platform for future TLHS editions.


Your Funding: Campaign funds will be used to cover creative and production fees to photograph and provide yearbooks for 165 students.


—Yearbook Club


About the School:

"TLHS’s mission is to provide motivated students of diverse ability levels a unique secondary school experience with particular emphasis on ESOL education for newcomer students from the Caribbean and other countries as well as for native English speakers of all proficiency levels. Our vision is to help youth acquire the skills they need to be successful in college and/or work and to have a voice in co-creating a world they can believe in. TLHS provides an innovative, standards-based educational choice focusing on high student achievement for all students regardless of onset linguistic ability and prepares them for successful participation in the lives of their communities."  —Read More

story:
TOKEN OF OUR THANKS FOR 10 YEARS!

Now we can be active in workshops, show performances, movie appearances and Kinbaku instructions, etc. at all over the world as well as Japan, thanks to being blessed with a lot of wonderful encounter and relationship, and our loving fans.
So we planned production of Kinbaku photobook by simultaneous crowdfunds of Japan and U.S. for doing the 10th anniversary's last commemorative campaign as an international project!

 

When you help us in Japanese from Japan, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
日本から日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。
MotionGallery web site＊縄師 神凪＆神楽１０周年記念！日米同時のクラウド緊縛写真集制作プロジェクト

 

ABOUT PHOTOBOOK

The photobook will become Nawashi Kanna's FIRST kinbaku photobook, and are produced focusing on tying of Kanna and fascinating of Kagura in Kanna's ropes.
All pictures are completely newly taken for this photobook by Goku who is a photographer/rigger based in Toyama, Japan.

The shooting has been done in Hamamatsu and Kyoto with him in November and December, 2015.
This photograph collection contains Kagura costumed Oiran that is one of our most important performance work.

 

GOALS FOR THE PROJECT

For the 10th anniversary congratulatory commemoration, we'd like to raise the quality and size and number/volume of paper, binding and pictures, and produce a luxurious and valuable photobook by the end of this anniversary year.
We hope we could have a great eleventh year with you and this photobook!

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...
the costs for layout, editing, distribution and printing, perks covered, shipping to you.

We'll make every effort to build this photobook and find good printing.

 

PERKS IN RETURN FOR MONETARY GIFT

Backers who donate $150 or more will receive a copy of our 10TH ANNIVERSARY'S PHOTOBOOK.
Backers who donate $460 or more will also receive a copy of 10 YEAR'S HISTORY COMPILATION BOOKLET.
We have fantastic perks on offer to bring our appreciation into your home!

 

  • The limited three Photo Postcards set

​These prints are yet-to-be-released pictures and only available with this campaign.

 

  • The limited edition print

It's sized at 297×420, with our three autographs on back, with a frame☆
These prints are yet-to-be-released pictures and only available with this campaign!

Please choose which one you want to get from 5 prints!
Here is selection↓↓

 

  • The 10th Anniversary's Kinbaku photobook

The photobook is all yours if you donate $150 or more. 
This time it will be in full color, with all new images, in hard-cover, sized at 210x297mm, with our autographs, handwriting edition number, featuring about 100 photographs!
(The edition number will be the order of reception, so you cannot choose it.)
Only available with this campaign☆ So please don't miss this opportunity, and get yours!!

 

  • Name credit

Those who donate $150 or more will have their name printed in the end of the Limited Edition as a token of our appreciation! The size of the letter is different depending on a support price.

 

  • The limited original items

Those who donate $460 or more will receive special original items made for this campaign! It'll be some special goodies  as original designed Tenugui and Button-Badges☆ A kind, the number of items may be different according to the support price.

Watch this page or SNS page for updates!

 

  • The 10 year's history compilation booklet 

Those who donate $460 or more will receive the compilation booklet! 

The 10 year's history compilation booklet gathered up our activities for 10 years to 1 copy, contains kinbaku pictures from all live performance including the unreleased picture material and private photography☆

 

  • KANNAWA and GOKURO

KANNA ORIGINAL JUTE ROPE(NAWA) [KANNAWA] for kinbaku you can use as soon as you get, and GOKU ORIGINAL BEESWAX(MITSURO) CREAM [GOKURO] for rope treatment which blended only the greatest materials!

 

  • Private lesson or kinbaku session

We'll offer a private lesson or kinbaku experience/session by Nawashi Kanna for 2 hours/ 3 hours to one couple who donate $920 to Couple perk package or Rope couple perk package.

  • The voucher will be valid for use on any scheduled world tour as far as Nawashi Kanna is active!
  • Lessons/Sessions are subject to availability
  • You will need to reserve in advance.
  • Without traveling expenses, renting space expenses

 

  • Show performance and workshop

We'll come to your place or anywhere and offer a live show performance and workshop just for you or your group who donate $9200 to Premium perk package!

  • The voucher will be valid for use as far as Nawashi Kanna is active!
  • Performance and Workshop are subject to availability
  • Reservation is required. We will need to plan the schedule, length and contents of the workshop together. 
  • Traveling expenses included
  • Without renting space expenses

 

Risks & Challenges

Sometimes we end up rushing to meet deadlines...
We may have to change the schedule to make the best work which can be done now. 
So there is the risk of some delay.
Thank you for your understanding.

But you GET your print books whether we reach the print-run goal or not!

When achieving a goal, we'd be very much obliged if you'd apply funds to increase of the number of pages (increase of pictures), further improvement of the quality of paper, additional photography and addition of limited original items.
For that, Your contribution would also help us!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are moved to support our project for $1, $10k, or by sharing this on social media like Facebook/Instagram/Twitter/Tumblr/FetLife etc etc, and letting your friends know about our campaign, every bit truly makes a difference like a rope skill!

Please lend your force to this movement. Share and spread the campaign☆
Make a lot of noise and loves♡

We're really excited to bring this dream to life, having worked on its production for over one years. Thank you all so much for everything you can do to bring this to life!!


If you have any questions or thoughts to share, please contact us!

 

Staff 

Nawashi/Hairstylist/Dressing: Kanna神凪

Born in Asakusa, Tokyo.
Rope performer and instructor "Nawashi/Kinbakushi" active in Japan and abroad.
He studied under the late Akechi Denki, and inherit his rope patterns and techniques from the master Akechi, and add arrangement of oneself, and initiate a large number of Kinbaku lovers of the world into Kinbaku art of the Akechi school / Kanna school.

Getting high evaluation for his Incomparable kinbaku skill by well thought rope art / complicated and beautiful rope patterns / elegant and flowing rope handling, and his hard torture rope "semenawa" which adopted art of the traditional Japanese martial arts using rope "Hojojutsu".
Holds a workshop a lot in foreign countries such as The United States/Canada/Vienna/Germany/France/Italy/Spain/Czech/Denmark/Norway/Russia/Australia/China. Often also appears on an event and a performance.
Activities of the live show performance and workshop, besides, develops activity, like organizing Kannawakai, and planning and holding irregularly the event/salon/rope jam/photo session, offering kinbaku experience/individual guidance/private group class,  kinbaku instruction/appearance/supervision for the stage and the movie, kinbaku photography by himself, collaborating with overseas photographer and artist actively.
Gains great result as a performer and a instructor as well as is making an effort toward instruction upbringing of much well-known Kinbakushi and Domina/Mistress, and contributes to the spread of kinbaku art and technical improvement of kinbaku in the world greatly.

More info about 神凪Kanna
http://kanna-kagura.blogspot.com/2014/11/about-...

Twitter★@nawashi_kanna
Facebook★@nawashikanna/@kannanawashi
Instagram★@nawashi_kanna
Blog★http://nawashikanna78.blog136.fc2.com/
Blog★http://kannakinbakuphoto.blog.fc2.com/

 

Model: Kagura神楽

Born in Hamamatsu, Shizuoka.
Appear on the stage as a partner and a belonging model to Nawashi Kanna, and hold a salon and an event with Kanna together, and host to students of private lessons to a house recently from foreign countries and introduce Japanese life and culture, and organizing world tours and accompanying, and support activity of Kanna officially and privately as an interpreter and a manager.

More info about 神楽Kagura
http://kanna-kagura.blogspot.com/2014/11/about-...

Twitter★@momoemu
Facebook★@kaguram
Instagram★@momoemu
Blog★http://kanna-kagura.blogspot.jp/
FetLife★Kanna-Kagura

 

Photographer: Goku悟空

Kinbakushi and photographer who is active in Hokuriku area Toyama.
Manages a kinbaku bar in his studio StudioG, and holds regularly a kinbaku dojo, rope lecture, and kinbaku photography meeting "Photo-Nawa club" as a representative of rope group "Enbu-Shinbaku kai".
Has begun to get enthusiastic fans by appearance on a kinbaku performance show in several events throughout the country, and kinbaku experience filled with passion and enthusiasm.
Devote himself to a search and the study for shibari and photography, and attract audiences in his seductive kinbaku show and kinbaku photograph.
Runs after Kanna as much as possible among Japan and is taking photographs of live show performance of Kanna.

Twitter★@toyotoyo117
Blog★http://59gojo.blog.fc2.com/
Blog★http://studiogtoyo.blog.fc2.com/

 

Assistant: Onitsuka, Reika, Gene

 

Designer/Advisor: Suo Maya

Representative of "LocoRock Design".
Designs the fryer of various events, and  original goods and the photobook of Kannawakai.

Twitter★@maya7181suou
Facebook★@mayasuou
Instagram★@mayasuou
Blog★http://suoumaya.blog.fc2.com/

 

 

Follow us and get updates on SNS!

Thank you for all of your support♡♡♡

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...the costs for layout, editing, distribution and printing, perks covered, shipping to you.
We'll make every effort to build this photobook and find good printing.

 
PERKS IN RETURN FOR MONETARY GIFT
Backers who donate $150 or more will receive a copy of our 10TH ANNIVERSARY'S PHOTOBOOK.Backers who donate $460 or more will also receive a copy of 10 YEAR'S HISTORY COMPILATION BOOKLET.We have fantastic perks on offer to bring our appreciation into your home!
 
The limited three Photo Postcards set
​These prints are yet-to-be-released pictures and only available with this campaign.
 
The limited edition print
It's sized at 297×420, with our three autographs on back, with a frame☆These prints are yet-to-be-released pictures and only available with this campaign!
Please choose which one you want to get from 5 prints!Here is selection↓↓

 
The 10th Anniversary's Kinbaku photobook
The photobook is all yours if you donate $150 or more. This time it will be in full color, with all new images, in hard-cover, sized at 210x297mm, with our autographs, handwriting edition number, featuring about 100 photographs!(The edition number will be the order of reception, so you cannot choose it.)Only available with this campaign☆ So please don't miss this opportunity, and get yours!!
 
Name credit
Those who donate $150 or more will have their name printed in the end of the Limited Edition as a token of our appreciation! The size of the letter is different depending on a support price.
 
The limited original items
Those who donate $460 or more will receive special original items made for this campaign! It'll be some special goodies  as original designed Tenugui and Button-Badges☆ A kind, the number of items may be different according to the support price.
Watch this page or SNS page for updates!
 
The 10 year's history compilation booklet 
Those who donate $460 or more will receive the compilation booklet! 
The 10 year's history compilation booklet gathered up our activities for 10 years to 1 copy, contains kinbaku pictures from all live performance including the unreleased picture material and private photography☆
 
KANNAWA and GOKURO


KANNA ORIGINAL JUTE ROPE(NAWA) [KANNAWA] for kinbaku you can use as soon as you get, and GOKU ORIGINAL BEESWAX(MITSURO) CREAM [GOKURO] for rope treatment which blended only the greatest materials!
 
Private lesson or kinbaku session

We'll offer a private lesson or kinbaku experience/session by Nawashi Kanna for 2 hours/ 3 hours to one couple who donate $920 to Couple perk package or Rope couple perk package.

The voucher will be valid for use on any scheduled world tour as far as Nawashi Kanna is active!
Lessons/Sessions are subject to availability
You will need to reserve in advance.
Without traveling expenses, renting space expenses

 
Show performance and workshop

We'll come to your place or anywhere and offer a live show performance and workshop just for you or your group who donate $9200 to Premium perk package!

The voucher will be valid for use as far as Nawashi Kanna is active!
Performance and Workshop are subject to availability
Reservation is required. We will need to plan the schedule, length and contents of the workshop together. 
Traveling expenses included
Without renting space expenses

 

Risks & Challenges
Sometimes we end up rushing to meet deadlines...We may have to change the schedule to make the best work which can be done now. So there is the risk of some delay.Thank you for your understanding.
But you GET your print books whether we reach the print-run goal or not!
When achieving a goal, we'd be very much obliged if you'd apply funds to increase of the number of pages (increase of pictures), further improvement of the quality of paper, additional photography and addition of limited original items.For that, Your contribution would also help us!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are moved to support our project for $1, $10k, or by sharing this on social media like Facebook/Instagram/Twitter/Tumblr/FetLife etc etc, and letting your friends know about our campaign, every bit truly makes a difference like a rope skill!
Please lend your force to this movement. Share and spread the campaign☆Make a lot of noise and loves♡
We're really excited to bring this dream to life, having worked on its production for over one years. Thank you all so much for everything you can do to bring this to life!!
If you have any questions or thoughts to share, please contact us!
 
Staff 
Nawashi/Hairstylist/Dressing: Kanna神凪

Born in Asakusa, Tokyo.Rope performer and instructor "Nawashi/Kinbakushi" active in Japan and abroad.He studied under the late Akechi Denki, and inherit his rope patterns and techniques from the master Akechi, and add arrangement of oneself, and initiate a large number of Kinbaku lovers of the world into Kinbaku art of the Akechi school / Kanna school.
Getting high evaluation for his Incomparable kinbaku skill by well thought rope art / complicated and beautiful rope patterns / elegant and flowing rope handling, and his hard torture rope "semenawa" which adopted art of the traditional Japanese martial arts using rope "Hojojutsu".Holds a workshop a lot in foreign countries such as The United States/Canada/Vienna/Germany/France/Italy/Spain/Czech/Denmark/Norway/Russia/Australia/China. Often also appears on an event and a performance.Activities of the live show performance and workshop, besides, develops activity, like organizing Kannawakai, and planning and holding irregularly the event/salon/rope jam/photo session, offering kinbaku experience/individual guidance/private group class,  kinbaku instruction/appearance/supervision for the stage and the movie, kinbaku photography by himself, collaborating with overseas photographer and artist actively.Gains great result as a performer and a instructor as well as is making an effort toward instruction upbringing of much well-known Kinbakushi and Domina/Mistress, and contributes to the spread of kinbaku art and technical improvement of kinbaku in the world greatly.
More info about 神凪Kannahttp://kanna-kagura.blogspot.com/2014/11/about-...
Twitter★@nawashi_kannaFacebook★@nawashikanna/@kannanawashiInstagram★@nawashi_kannaBlog★http://nawashikanna78.blog136.fc2.com/Blog★http://kannakinbakuphoto.blog.fc2.com/
 
Model: Kagura神楽

Born in Hamamatsu, Shizuoka.Appear on the stage as a partner and a belonging model to Nawashi Kanna, and hold a salon and an event with Kanna together, and host to students of private lessons to a house recently from foreign countries and introduce Japanese life and culture, and organizing world tours and accompanying, and support activity of Kanna officially and privately as an interpreter and a manager.
More info about 神楽Kagurahttp://kanna-kagura.blogspot.com/2014/11/about-...
Twitter★@momoemuFacebook★@kaguramInstagram★@momoemuBlog★http://kanna-kagura.blogspot.jp/FetLife★Kanna-Kagura
 
Photographer: Goku悟空

Kinbakushi and photographer who is active in Hokuriku area Toyama.Manages a kinbaku bar in his studio StudioG, and holds regularly a kinbaku dojo, rope lecture, and kinbaku photography meeting "Photo-Nawa club" as a representative of rope group "Enbu-Shinbaku kai".Has begun to get enthusiastic fans by appearance on a kinbaku performance show in several events throughout the country, and kinbaku experience filled with passion and enthusiasm.Devote himself to a search and the study for shibari and photography, and attract audiences in his seductive kinbaku show and kinbaku photograph.Runs after Kanna as much as possible among Japan and is taking photographs of live show performance of Kanna.
Twitter★@toyotoyo117Blog★http://59gojo.blog.fc2.com/Blog★http://studiogtoyo.blog.fc2.com/
 
Assistant: Onitsuka, Reika, Gene
 
Designer/Advisor: Suo Maya

Representative of "LocoRock Design".Designs the fryer of various events, and  original goods and the photobook of Kannawakai.
Twitter★@maya7181suouFacebook★@mayasuouInstagram★@mayasuouBlog★http://suoumaya.blog.fc2.com/
 
 
Follow us and get updates on SNS!
Thank you for all of your support♡♡♡

story:
L'année 2019-2020 sera particulièrement intense (et palpitante évidemment) pour l'équipe du Théâtre de Dehors, alors que nous produisons Copeaux de Mishka Lavigne et que nous poursuivons nos laboratoires d'exploration et de création de Parmi les Monstres de Lisa L'Heureux. 

Comme vous le savez, le Théâtre de Dehors souhaite encourager les artistes de la région et  appuyer des démarches singulières, originales et audacieuses. Nous nous intéressons autant à la production qu'au processus et c'est pourquoi il est important pour nous d'appuyer des projets dès leurs premiers balbutiements.

Bref, l'argent recueilli par cette campagne nous servira justement à appuyer nos projets et à fournir à nos artistes, à nos créateurs, des conditions de production justes et équitables.

En plus de cette campagne en ligne, nous organisons aussi une activité de financement. Vous trouverez toutes les informations ici : https://www.facebook.com/events/646265029184964/

Nous vous remercions de votre générosité! Merci de nous aider à développer et à produire des spectacles de qualité et à mettre sur scène la vision d'artistes de la région.

Vous trouverez toutes les informations ici : https://www.facebook.com/events/646265029184964/Nous vous remercions de votre générosité! Merci de nous aider à développer et à produire des spectacles de qualité et à mettre sur scène la vision d'artistes de la région.

story:
Short Summary

From the same team that brought you the Image TMNT conclusion (Vol. 3 #24 & 25) as well as "TMNT: Odyssey" comes a brand new graphic novel. This one takes place after a couple of years after Mirage TMNT Vol. 4, with Donatello leading an excursion to the center of the universe both to save it (an unknown energy is breaking down all life on a cellular level) as well as get answers for himself, his brothers and the others in his group along the way. Answers will be had, secrets revealed and consequences will be suffered.

  • My name is Andrew Modeen, a writer and filmmaker from the Seattle area. I’m a lifelong fan of the TMNT, and am also the guy responsible for the Image TMNT comic book conclusion that you can read about here: http://www.thegreenlanterncorps.com/tmnt/vol3.html
    Also "TMNT: Odyssey," of which you can read a digital version here: http://www.thegreenlanterncorps.com/tmnt/odysse...
  • "Origin" is a 95+ page graphic novel that will feature Donatello leading an expedition to the center of the universe that will question everything he, his brothers, and those that he brings along for the journey have held as absolutes. A science fiction tale featuring adventure, action, as well as consequences. 

  • The book is illustrated by Jim Lawson, veteran TMNT artist who has been drawing the TMNT since nearly the very beginning. Classics like “Sons of the Silent Age,” “Return to New York,” “City at War,” Tales of the TMNT Vol. 1, the entirety of TMNT Vol. 2 (Mirage), TMNT Vol. 4, and a great deal of Tales of the TMNT Vol. 2… this is the guy. Check out what he's been up to here: http://jimlawsonart.com

  • Dan Berger, another TMNT veteran, contributes a 5 pages of artwork for a Splinter-based tale within the main storyline and narrative.

  • Andres Ponce, longtime TMNT artist ("Tales of the TMNT," Vol. 2 will contribute the cover artwork).

  • The "Professor Obligado" storyline from "Tales of the TMNT," Vol. 2 sees conclusion and ties directly into the main "Origin" narrative. This will be in black and white with duotones, to suit the previous installments of this. Drawn by Jim Lawson, of course.

  • A disconnected 20 page bonus backup will be included that features the Turtles squaring up against a popular intergalactic alien hunter species you may or may not be familiar with in the forests of Northampton. Drawn by Ernest Nathan Acosta III and in full color by Courtland Brugger.

  • A "The Shogun" backup will be included, featuring a story from Mark Pellegrini and artwork by Dennis Kennedy.

  • An additional backup with Shadow will be included as well, featuring art by Arseniy Dubakov.

  • We have a variety of rewards in store for people able and willing to contribute to the project, as you will see below.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As with "Odyssey," Jim Lawson has very graciously attached himself to the project as our artist, however he does need compensation. 7 pages of “Odyssey” have already been commissioned and completed in order to show you what is in store, but to complete the project additional funding is needed. As we're going color in this project (the Obligado introduction notwithstanding) we will also need to cover the cost of a colorist, the very talented Courtland Brugger. Beyond this and the printing costs (which we now know very well what to expect after "Odyssey" and the Image conclusion) and the actual campaign fees to Indiegogo, we need to make sure every base is covered.
  • We are definitely not asking for money to profit in any way, shape, or form – we are only looking for funds to continue commissioning Jim Lawson for the pages that remain, then see things through on the production side. In addition to helping bring to fruition this project contributing is also a big way to give back to a man who has given a great deal to TMNT as we know it today. 
  • Funds received will be going to Jim Lawson first and foremost to get the remaining pages pencilled and inked, then to our colorist, and then to cover the final cost of the printing and distribution which we need to not lose sight of. Rich Horn, who was a huge asset during "Odyssey"'s distribution, has also graciously agreed to help in all matters of that to ensure speedy delivery of the final product.
  • The greatest care will be taken in the final shipping of the printed books. Rich Horn at tmnt-ninjaturtles.com has been been doing this a long time and sends books out with high quality packaging.

The Risk

  • In the event this campaign is unsuccessful to meet its goal, if at least 50% of goal is met then it will still be full-steam ahead. This is a passion project and it will be seen through, the same as "Odyssey" and the Image TMNT finisher. Jim Lawson will continue to be commissioned, albeit at a slower pace. If less than 50% of the goal is reached, however, all funds will be returned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can’t contribute? You can help by getting the word out about our campaign, spreading the word about “Origin” and this Indiegogo page to other Turtle fans.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Short Summary

I'm David Orr. Under my Orogenic Industries name, I make art and design inspired by the vast awesomeness of prehistoric life! For years, I've created enamel pins, screen printed art, embroidered patches, stickers, tee shirts, and more to share my love of paleontology. These pins, featuring Tiktaalik and Lystrosaurus, have a timely message to inspire us to look back at the grand achievements of evolution, when our ancient ancestors explored new frontiers and persisted through disaster and cataclysm.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding goal has been set to be able to produce 100 each of each pin. They'll come carded and packed in sustainable shipping materials.

Stretch Goals!

If we meet the stretch goal of $1000, we will unlock embroidered patches of each design as well! Pledge levels for bundled pins and patches will offer additional savings.

The Impact

I create work for my own paleo-centered project Orogenic Industries as well as Blue Aster Studio, and with both projects, my goal is to spread the joy of science and nature. So with products like these pins, my greatest hope is that they allow my fellow science geeks a new way to spark conversations about the beauty of the natural world and the profundity of deep time. And I love creating pieces that shine a little light on the obscure, but no less wonderful, facets of life on Earth.

Risks & Challenges

This is a low-risk project! I have years of experience with design and production, and I've seen many projects like this through to completion. The designs are complete and production-ready. We just need some money to make them happen!

Of course, we are all dealing with a global pandemic, and that can have unexpected impacts on any industry. But I am working with trusted partners who are staying hard at work even through the COVID-19 crisis, and I will stay on top of any changes to production timelines as soon as I am aware of them!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like these pins and want to see them get made, but can't afford to pledge now, I still appreciate your support more than I can express. Spreading the word on social media makes a HUGE difference, and I'm grateful for every link you can tweet or plug on Facebook or Instagram.

story:
PULLPROOF Studio will be a fully equipped silkscreen printing facility, shared workspace, and storefront gallery at 5112 Penn Avenue in Garfield. Our mission is to provide affordable access to silkscreen printing equipment, space, and a community to artists in the Western Pennsylvania area. For a monthly fee, PULLPROOF members will have 24/7 access to our silkscreen printmaking facilities.

We’re committed to making the members of PULLPROOF Pittsburgh’s most exciting new collective of screenprinters. That’s why we need your help! We need to raise money to ensure that our members have consistent access to the best printmaking equipment at the lowest price. The more money we can raise, the more improvements we can make to our space, and the lower our membership costs can be. We've got tons of great print-related perks and more. Read on to learn more about our needs and what we're offering.

 

Our Team

We are a group of artists, activists, and designers based in the East End of Pittsburgh. Our backgrounds are varied - we grew up on the East Coast, West Coast, and right here in Pittsburgh. Our shared passion of silkscreen printing and desire for more artist-run spaces in our city created PULLPROOF. Between the five of us, we have the experience and work ethic to bring this studio to life successfully and quickly, with a little help from you. 

 

What We Need + What You Get
 



We've already found the perfect space at 5112 Penn Avenue in Garfield. Since we've rented the space in February, we've put a lot of work into the space by tearing up the carpet, scraping glue off the floors, re-painting the walls, and making the space shine. Now it's time to fill it up, and that's where we need your help. There are a handful of things that we still need, such as equipment, supplies, and labor. We'll break it down for you here: 

  • Plumbing ~$1000
  • Lumber Budget ~$3500 
  • Flat Files ~ $1200
  • Shop Computer ~ $2000 
  • Member Storage ~ $1000 
  • 24" Large Format Printer ~ $3500
  • Shared Member Supplies ~ $750
  • Silkscreen Equipment Essentials ~$3500
  • Miscellaneous Space Renovation Costs - $1500

We are excited to offer incentives to the donors of our campaign. Check out the perks in the right-hand column, which includes PULLPROOF Studio merchandise and prints by our members (Christina, Anna, Charlie, Aaron, and Matt).

If we surpass our goal, we will be able to purchase extra equipment that will elevate our space from functional to excellent, such as dehumidifiers, a storefront sign, new lighting, internet repeater, external hard drives, and more.

 

The Impact
 



It is crucial for artists to have to have facility access and space to make their work. While there are some great printmaking resources here in Pittsburgh, there are no studios that provide both 24/7 access and equipment necessary to emerging screenprinting artists. Our members will be able to use this space as their primary work place as artists, designers, and printmakers. Your support will enable PULLPROOF to become a hotbed of creative production and a contributor to Pittsburgh's art ecosystem through events, a learning space, and fellowship opportunities for our community.

 

Risks & Challenges



The biggest risk we face is not raising enough money. If our campaign does not raise the necessary funds, it will take us a lot longer to get PULLPROOF up-and-running in a way that’s financially sustainable in the long term. The more funds we can raise, the faster we can share this space’s full potential.

We’ve initiated this project because of our shared need for art-making space and desire to give back to our city. We’re excited about running this space and making it available to the arts community. We have a diverse set of collective arts and administration knowledge, and legal help for our contracts and business plans. The only thing we don't have is enough money to make this build out process speedy!

 

Other Ways You Can Help
 



If you can't contribute, that's okay. There are a couple of other easy ways to help:

  • Share our campaign: Invite friends who would be interested to contribute via e-mail and social media.
  • Follow PULLPROOF's progress: Sign up for our e-mail list and follow us on Instagram and Facebook.
  • Check out the space: Come visit us during a First Friday event! We'll have an open studio every month, with art by our members.
  • Become a member: If you are interested in joining PULLPROOF as a member, drop us a line!

 

FAQ
 

What is silkscreen printing?
Silkscreen printing is a printmaking technique in which an image is transferred into a stencil in a mesh screen, which can then be used to reproduce the stenciled image. The image can be anything: a marker drawing, a digital image, and painted brush stroke, as long is it is entirely opaque, and on a transparent surface. This silkscreen-ready image is called a transparency, film, or positive. The silkscreen itself is then coated in photo-emulsion, which is light sensitive. When the coated screen and the positive are exposed to a light source, the area blocked by the positive, which is your image, remains water-soluble, while the exposed areas of the screen are hardened. When you then rinse your screen with water, the area of your image washes out, leaving a stencil through which ink can pass. 

When will I receive my perk?
You will receive your gift in Fall 2018. We need enough time to set up the studio and settle in before we start making your art! Some perks may take a little longer to produce.  Please note that the colors and style of the pieces may vary.

Is shipping included in the Perk prices?
Shipping is not included in the Perk Prices. Larger artwork that ships flat will be packed nicely in thick foam core, which is a little expensive, but it's worth it to protect the print and keep it nice and flat. You'll also have an excellent place to store it, or a safe way to travel with it, say to a framer.

Can you ship internationally?
Yes, but we'll have to check out the shipping costs first, so please get in touch and we can arrange it!


I don't want any perks, I just want to donate!
If you'd like to contribute to our campaign without perks, click on the "Back It" button to the right of our video up top. You’ll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute, and choose your payment method.

 

Special Thanks


Legal Counsel
Eric Davis
